animal.description:
Meet Sandra

Sandra is a Catahoula mix, approximately 4yrs 11month old(June), approximately 47lbs(March), spayed, current on vaccinations, microchipped & house/crate trained. She is a dogs dog. Needs a another dog that will play with her. She is shy when meeting new people but once she warms up she loves to be very affectionate. Sandra is loves toys, active(but not in your face active), lap dog, playful & very goofy. She is learning her basic commands so far she knows; sit, outside, kennel, shake, stay, come & bed. She loves spending her time with her foster siblings & following her foster mom around the house. Sandra is also fine with her foster cat sibling. Please consider opening your heart & home to Sandra.

if you would like more information on this dog please contact Apaws at info@apawspets.org
if you would like to begin the adoption process and fill out an application please use our online application available here: http://www.apawspets.org/dog_application_display.php
if you cannot adopt or foster, but would like to donate to the rescue to help with the care of this dog and the others, please go to http://www.apawspets.org/donate.php

organization.name: Animal Protection And Welfare Society - APAWS

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.None of our foster dogs are tested with cats because we have no way of testing them with cats. Siberians are notorious for their high prey drive and typically kill cats, rabbits, chickens, birds, squirrels, opossums, etc., so we don't have much success adopting them out to homes with cats. Most of our foster dogs are with us for killing cats, chickens and goats to begin with so our assumption is they are not good with cats and other small things that move.

Siberians are typically good with children of all ages and the only reason we would not list them as not good with kids is because they may be too energetic and bouncy and knock over a toddler.

Southern Siberian Rescue is a volunteer based 501(c)3 organization based out of Raleigh, NC, so we do not have a physical facility with operating hours that you can visit to meet our dogs. All of our foster dogs are in our personal homes. You need to fill out our adoption application (http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption) and get approved to adopt and then we will set a time for you to meet our foster dogs. As a volunteer based group, we all have jobs, family, personal dogs and other commitments but we try to acknowledge and process applications as quickly as we can. That being said, we try to keep our available foster dogs as current as we can also but it is time consuming to get pics and information on new dogs so not all of our dogs are listed at all times. Please fill out our application and then we can discuss dogs that will work for you and your situation. We average 40-45 Siberians in our program so we are certain we have one that will work for you. Please know that we are not obligated to answer inquiries on dogs as we will focus on approved applicants. Again, there is ample time to discuss all of our foster dogs AFTER we have an approved application on file. We do adopt out of state as long as we can get a home check done. We ask that you, your family and existing pets make the trip to NC to meet and adopt our foster dogs.

SSR can not and will not hold dogs for anyone. If we do, that means another Siberian will die in a shelter because a shelter dogs time is very limited, as is our foster space. We do our best to process applications in the order received and first application gets first interest in our foster dog(s). We understand that there will be scheduling conflicts with home checks and meet and greets but we will try to accommodate for that if a potential adopter has interest in a particular foster dog in our program.

All Southern Siberian Rescue foster dogs are microchipped, up to date on shots, spay/neutered, on monthly heartworm preventative and flea and tick preventative. For additional information on Southern Siberian Rescue and Siberian Huskies, please visit www.SouthernSiberian.com.

To fill out an application, please visit http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption .

9/28/20 12:48 PM

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Personality: Nellie came to us completely matted and just a mess. The wooly coat requires much more grooming so she will need a home that understands that and gets her to the groomer. She is somewhat tolerant of brushing for short periods but if you try too long, she will snap at you. She is a happy, bouncy girl but can be the laziest sun bather and napper. She is cute as a button and will follow her people around but she does have a snappy side to her as well. She is startled by quick approaches and does not like to be led by her collar. You can leash her up just fine but she is untrusting if you try to lead her anywhere by her collar. She will put the brakes on and try to get away from you. Shortly after she came to us, she started having seizures. Her bloodwork is fine but her seizures lasted 4 plus minutes so she is now on phenobarb. She has not had another seizure since she has been on meds.

Energy Level: Low to Medium

Good with Dogs: Yes but only engages with a handful of dogs in her foster home.

Good with Children: Nellie can be a bit snappy sometimes so she will be best in a home with children 13 or older. She sometimes is freaked out by fast movements and might be anxious with young children and their exuberance.

animal.special_needs_notes: Sweet Rose has a heart murmur and an enlarged heart. She's on several medications that she will have to take for the rest of her life. While she shows no outward signs of her condition, Rose must be watched closely in hot temperatures. She's a very active, loving girl, and she can run and play with the best of them!

animal.description:
cocker spaniel mix femaleMAGGIE MAE-sponsor only
Maggie Mae is in need of sponsorship now! This 3 year old girl was part of a cruelty case that another rescue was helping in. The other rescue was not able to help Maggie Mae overcome some of her handling and fear issues and asked our rescue to see what we could do. Maggie Mae has bonded with her foster dad very very well and will let him do any handling he wants with her but now we are working on desensitizing her with everyone also in the world. Maggie Mae is sweet as pie and deserves a chance to overcome her issues that are a direct result of her former life. Please consider sponsoring Maggie during her recovery time. Please email office@rainbowrescues.org to set up a one time donation or monthly help for Maggie May's care. Thank you. 2/2/21 5:13 AM

animal.description: Timmy **** Timmy is part of our TLC program. Our TLC club members receive special follow-up help when adopted into their new home including visits with a professional behaviorist. Speak to our volunteers about more information regarding our TLC members.****4 year old male Catahoula mix that is good with people, not sure of kids or cats, basic potty trained, still has accidents.This little guy is very high energy. Still very puppyish.He is very shy when first meeting people but warms up after a little while, women quicker than men. He will need a home that will give him time to settle in, work on his socializing and give him lots of exercise. He is one of our TLC dogs, he will come with a session with a behaviorist to adjust to his new home. not good for apartments as he is a barker.Please note we do not have a central kennel facility, all of our pets are located in foster homes. The first step in meeting one of our furry friends is to fill out an application on our website at www.rainbowrescues.org. A volunteer will be in contact with you in 1-2 business days to review your application and speak with you about the adoption process. Our adoption fees at this time are $250 for Adult dogs, $300 for puppies (6 months and under), $100 for senior dogs, $100 for cats, and a $50 fee for small animals. **Please be aware that we are not responsible for inaccurate information on some cross-posted sites such as inaccurate adoption fees and inaccurate pet info.**

animal.description: Cookie**** Cookie is part of our TLC program. Our TLC club members receive special follow-up help when adopted into their new home including visits with a professional behaviorist. Speak to our volunteers about more information regarding our TLC members.**** 9 year old male Chihuahua, not good with children or cats, good with dogs, basic potty trainedCookie is looking for a quiet home that will give him lots of time to warm up to them. Cookie is a very nervous boy who was pulled from a hoarding situation where he got very little socialization. He is currently fostered with dogs and has done very well with them. Needs to be kept on a schedule for continued house training. He does like to chase cats so he would not do well in a home with cats. Cookie cannot go to a home with children as they will overwhelm him and it would set him up for failure in his road to recovery. Cookie tends to take better to women than men but has started to come up to his foster mother's brother. Cookie will need a very patient home that will not push him and give him all the time he needs to become comfortable with them. Once he is comfortable he is a sweet boy who will look for some love and attention on his terms. animal.description: Anndalina**** Anndalina is part of our TLC program. Our TLC club members receive special follow-up help when adopted into their new home including visits with a professional behaviorist. Speak to our volunteers about more information regarding our TLC members.****7 year old female, chi mix. black with white, no kids, okay with some dogs, basics of potty training. Needs fenced in yard and no apartments.Anndalina came to us as an emergency surrender. This poor girl was trying to chew her tail off and needed emergency treatment. We rushed her into our vet and it was determined her tail would need to be amputated to prevent any infection from spreading. This poor nervous girl was whisked into surgery and brought back to one of our foster homes. Anndalina has had a rough beginning to her life and she will need a patient and understanding home to help her become the dog we know she can be. We would recommend she go to a child free home and a home where her Chihuahua bark will not be a problem. A nice quiet couple or single person would be the ideal place for her as she can become overwhelmed with too many visitors. Once she bonds to her people she is very affectionate but it will take a while for this nervous girl to settle into any new home and she will need to be given time to calm and adjust. animal.description:
Thank you, for caring enough to consider adopting a rescued pup in need of love, respect and a warm place to lay it's head fur-ever.

This pup is in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until their adoptive person/family has been approved, and will then be ready for transport on the following Saturday(Saturday delivery ONLY).

Upon request, we will be happy to send you more videos and pictures of this pup interacting with her H4S buddies, to help you get a better understanding

of their personality and activity level, and how they interact with their people and other pups.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------CESAR(dob:10/26/2009 + weighs 40lbs)

was originally rescued from Rutherford County, NC's high-kill Animal Control

(on 12/28/2011)

by a long-time animal advocate + volunteer, who passed away leaving 14 dogs behind. Howlin4Spirit stepped up and took in 3 of her precious ones. CESAR was outside in a fenced-in area with

Snookie,

a very sweet overweight female RottieX, whom he had the pleasure of keeping company and helped protect Miss Pat(single senior) from anyone trying to come onto her property while walking to shop at Walmart. Cesar is neither scary nor aggressive, in any way. But, would prefer to be the only pup, or needs to be fed separately...we can only assume that Snookie was a big eater and may have been a little 'piggie' and so Cesar is used to having to secure his own bowl. In every other way, they made a good team. He gets along well with Howlin4Spirit's friendly and spirited 45+ dogs running freely on 5+ fenced-in acres, daily. He is a DEVOTED COMPANION, when his nose isn't glued to the ground. NOT to be mistaken for a 'yard ornament' nor laundry room occupant! He LOVES to be with his person, eat, sleep and follow his person around while doing all outdoor chores, laundry, cooking, following his nose to seek out critters, taking walks in the woods, etc. He gets along well with other dogs and cats, but prefers being one of 1, 2 or 3, at most. He needs his person to take time to love on him, sit quietly with him in the woods on their morning walks and on the couch in the evenings. He will be by your side the entire way!

EXTREMELY HAPPY disposition, DEVOTED to his person, and LOVES the outdoors!

He would NOT do well in an apartment, as he is typical beagle and an avid hunter/explorer.

Therefore, we are seeking to rehome Cesar in a home with a secured fenced-in yard

. We will not be accepting any applications where there are children under the age of 10yo living in the home.

We are SEEKING to place Cesar, PREFERABLY, in a home with an active retiree OR work-from-home MAN OR WOMAN 45>60yo. CESAR is 11yo and deserves a devoted person who will be there for him, who is able to fill his life with love, respect and companionship, NOT just someone to come home to when the work day or when party is over. HE DESERVES MUCH MORE than the precarious situation he was rescued from!

Adoption fee: $95 include neuter, micro-chip, Parvo-Distemper-Lepto & Bordatella and 3yr Rabies vaccination, parasite-
free, current on monthly heart worm and flea/tick prevention, Martingale collar and 6' leash & current health certificate (issued within 4days prior to transport).

Where there is a scent hound or guardian breed being considered for adoption, & in homes where older respectful children reside or will be visiting, a secured(not electric) fenced-in yard is required.

All potential adopters are required to be at least 25 yrs old and complete the application below, at your earliest convenience, to help secure the

pup of your choice.

Upon receipt of your application, we will acknowledge your application in an email and immediately send out a questionnaire to your 3 personal references.

To help your chances of adopting the pup of your 1st choice, be sure to contact/ask all references to reply at their most earliest convenience. Also, give your vet's office permission to release your information to Howlin4Spirit. We will be contacting everyone within 2 business days.

Upon approval of this adoption, & to hold the dog/pup of your choice, we require the pup's adoption fee to be sent to our secure PayPal.com acct at: howlin4spirit@gmail.com

Upon receipt of the adoption fee, we will send you the adoption contract and all pertinent information you will need to be ready for your pup's arrival, and reserve your pup's space on LIFESAVERS Rescued Pet Transport's next available transport(SATURDAY delivery ONLY). Their transport fee is $125

to all points as far N as Vince Lombardi svc plaza/NJTnpk mm115,

and $140 to all points N of NYC as far as BurlingtonVT & Albany, NY, to be paid by the adopter to the transport service.

Upon request, we will be happy to send you more videos and pictures of this pup interacting with her H4S buddies, to help you get a better understanding

of their personality and activity level, and how they interact with their people and other pups.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------CESAR(dob:10/26/2009 + weighs 40lbs)

was originally rescued from Rutherford County, NC's high-kill Animal Control

(on 12/28/2011)

by a long-time animal advocate + volunteer, who passed away leaving 14 dogs behind. Howlin4Spirit stepped up and took in 3 of her precious ones. CESAR was outside in a fenced-in area with

Snookie,

a very sweet overweight female RottieX, whom he had the pleasure of keeping company and helped protect Miss Pat(single senior) from anyone trying to come onto her property while walking to shop at Walmart. Cesar is neither scary nor aggressive, in any way. But, would prefer to be the only pup, or needs to be fed separately...we can only assume that Snookie was a big eater and may have been a little 'piggie' and so Cesar is used to having to secure his own bowl. In every other way, they made a good team. He gets along well with Howlin4Spirit's friendly and spirited 45+ dogs running freely on 5+ fenced-in acres, daily. He is a DEVOTED COMPANION, when his nose isn't glued to the ground. NOT to be mistaken for a 'yard ornament' nor laundry room occupant! He LOVES to be with his person, eat, sleep and follow his person around while doing all outdoor chores, laundry, cooking, following his nose to seek out critters, taking walks in the woods, etc. He gets along well with other dogs and cats, but prefers being one of 1, 2 or 3, at most. He needs his person to take time to love on him, sit quietly with him in the woods on their morning walks and on the couch in the evenings. He will be by your side the entire way!

animal.description:
BOLT is a vibrant (as you can see) energetic young huksy ( not older than 1-1/2 yrs) He is PERSONALITY PLUS..He is great with people but it was reported from the public shelter he did not do well with other dogs. He was recently neutered while in our custody so we will report back once he has been tested with other dogs now neutered. 
QUES?
EMAIL: huskyhavenofla@hotmail.com

GNERL INFO re all dogs listed:
For more info contact our email add stated just above 
WE are hard to reach by phone due to our work load
We make appoint to meet AFTER receiving and completing the application process NOT before.
There is helpful info on our website: huskyhavenofla.org- BUT it is outdated with some info We do not have funds to complete  a new website
The adopt fee stated is VERY old: Our current adopt fee for adults is bet $245 and $285 
Everything is done: all vaccines/spay o r neuter/microchip/evaluation. If vet intervention was needed, this info will be provided as well 
PLUS 30 dys FREE vet insurance and access to continue vet insurance at VERY low cost 
Most dogs have videos and "clicking" on the video link ( the little film icon) is helpful to learn more.. 

PLS DO NOT submit an application if you are NOT ready to adopt within the next 2 wks. 

If any of the following LIST applies to you pls EMAIL first BEFORE applying so we can give you addl info:

If you have a sml dog weighing less than 35 lbs
If you have a cat or cats
If your current fencing is NOT min 6 foot all the way around including the gates
(Some of the dogs are ok with 5 foot but NOTHING less)
If you have an inground swimming pool NOT safely fenced off 
If the location you are residing at is your parents home
If you are a renter, we REQUIRE WRITTEN landlord approval
PLS make sure you have asked if there are restrictions re the breed or size or weight for your complex.

animal.description:
Why is my name, TEDDY?
Because everyone loves a TEDDY BEAR!

*Volunteer Favorite
*Fun Personality
*Will Wear PJs if he has to
*Crate Trained
*House Trained
*Loves to Chase Balls
*Loves to Cuddle
*Does Well With Other Nice Dogs


I am a loyal and loving pittie mix that is just a happy go-lucky lug of a guy.   I am crate and house trained and will take food gently from your finger tips. I love to play, and chasing balls is my favorite activity. I like it inside and outside the house. I will lay in the sun then wait patiently at the door for my owner to let me in. I love to relax with my nose touching my owner. I'm still a little young and goofy. I like people and other dogs.

Teddy is an American Staffordshire Terrier mix, weighs approx 70 pounds, has an estimated DOB of 6/2013.  He is neutered, microchipped, HW negative, kept on monthly Heart Worm and Flea Prevents, and is up to date on his vaccinations.

For more information on our adoption process, please visit our website at www.youluckydogrescue.org and read our Adoption FAQ's and Before You Adopt documents. In addition you can complete an online adoption application from our website. You can also email info@youluckydogrescue.org for additional details.  

Our adoption fee is $300 and includes all age appropriate vaccines, spay  or neuter and microchipping.  The breed and age included in this listing is based upon the opinion of a vet that has examined the dog.  We cannot confirm the age of the dog unless the dog was born in the care of the rescue.  We are located in the metro Atlanta area.   We currently do not allow out of state adoptions as a home check is required as part of the adoption process.

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

If you would like to take me home please complete a Pet Adoption Application

male. 50 lbs. click name to read moreA PRE-APPROVED application is required to meet Lucky. BY APPOINTMENT ONLY

Background: Surrender

Personality: Slow intros but once bonded..loves his people

Cats: No

Dogs: Compatible females

Kids: No, adults only (not even visiting kids)

Energy Level: High

Housebroken: working on it

Crate Trained : Yes

Prey for Wildlife(no invisible fence if high) High

Fence required: Yes

Best home for this Pet: Lucky has had to adapt to a lot of change in his life. He has done so successfully but will need to be with someone who will give him the time and patience he needs to bond, so that he will be able to adapt again. He should have a calm low traffic home. He really loves one on one time with his people, is very food motivated and loves to go on walks around the lake.

Lucky will require multiple meets(by appt only)

We do our best to get to know each and every dog at our camp. Their personalities emerge after being with us for a bit and sometimes change. The personality and other information included in the above description is based on what we know currently in the shelter environment. All dogs are up to date on vaccines (Distemper, Rabies, Bordetella), microchipped, spayed/neutered and receive worming, flea & tick medication before they are adopted out. Please note there are some exceptions depending on the condition of the dog. If you are interested in this dog please fill out an online application at https://www.camppapillon.org/dog-application.

Once your dog is in your home, they will adjust and relax and could become more playful or show more personality traits as they begin to open up. Once adopted, please allow your dog time to decompress and relax in a stable home environment.

animal.breeds_label: Australian Shepherd & Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler Mix
animal.description:
Eddy is a herding dog enthusiast's delight. He appears to be a mix of Australian Shepherd and Australian Cattle Dog, which is known as a 'Texas heeler'. He is bred merle to merle, resulting in deafness.
He's a handsome and unique looking boy who is affectionate, loves to sit for cookies. He hails from the Apple Valley shelter, picked up as a stray. He's very affectionate, and he's a pretty gentle boy. He has a unique temperament. Eddie's kind of on his own planet. We find his quirkiness to be really endearing and he's grateful for every minute of attention. He's an unshakably happy and calm boy.
Eddie came from the shelter with a rash that turned out to be a nasty staph infection. It spread like wildfire and he lost most of his coat. The infection is finally gone after treating it several times, leaving Eddie with a thin coat. He takes a very inexpensive supplement to help with his coat.
To meet Eddie, please complete our on-line adoption application:
http://www.deafdogrescueofamerica.org/adoption-application.html

Please note that we are unable to respond to inquiries, emails or phone calls. Our adoption process starts with completion/submission of an application for adoption. All applications are reviewed as quickly as we can, and our adoption process is not first come, first served. We select our adoptive homes according to what our dogs/puppies require. If you are selected as an appropriate match, you will be contacted to set an appointment to visit the Ranch and meet Eddie.

animal.breeds_label: American Staffordshire Terrier & Labrador Retriever Mix
animal.description: "Hi I'm Teddy! My family disappeared and I was left alone in a trailer with two other dogs. We were locked in a tiny room together and food was running out. My new family (A.S.K.) saved me at the request of my former family who had bailed. They gave me a chance even though I had a "grumpy dog" face on a lot. I was just scared, and missing my Dad. I have learned to believe in the power of kind people! All people are good people. I don't love sharing people with other dogs though. I can do it, but I am be a little bossy over my food or toys. I would be happiest as a single dog. I have average energy level and am used to going with the flow. I walk well and am house-trained. I have one "issue" that they say makes me "special needs." My skin is sensitive. I have to be managed on steroids or another drug lifelong. It's not a big deal. My people say it's affordable, and I'm worth it. A.S.K. can tell you more. Please come meet me in Battle Creek, Michigan! I deserve to finally find love again! Please private message us at www.facebook.com/allspecieskinship for questions! To be considered for adoption, complete the adoption inquiry here: http://allspecieskinship.org/dog-adoption-survey/ If you are unable to complete the inquiry online, call to have a copy mailed or read to you: 877-596-7776

animal.description:
Baci is the dog companion for the outdoor enthusiast who prefers hikes or jogs instead of walks or for the person who looks for a reason to be outside in the garden or yard in any season.  Baci is a 17 month, 32 lb. short hair neutered male who is housebroken, crate trained, microchipped and up to date on all vaccinations.  He was rescued as a young puppy from Puerto Rico and selected for our hearing dog program.  Baci is an extremely quick learner and has a drive/need to be busy with ball retrieving, a frisbee toss or just being a constant, attentive companion.  He rates the highest score on our intelligence scale however, unfortunately, he is too active for the passive behaviors required of an assistance dog.  He is not the laid back family dog personality that is usually the description of our release dogs.  Baci is extremely loyal and bonds strongly to those he trusts.  He may bark or be aloof to strangers which may appear to be protective, but a dog treat or ball toss wins him over quickly.
Baci has won our hearts with his loyalty and zest for life.  He is so special in his own unique way.  His adoption fee is $400.00. If interested, please email Sue Berry at sberry@neads.org (no calls will be accepted).

animal.description:
GOOD NEWS! FOR THE MONTH OF NOVEMBER STELLA AND CHEWY'S PET FOOD WITH REIMBURSE THE ADOPTION FEE FOR NEW OWNERS OF SENIOR DOGS!

I am a sweet senior guy, I was born November 7, 2012. I love spending time with my foster family and resident dogs, I even like the young foster puppies. I get along with most dogs and would be most happy living with another one. I also require a single family home. NO invisible fences for me! Oh yeah, I like to chase cats. I have a high prey drive, squirrels and bunnies are fun to chase and bark at. Babies and young kids kind of scare me, I need a home without kids younger than 13. 

I love to play fetch! Ball is my favorite game. I like to fetch sticks that are tossed in the lake too! I love to snuggle on the couch with my people, that’s my very favorite thing. I am what you call a Velcro dog; wherever my foster mom goes, I follow. 

I do have some anxiety. I am on 2 different daily anxiety meds, they are very affordable. I also have prescription dog food for my sensitive digestive tract. This is managed by eating my prescription food and treats with no table scrapes. I get a little nervous when meeting new people. It can take a few minutes and some of my dog food to warm up to people I don’t know. I’ll also warm up if you throw the ball for me! I have a loud bark, that sometimes scares people, it’s just how I bark. I don’t want to scare anyone, I just get so excited!  

Adoption fee is $425 plus tax. Please email us at info@actvrescue.org. Inquiries with in 1 hour of downtown Minneapolis. Looking forward to hearing from you!

animal.description:
Hi ya. So happy you’ve found my page! I’m Travis Harris and it’s great to meet you. I’m looking for a new family to call my own! Could it be you?
Here’s my stats:
Possible Breed: Maybe Lhasa Apso and Shih Tzu
Gender:  I’m a boy 
Colors: White with a little light brown
Age:  I’m about 8 ears old
Weight: about 24 pounds
My Perfect home: I would prefer to be an only dog.

Now for the good stuff!-
I am an independent boy.  When outside with other dogs I like to stand on the side lines and watch them play.  When I first came to Lone Star, I sometimes showed Lhasa-tude. I would be a little growly/snappy if I didn’t like something. Now I’m getting better and better as I learn new manners from firm but loving people. I would do best in a home with teenagers and above. I don’t have any known medical issues

To start the process of adopting me or one of the other pups by filling out the application found at www.shihtzu-rescue.com. 
PS. I've had ALL my vetting, and oh boy, it was a lot. Here's what I had done:
Distemper/Parvo shots – TWICE. One shot doesn't cut it.
Bordetella shots - ALSO TWICE. 
Spay/Neuter-of course.
A fecal exam so I don't have any bad worms. Treatment if I do.
A heartworm test. Treatment if I am positive for heart worms
BLOODWORK to make sure my liver and kidneys are working well, because you know, we doggies often have issues in the liver and kidneys.
A DENTAL exam AND cleaning if I needed it- yep, all my toofies are checked out.
See, that's a LOT. Ask your vet - that's a LOT.
animal.name: Travis Harris Turner

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Bailey once had a family and she adored them. But then they dumped her at a high kill shelter in NYC. She was on death row and terrified.

What Bailey didn't know was that she had a Guardian Angel watching over her. This angel went and got her from NYC - he had to save this poor girl. He contacted us and we agreed that we had to help her!

Bailey is an itty bitty Boston pitty - she's super fun and also a HUGE snuggler. Bailey loves people more than anything. She just wants to be close and feel their touch.

Bailey cannot live with dogs or small children (they make her very nervous). She chases cats but can live with them. There is a catch-- she needs very slow introductions over a period of time (using gates for separation and no contact unless cat or Bailey is crated so they can sniff but also be safe while doing so) This enables her to get to know the cat just like people get to know each other! It can take anywhere from 1-2 months, but then she is fine and will even snuggle with a kitty!

This girl needs a calm, stable environment. Bailey's ideal family will be active, able to handle her high energy and administer structure to help her be her best. She has anxiety so being active will truly help with that and it will allow her people to bond with her.

Please submit an application if you are interested in her. Bailey is a perfect addition to any home!

**Beauty of Bailey captured by Marlee and Me 716**

**Bailey's adoption fee has been sponsored by a generous volunteer**

**Please note we do not adopt to Canada due to border issues and breed specific legislation.Adoption donation includes Spay/Neuter, UTD on Vaccinations, deworming, and flea treatment.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website. Gatsby has been with Bobbie's since 2015 and had very little interest. He is a very effectionate boy, listens very well to commands, is eager to please his humans and does get along with calm submissive dogs. Gatsby is a very happy guy who loves to run, carry around his toys and play fetch with a ball. Oh let me re-phrase that, he is a ball fanatic!Gatsby enjoys being in the company of his 'humans' and really enjoys extended cuddle sessions on the couch.
Gatsby is house and crate trained and rides very well in the car.
Gatsby is a little bit too interested in cats, so we recommend a home without them. Gatsby is walking nicely on the leash but will get excited when he sees other dogs during walks which should be easily controlled with some professional training. Gatsby does guard his food and is used to eat his meals in his crate without a problem. He automatically runs into his crate when it is feeding time, sits and waits until it is his turn. Due to his size and energy level we recommend children 6 and up. Please consider giving this gorgeous golden-eyed boy a forever home. He has been waiting for so long and deserves a chance.

animal.description:
Meet KOBE! He is a 5 year old Mastiff/Staffordshire terrier mix.  We rescued Kobe from the South LA Shelter over three years ago and he has been waiting for the right person to come along and take him home. 

Kobe is very strong, but gentle and sweet as well. Due to his size and strength we believe he would do well with an experienced dog owner with strong leadership skills and be an only dog. He is looking to please that "one and only" human. Kobe knows basic commands and walks very well on leash...unless he sees a cat or small dog. Because of this we think we would do best in a home vs apartment setting.  If you adopt Kobe, he comes with 6 months of weekly training sessions at our kennel plus two weeks of boarding. 

Kobe has worked on and off with obedience training and one of his trainers said "I've been working with Kobe for a few months now, and he is always happy to see me and always ready for some fun together. We have been working on leash manners and he does very nicely (unless there is a stray cat lurking about and we have been working on leaving those alone too.) Kobe enjoys going to the park and watching all of the kids, bikes, dogs and horses that go by with ease. He knows all of his commands like; sit, down, stay, focus, and is working on rollover! He's easy to get in and out of the car and is an excellent passenger. I really can't say enough great things about this big hunk, he has the looks and the personality and would be a great dog to snuggle with on the couch. Yesterday Kobe worked on walking nicely by distractions, ie bikes, remote cars, drones, horses, goats, dogs, kids playing soccer etc. We worked on down, stay, and learned rollover (which is more rub my belly ?). He was great getting in and out of my car and sat nicely outside Starbucks and had a puppachino with a lot of stuff going on around him.

SEE KOBE DEMONSTRATE HIS TRAINING: https://youtu.be/xOj8fn7o6Cw

If you are interested in KOBE and live in the LOS ANGELES AREA, please fill out our brief online questionnaire (copy and paste link): www.downtowndogrescue.org/adoption-questionnaire

Additional Downtown Dog Rescue information email: adopt@downtowndogrescue.org or call: 818-407-4145

Belle is affectionate, playful, loves to snuggle, and is housebroken. Belle has played with several other dogs and has walked well with them, too. She lived with a small dog and with a young child. animal.description:
I Am One of the Max Collection!Tabitha was born about April 1, 2013 and weighs a bit too much at about 90 lbs. This girl is very proud of her curves and when her favorite human has been gone for a few hours she does the most delightful, bouncy, dance that we've ever seen! She is absolutely adorable and has been very good with all of us, but terribly shy at first. She is good with other dogs, fine in the car and on leash. This gorgeous girl has been tossed away and will be so thankful for a new home where she will be cherished! She was left at a shelter when her babies were two days old, guess she became an inconvenience. She was terrified for herself and her infants when we loaded them up to come here just a couple of days later. She was a very good Mom, surmounted the stress and kept taking care of her babies who grew to be strong and healthy and now she is looking for a new home that will love her unconditionally! It is obvious that Tabitha has not always been treated well by humans and she is terrified of being touched by new humans and she is terrified of new places. She will take much time and effort to adjust to a new life, but she is a really wonderful, loving, girl once comfortable. Due to her fears she truly must have a fenced in yard. Tabitha is too interested in cats to live with any.
Adoptions fees vary based on adoptability. In general our fees include spay/neuter, all age appropriate vaccines, Home Again micro-chipping & registration, worming & flea control - a 'complete' pet.
Joyful Rescues has no funding except for our adoption fees and miscellaneous donations. Pet care and vet bills are expensive - you must be ready to take on this financial (as well as emotional) responsibility. YOU MUST BE AT LEAST 25 YEARS OF AGE TO ADOPT A DOG FROM JOYFUL RESCUES

We keep our pet list as up-to-date as possible. As soon as a pet is adopted, it is removed from the list. If a pet is still showing, it is still available for adoption.

Can't Adopt Me? SPONSOR ME
Look for the Link 'Special Instructions to Seller' if you want to note a particular pet
Before you seek to adopt a pet from Joyful Rescues, please read our Pet Adoption page http://www.joyfulrescues.org/pet_adoption.html.

Online Application

animal.description:
If you are interested in adopting this dog, please download and complete an Adoption Questionnaire: http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/s/2016applicationdocx-1.docx and email Elizabeth at elizabethg@k-9lifesavers.org
You can also find the adoption questionnaire and learn about the adoption process by visiting our website: http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/howtoadopt/
Dog's Name: Cricket
Estimated Breed : Bulldog mix
Approximate Age: 5 yrs
Approximate Weight: ~45 lbs ?
Currently Living at: Foster home! Other dogs are not so lucky, have you considered fostering?
Adoption Fee: $300
DOG'S DESCRIPTION:
Take a look at Cricket! This cute gal is looking for a new home...she's super sweet and good with people once she trusts them and other dogs. Cricket will do well with a patient adopter willing to give her time to adjust.
Cricket is a quirky girl, she isn't a super outgoing & she is very shy, but she makes up for it in the most affectionate ways. She must go to a home with another dog. Another dog will show her that people are okay and will show her the ropes of a new home. Cricket has been living in a foster home with a family, multiple dogs and a cat. Cricket is a great couch cuddler and her favorite place is sitting under the table waiting for her tiny human to drop some food! Can you give Cricket a forever home? Email us & talk to her foster mom for more information.
Your new pet will require a refresher in house-training. K-9 Lifesavers strongly recommends all new adopters enroll their new pet into obedience training. This provides for an easier transition into a new home, ensures the dog remains well socialized, and helps form a bond between the dog and the new family.
Adoption fees cover basic vetting, spay/neuter surgery (for dogs over 6 months old), rabies, distemper/parvo vaccinations, treatment for worms, heartworm testing, monthly heartworm prevention and monthly flea/tick prevention (while the animal is in our care), and transport costs from high-kill shelter. Please note that on average, K-9 Lifesavers spend significantly more on each dog than their adoption fee. Adoption fee for HW positive dog also covers heartworm treatment at our partner vets.
Foster Program: Foster homes provide for the temporary care of a rescue until the dog is placed into a loving, forever home. For more information on becoming a foster parent, and our Foster Program, visit http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/foster/ or email our Foster Coordinator at foster@k-9lifesavers.org
Help Save Lives! Make a tax-deductible donation today by clicking on the Donate Button below! Donations help us offset boarding costs and additional medical treatment for those dogs who need it. K-9 Lifesavers receives NO federal funding and we are non-profit, all-volunteer run rescue. ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE.
For more information on K-9 Lifesavers, or to view a complete listing of all our Adoptable Dogs, visit our website at www.k-9lifesavers.org.
Please "like" our Facebook Page for the most current events and new dogs.
Thank you for considering a rescue dog!
SPONSOR ME!
Please donate towards my care and medical expenses here:
http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/donate/ 2/2/21 6:06 PM

animal.description:
IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING CHLOE, PLEASE GO TO THE MAKE A DIFFERENCE RESCUE FACEBOOK PAGE AND SEND A PRIVATE MESSAGE THAT INCLUDES YOUR PHONE NUMBER AND EMAIL ADDRESS.


Hi everyone. Hope everyone is having a good day. I know I am. My previous life was not that great. I had several litters of puppies and was dumped at a kill shelter. I am a very lucky girl because Make A Difference Rescue saved me. Unfortunately I have been patiently waiting for 3 years for my forever family to find me. The volunteers give me lots of love, but it is not the same as my very own family.

Let me tell you a little more about myself. I am a 6 year old American Bulldog mix. I was found to be heartworm positive and I received treatment. I am now heartworm negative. I do need to have a Heartguard once a month for the rest of my life. NO DOGS OR CATS!! I absolutely love being around people!! I love to play and swim in kiddie pools. I am a champion at taking the stuffing out of toys. I love bones with peanut butter in them too. I would do best with children 10 years old or older. My forever home needs to have a fenced yard where I can safely run and play. I am spayed, on heartworm preventative as well as house and crate trained. The volunteers cannot believe I have not been adopted yet. Are you my forever family??

All dogs we rescue stay with us until they find their forever homes. We do not do same day adoptions. A home visit is required to ensure our dog is going to a safe environment and our dog gets along with your dog(s) and/or cat(s). We require all our dogs over the age of 1 year attend 1 obedience class (6 week session) outside the home. You must live within 1 hour of Birmingham, MI to adopt one of our dogs. No out of state or outside the U.S. adoptions or fosters. My adoption fee is $275.

animal.description:
Adoption fee on this dog is $300.

		Moses is a Handsome 8 yo Black and Tan male weighing 80 lbs.  He was originally found as a stray when he first arrived to us 3 years ago. While we do not know much about his early past, he was returned to us after living with a family for 3 years due to a change in job location.  As always, Moses remains very social and curious.  Like many dogs, he displays moments of hesitation with some new experiences, however he will eagerly join you with positive and confident leadership.  Due to years of living outdoors, he used to avoid all tile/linoleum floors. Happily, this has been completely overcome.  In fact, Moses finds the indoors to be his preferred sanctuary where he often may entice play even on slippery surfaces.

		This boy is amazingly game for any activity you have to offer whether a walk in the neighborhood, an adventure in the car, or retrieving a bouncing ball. In fact, his love of balls makes us wonder if he is part Labrador retriever! (Of note, this boy can destroy a bagful of tennis balls in record time. Supervision is necessary to prevent him from getting pieces lodged in his teeth!).  

		Moses has developed excellent house manners.  He sleeps in a roomy crate at night, and is accustomed to staying alone long hours while his foster mom is at work.  He greets all dogs well, both large and small, however he may become rather rough in play.  Supervision and guidance is important while he is around other dogs to manage his arousal.  On occasion, he reverts to an adolescent with bouts of impatience and a grumble protest.  With calm patience and commitment to carry through, he will quickly learn to trust your direction.  Despite bursts of this boyhood rambunctious nature, he is very affectionate with low to medium energy, and rests very well in the home.  While he has enjoyed life with other foster dogs, he will do well as an only dog who can adapt to a wide range of human activity, including the company of calm older children.  

Moses has osteoarthritis [of his elbows, back, and hips], and will require daily inexpensive anti-inflammatory medications. Moses has had bladder stones in the past and at this time is not on a prescription diet which helped to resolve his bladder stones.  Consistent hydration will be important in his daily diet for this reason.  

		Cats & small critters unknown.

This dog is a Level 3. Please be sure you understand what a dog of this Level requires. Go to our home page for an explanation of the Dog Rating Levels.


For more information and to see when this dog will be attending an Adoption Day, please see our Dogs page on our main website at www.gcgsr.org. 

We operate within a reasonable driving distance from the Greater Sacramento area, the 	Central Valley down to Merced, and Lake Tahoe. A reasonable driving distance is determined by where one of our volunteers is willing to drive within our areas of service. That means we don't adopt out of our area, to Southern California, or Out of State. 


Thank you for visiting!

animal.description:
Passion 4 Paws is looking for new foster homes in Chittenden County and surrounding areas! We save dogs from shelters in the south and need foster homes in the north for our dogs until they get adopted. The more foster homes we have, the more dogs we can save! Please consider giving this short term rewarding commitment a try. Foster as often or as little as you'd like. We supply any vet care needed and support to our foster homes, you supply the food and the love. Please contact us today to find out more! Visit our website to complete a foster application www.Passion-4-Paws.org

Disclosure:

Breed labels are often incorrect: we rarely know the genetic lineage of the dogs we rescue. Many shelters and rescues specify breeds based on appearance; however, research has shown that less than 2% of a dog's DNA determines appearance!

Passion 4 Paws does not practice the use of labels pertaining to compatibility with others or dog breed. Labels such as "dog friendly" and "child friendly" should be used with caution as they often over-simplify the personalities and behavior of dogs.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi! It's me, BlackJack! My picture caught your eye, huh? And you just had to read up to find out more about meI'm not surprised, my foster mom tells me all the time how cute I am! So, here is a little bit about me: I'm about 5 years old and I've been with Diamonds in the Ruff for a REALLY long time now. Don't get me wrong, I've been doing great in my foster home, but I'd really like to find my forever home and get settled in. Everyone tells me that it takes longer when you're like me - a black pittie. I don't know why, but that's just the way it is. But I'm not worried, my perfect family is out there.

When I dream about my perfect home, I see a quiet place where my humans have a routine that they follow most days. I'm not a big fan of surprises, so routine is good; that way, I know what to expect and what is expected of me. I want to make my humans happy, but they need to be able to tell me what to do and tell me when I'm doing something I'm not supposed to. My perfect family would be made up of older humans. Like I mentioned, I don't like surprises and sometimes young kids are just too much for me to figure out. My favorite things in the whole world are going for walks and going for rides in the car!! It's so much fun to explore! I walk nicely on my leash and I am a perfect gentleman in the car.

I enjoy being around other dogs, but I don't necessarily have to have a furry brother or sister to be happy. I'm quite happy to have all the attention of my humans all to myself. I don't like cats, though. YUCK!

I would like a home where I can get a medium amount of activity. I've gone running with my foster mom and that's fun, but I also like to be lazy and just cuddle up on the couch next to my humans. Of course, I am house-trained, crate-trained, up to date on my shots, and microchipped. Now that you know a little bit more about me, I know you'll want to meet me and get to know me even better! All you have to do is contact Diamonds in the Ruff, fill out an application, and set up a time for us to meet! You know you want to!!

**Please note we do not adopt to Canada due to border issues and breed specific legislation.Adoption donation includes Spay/Neuter, UTD on Vaccinations, deworming, and flea treatment. 2/2/21 10:16 AM

animal.description:
Thank you for your interest in dog who needs a new home. Adoption can be one of the most fulfilling experiences in your life and especially in the life of your new canine companion.

A note to those looking at CPR. We have no perfect dogs - but many of our dogs have proven to be perfect for a certain someone. Our job is to find those someone's. Our most successful adopters come to CPR not because they want a dog. They come to us because they want to give a dog a home. We urge all of our potential adopters not to fall in love with a picture. While we like to know what you like in looks, a dog is more than a pretty face. Our goal is to match you with the best possible pet for you and your home. We want to create furever families.

Our descriptions contain all that we know about this dog today. We'll update as more information is known.

Are you looking to adopt within the next 30 days? If so please visit our webpage at www.carolinapoodlerescue.org and complete the application. You'll find it in the menu on the left hand side. You'll also find a total listing of all our dogs available.

Just browsing but interested in poodles and poodle mixes? Please drop a note to applications@carolinapoodlerescue.org with your name, address and phone # and email. We'll add you to our mailing list.

thanks
the CPR Adoption team

Hi, I'm Charlie and I love everybody with 2 legs!Date into Rescue: 5/2/2017

Reason for being in rescue: Owner release/health of the owner
Foster location: Dreamweaver Farms, Pacolet SC
Special Needs? none needed
Weight: About 45 lbs
Height: est 22" at the shoulder
Spayed/Neutered: Yes

Adoption Fee: $200

Fence needed? Yes

What kind of home would be best for me? I need a home with no other smaller animals, and where I can be loved of course!

What is my personality like? He is a whole lot of dog. His owner did tell us that he has had problems with other dogs, especially little dogs, so we have not tested him with others nose to nose. This can be done on request but Charlie is so people focused we'd really like to find him a home as an only dog. Note that dogs can walk by his crate all day or he can be with other dogs with a fence between them with no issues at all. Dogs who want to be only dogs are rare. He is an ideal candidate for someone who only wants one dog. Charlie is physically very strong! He pulls on his leash and for some reason has an obsession with the shower in the kennel because if given the chance he runs straight for it. We don't have a pool but I'd love to see this water loving dog doing some hiking where he can splash in the creeks.

How do I act when I first meet new people? Friendly.

Other tips and tidbits: Estimated Birthdate: 5/3/2014. Charlie doesn't know basic commands but he is learning he has to sit for his treats. I think he will be a fast learner. He would need a fence. He is very friendly with the adults in our kennel but has not been tested with kids. On our walk he kept his nose to the ground and was full speed ahead! He didn't bark when meeting new people and was perfectly okay with them approaching him to love on him.

UPDATE 1/30/2018: Charlie truly lives to please people. His whole world begins and ends with humans. As soon as you walk into the kennel and make eye contact with him his tail immediatly starts to wag and he does his happy dance. This boy is not hard to win over what so ever, and he will surly be after your own heart! Since being here we have learned that Charlie DOES NOT like other dogs. He would prefer to be the only pet. He has learned to sit, to go in his crate, give shakes, and to go straight to the door when being let out. Charlie is easily trainable due to him just wanting to please you. Just like any other young lab he loves tennis balls and really really loves being let out into the bigger field we have, he loves to get his exercise!

House trained? Dogs can be house trained if they are in the right environment and are allowed to follow a schedule as long as a physical reason doesn't keep them from being trained. A dog house trained in my home may not be in yours. We will help you teach your new dog this necessary skill and based on your schedule.

Please note - we do not ship dogs. If you are interested in adopting, please take a look at the distance between the foster home location and your location and make sure you are willing to make that trip. Most of our dogs are at our farm in Pacolet, South Carolina.

To apply, please visit our webpage at www.carolinapoodlerescue.org and visit the tab on the left that directions you to the online application.

Please note that when screening applications, we look at the entire home and then make suggestions based on what would be a good fit for your home. You are not being screened for a specific dog although we are looking to see what type of dog interests you - poodles or non poodles, color, age, etc. Others here may be a better fit for you. It is very difficult to get to know a living animal from a picture and a short description. Since we are constantly getting in new dogs, this may be a dog not in our listings yet. We want you to be very happy with your new companion and will make suggestions based on what you tell us about you.

Thank you for considering CPR.

animal.description:
MEET TAYLOR!

Taylor is a 3.5 year old, 50 lbs, Black Mouth Cur/Boxer/Terrier mix who was transferred to Charley's Strays from another Maine shelter.  Taylor has a hard time in a cage which is the reason he came to our shelter, as our dogs have little "kennel" in comparison to traditional shelters.

He is protective in his kennel but once he is out of his kennel and running amok in our yard, he is a very sweet pup.  As you can see in the profile pictures & video, he adores playing in the pool.  We hope his new family will have a kiddie pool for him to splash around in.  

We do not receive much information about Taylor from the transferring shelter.  He appears to do well with other dogs that are calm and friendly towards him.  If you are interested in Taylor and have another dog, please bring your canine family member to the shelter for a meet and greet,

We have no information on how Taylor gets along with cats.  Do to his unknown history, we do recommend that his adoptive home be one without small children.

This is a sweet boy who needs an active and loving home.  If you are interested in meeting TAYLOR please contact the shelter, (207) 426-9482 to arrange a time. Leave a voice mail if no answer.

animal.description:
To access the home page for our group, click on Southern Comfort Maltese Rescue which will take you to the map page.  Below the map is our logo and the link to click on to access adoption forms, contact info or to donate. ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE.

Napolean has an angel!!!  His angel is Inge Coad!!  S.C.M.R. thanks you and so does Napolean.

We are sorry to say Napoleon is no longer available for adoption.  His diabetes has caused a lot of damage over the years to his little body, and he is now totally blind and deaf.  His quality of life is slowly going away, so we are now giving him hospice care and don't expect him to be with us very much longer.

If there is anyone that would like to contribute to his hospice care please send to SCMR.


NOTE: SCMR DOES NOT adopt to homes with children under the age of 10 years or homes with Electric Fences

Out-of-state adoptions are possible; however, the approved adoptive home is responsible for making the necessary arrangements to pick up their new little one.

Princess is patiently waiting a long time at Rescue Ridge in central N. J. and would love a
quiet home where she will be your special little girl, your only pet. Princess is a Boxer/ Hound mix, ~6 yrs. young, housebroken, good on a leash, takes toys, treats and food gently, knows some commands, loves the kiddie pool, and loves to fetch. She does have some doggie friends at the rescue, but really prefers to be the only pet in the home. Princess is well mannered in the home and in the car, too. Won't you please give this sweet girl a loving, forever home? Please apply to adopt Princess at: RescueRidge.com and text: 732 546 8805 or email: rescueridgeshelter@gmail.com for a meet and greet. Please share and watch her videos, too. animal.description:
Jade, now known as Brody, is a beautiful 45 pound, 3.75 -year- old Lab mix.  He was adopted from us as a puppy, but now needs to be rehomed due to his anxiety and the addition of a new baby in the house.
 Brody needs a home with active, dog-experienced owners and no young children or other dogs or cats.  Brody thrives on structure and will need training, exercise, and positive reinforcement.  His family says he is a great dog to have around. This handsome boy enjoys lounging in the sun, cuddling, playing, and car rides; but his favorite activity is going for walks. Brody still has puppy-like qualities, and he loves to run around his fenced yard and play fetch, though a fenced yard isn't mandatory. His original write up is below and the second to the  last picture is of him as a puppy.  If you can give Brody his forever home, please apply today. 
Jade's/Brody's  adoption fee is $200.
Adoption coordinator:  Pam

Original write up:
Jade is one of Mia Mya's 9 puppies.  He is a 12-week-old Lab mix puppy.  He and his littermates will be larger than their 28 pound mom Mia Mya, but a bit smaller than a large Lab.  Jade is a gem worth keeping--a rare find.  He meets all your needs--he loves to play and snuggle. And, as I'm sure you can tell from his pictures--he loves the water.   Jade  is working on his house and crate training.  If you can give this adorable guy his forever home, please apply today.  Puppies do best with children 5 and up.  Jade's adoption fee is $450.



Please complete an online APPLICATION if you wish to adopt.  Forever Home Rescue New England is a 501(c)3  non-profit organization. We are a network of foster homes in the South and the New England area. THERE IS NO SPECIFIC SHELTER LOCATION. If you wish to meet our dogs, you must first be approved by going through our application and screening process. Forever Home Rescue suggests obedience training for all puppies and dogs. All dogs are up to date on their shots, dewormed and spayed or neutered. Vet fees, transport fee and New England quarantine fees ARE INCLUDED in each dog's adoption fee. Also, any dogs older than pups--even if they are not marked housetrained in their posting---usually housetrain within a day or two, because most are used to living outside in the south and will prefer to do their business outdoors. Our dogs and pups are best suited for families with children 5 yrs old and up. If you are approved to adopt, please submit the $100 deposit by clicking on our rescue's name in this posting (Forever Home Rescue New England--in purple) which will bring you to a new page with the deposit link at the bottom.  STOP! If you have not been notified of your approval status do not make a deposit.

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE BEFORE CONTACTING US AS IT WILL ANSWER MANY OF YOUR BASIC QUESTIONS ABOUT ADOPTING FROM OUR RESCUE.  WWW.CARERVA.COM

Farley is a precious little fellow who was left behind to fend for himself when his owners moved away.  Though we cannot imagine doing something so careless ourselves, we don't understand how this sweet boy could still be the happy guy that he is!  Farley is a smart fellow who loves other dogs his size and gets along great with our volunteers.  Farley is about 4 years old.  He is in good health, up to date with vaccines, and is neutered and microchipped.  Learn how to meet and adopt Farley on our website at www.carerva.com.

CARE Rescue is  foster-base rescue located in Richmond, VA.  We do not have a facility for you to come to meet animals at.  You must visit our weekly adoption stand (calendar on our website) to meet the adoptable dogs.  Out of area adoptions can only be facilitated when we are able to find a volunteer to do a home visit for us and when the potential adopter already has a veterinary reference.

As we are a 100%-volunteer organization, Romulus currently lives in a foster home. Romulus is very sweet but also very timid. He requires a secured fenced in yard! No small children! He will do better in a home with a friendly dog. He is house and crate trained, fully vetted and microchipped. For more info, email us: spiritcaninerescue@gmail.com

****************************************************************************

Romulus is available for adoption through Spirit Canine Rescue. To adopt Romulus, please visit our website http://www.spiritcaninerescue.org/adopt.html for more information and to complete an application. A home visit will be required prior to adoption. We request that all adopters be within reasonable traveling distance to Burlington NC ( no more than 2hrs) All dogs will be spayed/neutered prior to adoption and will also be up-to-date on age-appropriate vaccinations (rabies, distemper/parvo and bordatella).

* Our only obligation is to the dogs in our program and we reserve the right to determine whether a particular dog and the adopter are the right fit.Remember, just because a dog "looks" like the one you want, that does not necessarily mean that the dog will "behave" like the one you want!

Note: We don't adopt out of state! Romulus requires a fenced in yard!

animal.description:
Age: 6 years old (approx)

Weight: 50 pounds

Adoption Fee: $150 (includes microchip, neuter surgery and vaccinations)

Papa is a very friendly medium-sized dog who is sweet and people-oriented. He knows how to SIT, lay down, and SHAKE hands and will even do this with either paw! He is quite playful but also a well-behaved adult dog. He likes car rides and going for puppacinos and frozen yogurt! He loves all people and loves to make new friends! We have also discovered he seems to enjoy wearing hats and sweaters, and he's so photogenic that you cannot help but dress him up for pictures! He's our resident Dog Model who will wear just about anything and has fun too. Got Netflix? He'll binge-watch whatever you're watching with you (we can't guarantee he'll stay awake though!) We have also found that Papa also really likes race tracks! He has been to Virginia International Raceway THREE times and loves all the people and noise.

His ideal home would have no other dogs (cats who know dogs are OK) and no small children/toddlers (he jumps a little bit when he's excited and could knock a little child over without meaning harm). He likes to run around with balls so a fenced yard is required.

****************************************************************************

Papa is available for adoption through Spirit Canine Rescue. To adopt Papa, please visit our website http://www.spiritcaninerescue.org/adopt.html for more information and to complete an application. A home visit will be required prior to adoption. We request that all adopters be within reasonable traveling distance to Burlington NC.

* Our only obligation is to the dogs in our program and we reserve the right to determine whether a particular dog and the adopter are the right fit. Remember, just because a dog "looks" like the one you want, that does not necessarily mean that the dog will "behave" like the one you want!

Note: We do not adopt out of state! We do not adopt dogs into homes with invisible /underground fencing! 2/1/21 3:43 PM

animal.description:
Guri and Simone are the surviving children of Nuri. The entire family was abandoned on some vacant land behind the Sanctuary behind a pile of brush. The staff didn't realize they were even there until they heard the puppies crying. They found an extremely frightened and guarding Nuri with 5 pups - 3 of whom were already dead.

As you can see, the 2 surviving pups are now thriving and look to grow into medium to medium-large doggies.

We are saying their other breed is Bull Terrier (think Spuds Mckenzie) as their mom definitely looks to have some of that in her. They are very playful with each other and are learning, just like their mom, that they can trust humans that will treat them with love and kindness! Sponsor Guri, Simone, and Nuri to help us help them get a second chance at life today!

animal.description:
Princess and Bud were a bonded pair. She is about 10 years young and a large breed but agile.
 Sadly Bud, her bonded companion,  passed away this past fall, from an illness related to the breed  Dogue de Bordeaux, 
Princess smile goes from ear to ear! She lives the leisurely life now and loves human company so much!
She would love a person or family to love and see her through her golden years.
She is an absolute  loving doll!
Kind, gentle and loves to lounge and go for walks., Hanging out with people and receiving love, is her favorite past time. Walking and enjoying life at a leisurely pace suits her perfect! about 4-5 years old and is wonderful! She is loving, gentle, easy, loves to go for walks, and is very beautiful! 
Pictures don't do her justice! Princess is about 10 years old and a mix. She is a sweetheart. Up to date on vaccines, micro-chipped and spayed/neutered. If you would like to adopt  Princess please fill out an application today. Applications can be found on our website www.LindaBlairWorldheart.org.

Southern Ca adoptions only due to home checks.

To view all of our dogs available for adoption please visit www.LindaBlairWorldheart.org
Follow us on social media: Facebook/LindaBlairWorldheartFoundation
Twitter & Instagram @LindaBlairWF

animal.description:
Colorado Saint Bernard Rescue 
FOSTER HOMES NEEDED

URGENT!!! 

Volunteer foster homes are what makes our rescue program successful. Opening your home to a Saint Bernard in need, is a wonderful family activity. It teaches children compassion and responsibility as they see their parents giving of themselves to help a Saint Bernard in their own home. 

We provide all medical veterinary care (Typically done before placed into foster homes) and food. Your provide a safe, loving home environment for a Saint Bernard in need. 

Please fill out our online adoption/Foster application and mark it that you are interested in fostering. It can be found on our website at www.gotdrool.org

If you have questions about fostering, you can email us at cosaintrescue@gmail.com

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website. All of our dogs and cats are in foster homes and we have no paid staff. If you have questions concerning a specific animal, PLEASE fill out an application and the foster parent will be in touch. We will not arrange any home visits with any of our dogs and cats until your application is processed. Please understand our foster parents are precious to our 2nd Chance family; without them we cannot function, so we do our best to not burden them with multiple appointments. Our foster parents will choose their top 3 applications and arrange home visits with these applicants. The adopter will be chosen at that time. The process can take anywhere from a week to a month. We want to make sure our little furry ones are placed in their 'forever home' and never have to go through a rehoming again!Nova is super cute and lives with dogs and cats HOWEVER he can have a bit of a 'tude' so you are going to have to be able to handle his attitude. He will choose to bite if he feels cornered so he is not going to a home with children.Please fill out an adoption application:
Adoption application (Dog)
Adoption Application (Cat)

Please understand we do not adopt out dogs to
families with children under the age of 5. We do not adopt dogs to renters. Some dogs will have fence requirements while others may not.

A pet is a lifetime commitment. The dogs and cats in our system find themselves there, for the most part, because their humans did not have the same loyalty to them as they did to their owners. We do not take the adoption process lightly, and will do everything in our power to make sure the animal is placed correctly the first time around for your sake and theirs. Thank you for choosing to adopt not shop!

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website. All of our dogs and cats are in foster homes and we have no paid staff. If you have questions concerning a specific animal, PLEASE fill out an application and the foster parent will be in touch. We will not arrange any home visits with any of our dogs and cats until your application is processed. Please understand our foster parents are precious to our 2nd Chance family; without them we cannot function, so we do our best to not burden them with multiple appointments. Our foster parents will choose their top 3 applications and arrange home visits with these applicants. The adopter will be chosen at that time. The process can take anywhere from a week to a month. We want to make sure our little furry ones are placed in their 'forever home' and never have to go through a rehoming again!Ozzie is part of a group of 4 chihuahua's that were given to us from a home with 11 dogs that were never given human attention. They are very fearful of everything. We are working slowly with each of them.Update:Once upon a time, in a land not so far away, lived a very scared and broken-hearted chihuahua. His name was Ozzie. He was taken to boarding until a foster home became available to wish away the memories that scared and scarred him. Within a week, a lady came to pick him up. Ozzie saw the lady and tried to hide in a corner of the boarding facility. The lady took a step closer and Ozzie pooped his pants! (Okay, Ozzie didn't have pants on and it hit the floor. But, we don't want to embarrass him about being naked in public.) The lady spent a long time sitting near him and talking to him before Ozzie would crawl onto her lap. The lady took Ozzie home with her. Ozzie was given his own room with a crate to sleep in. It had a warm fluffy bed. The lady placed him in the crate to adjust to the sounds of the house. Ozzie had never been more scared in his life. Whenever the lady tried to put a leash on his collar he would try to scare her away with snarls and barks, but she wouldn't give up. For 2 weeks the lady would dangle a slip lead through the crate and loop it around him before she could put his leash on. The foster lady had discovered that Ozzie was afraid to have anyone be near his head. Ozzie started to realize that no matter how much he showed his fears, this foster lady wouldn't give up on trying to love him. His foster mom started leaving his crate and bedroom door open. One night he peeked into her bedroom and saw her with two other dogs on her bed. They were playing and licking her face...and she laughed and seemed to like it. Ozzie snuck closer and closer...until he was up on the bed at the bottom, watching as the other dogs moved closer to foster mom and cuddled up to sleep! Foster mom pretended not to notice as Ozzie crept closer and closer...until he came up to her and cuddled too! This went on for several nights. Finally, Ozzie decided that he wasn't so afraid of foster mom and he was going to give her a kiss on the face like the other dogs did. Foster mom was filled with joy. This kiss meant more than any wet puppy kiss she ever had. The scared and broken-hearted chihuahua had turned a corner and found someone he could trust and care for!As the days and weeks turned into months, Ozzie started to try playing with the other dogs. He would sit on foster mom's lap, drink her iced tea and coffee when she wasn't paying attention, and start going up to other members of the household for petting. Ozzie learned nobody was going to hurt his head and all the humans respected his wish to allow him to give kisses first and not reach for his head or put their face in his without first being asked to by him. Life for Ozzie was the best he could remember.Then, one day, foster mom brought home a pup. The pup's name was Dink. Dink was a very energetic and playful puppy. Ozzie wasn't sure why, but foster mom decided to introduce him to Dink in the play yard...just the two of them! Ozzie heard foster mom tell someone she was so happy to finally see him play like a young dog should. Ozzie continued to play with Dink. They ran and ran in the green grass until they were both tired and thirsty. Ozzie thinks he heard foster mom say she hopes he finds a furever home now that his fears have lessened. Ozzie now has joy and hope in his heart that he will soon find another patient and understanding home of humans that he could make as happy as foster mom!Please fill out an adoption application:
Adoption application (Dog)
Adoption Application (Cat)

Please understand we do not adopt out dogs to
families with children under the age of 5. We do not adopt dogs to renters. Some dogs will have fence requirements while others may not.

A pet is a lifetime commitment. The dogs and cats in our system find themselves there, for the most part, because their humans did not have the same loyalty to them as they did to their owners. We do not take the adoption process lightly, and will do everything in our power to make sure the animal is placed correctly the first time around for your sake and theirs. Thank you for choosing to adopt not shop!

Our foster parents will choose their top 3 applications and arrange home visits with these applicants. The adopter will be chosen at that time. The process can take anywhere from a week to a month. We want to make sure our little furry ones are placed in their 'forever home' and never have to go through a rehoming again!MUST HAVE FENCED YARDNO SMALL CHILDRENQUIET HOUSEHOLDSo I'm a little 'crooked' anatomically speaking! I would never morally be 'crooked' its just not in my sweet, angelic character. Now here is my story. I was wandering around the street of Philly now if you have never been there let me tell you there are some SCARY streets and a LOT of homeless pups. I was 'holding my own' but I gotta tell you living on the streets is tough business and I'm just not setup to be 'tough' so between you and I shhhhhh I left myself get caught. They brought me to the shelter and I just hoped for the best. I tried to look really sweet and stand up straight (well as straight as I can) when people came in the room.
A lady came in and the guy with her said hey this little guy is cute.... The lady said what's wrong with his neck? That's not good we need to take him too!! And the next thing I knew they took me out of the crate and put me in their nice warm car with Princess and the two of us left the scary shelter and city behind and headed for Elizabethtown.
Whoooohooooo. I stayed at the hospital so they could see if my crooked neck was hurting my spine or anything but Dr. C said it is congenital and it is not compressing my spine so its all good I'm just 'unique' hmmmm I could have told them that and saved us all a lot of time :)
Avery has been on a few home visits. He is very 'picky' with whom he likes. He is not a dog to go to a home with a lot of activity and he cuddles on his terms :) FENCED YARD REQUIRED Please fill out an adoption application:

All of our dogs and cats are in foster homes and we have no paid staff. If you have questions concerning a specific animal, PLEASE fill out an application and the foster parent will be in touch. Our foster parents will choose their top 3 applications and arrange home visits with these applicants. The adopter will be chosen at that time. The process can take anywhere from a week to a month. We want to make sure our little furry ones are placed in their 'forever home' and never have to go through a rehoming again!Hello my name is Logan I know weird name for a girl right? Well I'm no prissy female anyway so thats OK. I get along with all the other foster dogs in my home I'm not thrilled with humans and I am VERY choosy about whom I will make up to. Please understand I am not a dog that will fit in just any home and definitely not one with children.I came from ACCT Philly. That is a really scary place and my people handed me and Lindsey over and walked away. The guy went to put me in this high cage and dropped me. I fell 4 feet on to the cement floor on my head and had a seziure! It was awful!!! When that happened they took me somewhere else and I didn't see Lindsey again. I was soooo scared I just cuddled in a corner with my face in the corner of the cage and tried to shut out the world. The shelter decided it was time to put me to sleep!! Thank God they put out an email that they were going to euth me and 2nd Chance drove to Philadelphia. When they got there their director said 'where is Logan' the shelter said on the adoption floor. The Director said get her. The shelter worker said I don't know if I can we have her up for adoption. The Director said you either give me both or I take neither (she told me later she was bluffing and would NEVER have left me behind but she knew the shelter would not want to make that decision :) Soooo they went and got Lindsey and I was soooo happy when I saw a familiar face!! These days we are not as close as we have made other friends in the house so our foster mom says we do not need to go together. I am not a cat dog. I like to chase them way to much!! The cat in my house now HATES me. I don't know why, she runs, I chase :)Please fill out an adoption application:

families with children under the age of 5. We do not adopt dogs to renters. Some dogs will have fence requirements while others may not.
