animal.description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.***COURTESY POST FOR CURRENT OWNER WHO NEEDS TO REHOME DUKE***Duke or 'Duke Boy' as I like to call him is a 3 year old Blue Brindle Pit Bull/Lab mix. He is a very energetic and a happy go lucky puppy at heart. Duke has so much spunk and so much to offer man's best friend. As playful as Duke can be, he can also be protective but not in an aggressive manner. He hears noise and he starts to bark so he does what dogs do. Duke is loyal and knows some commands, like sit, stay and back. He will listen to sit back and wait for you to let him out when it's time to go out. He also waits to be told to eat as opposed to simply going for the food when placed down. Duke is potty trained and crate trained. Duke needs an active owner that will allow him to be a great dog and a better best friend. Can be successful with other large dogs depending on temperament but best as an only dog. No cats. Email CAUSE4SBPAWS@GMAIL.COM to get in touch with current owner!

animal.description:
Meet Clyde!

You may remember Clyde's sad story of cruelty and neglect. We were shocked when we saw his pictures and heard how he had literally been strangled with a belt by his so called owner. His strangulation caused a massive deep cut all around his neck and caused the blood not be able to circulate resulting in his face ballooning until he was unrecognizable. He was confiscated from his owner and charges are pending. In the meantime, we brought him into our rescue and have nursed him back to health. We could tell he didn't know what it was like to be treated kindly, but after talking to him a bit and giving him love, he started wagging his tail. He is BEYOND sweet!! Check him out HERE playing with his friends at daycare!

We are happy to report that with the help of the vets, we provided pictures and info on the extent of his injuries to the Harris County DA's office. His former owner was prosecuted and justice was done!

Clyde is about 4-5 years old and a Cattle Dog mix of sorts. He's friendly and fun-loving but cautious with new people until he knows you mean him no harm. He does great with most other dogs that are medium to large in size. He is high-energy, so he would do best in an active home and with another active dog that can play, and play, and play with him! He's not especially fond of cats, so a home without cats is a must.

Clyde is just the sweetest, although he does get his feelings hurts easily when corrected, so he is a quick learner and pleaser. Makes training a piece of cake!

Clyde is doing fabulous in his foster home with his 2 canine siblings, but he would really love to find a forever home where he never has to worry again! Contact us at
info@scoutshonor.org
if you can help!

No surprise here in Houston and considering the condition he was in, Clyde is heartworm positive, but don't worry. Scout's Honor is taking care of that for him and if you want to adopt Clyde before he's all clear (which would be great!) we will continue to cover the expense of his medicine and next heartworm check. We can explain it all but he's going to be just fine.

Check out Clyde playing with his friends at daycare HERE

animal.description:
Please meet sweet Sparkle, the Disney Dog! Sparkle is a retriever/Dalmatian mix, and she is just precious. We call her the Disney Dog because she has the most beautiful eye liner and expressive eyes, which make her look like one of the 101 Dalmatians.

Sparkle is such a sweet girl and just loves her people and other dogs. Sparkle is housetrained. She is not a fan of her crate, but she is a good girl when left alone in the house. A lot of times, Sparkle's foster mom will find her waiting by the window when she comes home. When her foster mom is home, Sparkle will nudge the back door when she needs to go potty. Even though Sparkle does not like to be locked up in a crate, she does enjoy sleeping in hers when the door is left open. Many nights, she will go to bed in her foster mom's bedroom and end up sleeping in her crate in the dining room.

Sparkle is also wonderful with kids. She is so gentle around them and even listens to their commands. Sparkle also gets along with her 4-legged foster siblings and LOVES to play with them. She is not a cat person, so no cats or other small animals!

Sparkle has a lot of energy when appropriate and LOVES to run. She does have a bit of thunderphobia, but we are working on desensitizing her to that. She would do well in a home with kids and/or other dogs. She likes the activity and loves nothing more than to lie next to you and cuddle. She knows when it's time to play versus when it's time to just hang out in the house and be calm.

Sparkle also LOVES (she loves a lot of things!) squeaky toys and enjoys playing with them a lot. She also enjoys a short game of fetch. She will bring the object to you, and if you ask for it, she will let it go. She will do this about 4 or 5 times, and then she just prefers to chew on the toy. So cute.

Sparkle knows basic commands and will follow them if she is awarded with treats. She walks great on a leash as well. What a great girl!

If you are interested in adopting this sweet girl, please contact us at info@scoutshonor.org. To read about Scout's Honor's adoption procedures or to fill out an application for Sparkle, please visit our website at www.scoutshonor.org.

Meet our sweet, lovable senior girl Sparkle. Don't be fooled by "senior" this girl still has plenty of energy, love and spunk to last a long, long time.

Sparkle has been with us a long time, not because she is ever anything less than a total lovebug, but because she came to us with extreme thunderphobia. And we will tell you all about the beginning if you are truly interested, but nowadays her foster has a plan that seems to be working. On stormy days Sparkle either goes to doggie daycare or her mom works from home. The key is too not leave her alone during storms.

Sparkle LOVES other dogs and would do best in a home with a canine sibling. She loves kids too and has even learned to live with a cat.

Sparkle is now about 9-10 years old, about 45-50 pounds and is a Dalmatian, retriever mix. She loves toys and playing fetch. She hates crates and being confined but is a good girl left out in the house (without storms

)

Sparkle is up to date on vaccines, spayed and microchipped.

If you are interested in adopting this sweet senior girl just fill out the application and we will be in touch soon.

animal.description:
Welcome to the Wonderful World of Rescue Dachshunds. Look around and read their bios. Find a few whose personality seems to fit well. Consider one of our Well Seasoned Seniors who are truly wonderful and have so much to offer. Need help finding the best fit? We'll help with that too. Please fill out an application and let's get you all matched up with a loving new "furever' companion and friend. You'll find the application on the "Available Dogs" page.

NOTE:

Adoptions to Central/South Texas residents only

Standard Adoption Fee Adult Dog: $250 ea. Puppy Adoption Fee: $300 ea. Reduced rates for Seniors dogs (10 and up). Reduced rates for pairs (when adopted together). All adoption fees are subject to sales tax per the State of Texas. DDRTX only adopts in Central/South Texas.

Email: ddrtxinfo@gmail.com Primary Website: www.DDRTX.org
Hello! I'm Romeo. I came to DDRT when my parent got sick and couldn't take care of me any longer. My current foster family has taken great care of me but I am looking for my forever home.

Most of my day is keeping company with the humans in the house. I like to sit in laps while they read or watch TV. I will "talk" to them and let them know if I need to go out, or when I'm ready to come back in, if my water bowl is empty, or if I want to play. I'd rather be the only dog in the house and keep the humans all to myself, but if I do have to share the home with another dog, they need to be little like me.

See, there are things in my life that scare me just a little - like big dogs, certain noises, and laminate or hardwood floors. The noise and texture on my feet doesn't feel so good. I prefer the carpet and tile. I know that sounds kinda silly, but at my age, a guy knows what he wants!

I would love to spend my days on the couch snoozing and taking naps, watching TV with you, and getting belly rubs! Due to my age, I have bone spurs and calcification on disks that may cause me pain, this can be managed by adding fish oil and glucosamine chondroitin (Cosequin pills) to my diet. If you are older, like me, at home most of the time, or like watching TV too - you could be my forever home!

If you would like to meet this handsome, snuggly, lap guy, please fill out an application for Romeo Too today!

Love dachshunds and not ready to adopt or circumstances won't permit having a dog? How about being a sponsor or making a donation. Every one of our dachshunds receives excellent medical care along with day to day food, love and housing. Being non-profit, we rely on generous individuals like yourselves to help save these fur babies. You can do this specifically for one dog with the sponsor button on their webpage or a general donation on our "How To Help" page. Easy and quick through Pay Pal or your debit/credit card. You generosity is sincerely appreciated by all and is tax deductable. Need other ideas? You'll find tons of them on the How to Help tab. All contributions are tax deductable.

Diamond Dachshund Rescue of Texas is a non-profit 501(c)(3) volunteer organization with focus on rescue and adoption of pure breed Dachshunds. All dogs are fully vetted and housed on private property. Meetings are scheduled upon adoption approval. Thank you for your continued support to the rescue and shelter communities!
Opt to Adopt!

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.DOB: 2/1/2013HEY! I've been on this site for quite awhile. So, I'm gonna put my cards on the table. I'm just a great dog with specific requirements! No dogs, iffy on kids, no cats. Just you and a big fenced yard to play ball. You wouldn't even have to walk me if you throw the ball. I also love walking with you in the yard and you can kick the ball! I have fantastic recall: all you have to do is whistle and I stop to look at you or yell 'Haze'. And if you are lonely too, we'd be the bestest buddies! Say 'Ball'and I bring it right to you. Say 'Drop' and the ball is at your feet. And I love to play Tug with my favorite rope. Just over 7 years old and wonderfully obedient, I'm energetic, playful, and loving. Say 'Sit' and my behind hits the ground. Say 'Down' and my belly's on the ground. Need an alarm dog? I have a BIG bark. I'm good on a leash and very good off-leash. Just say 'Haze!' and I come right to you. Come see me & we just might hit it off! I just know that there is a lonesome person who needs me too!
I'm house trained and crate trained, and should have an experienced big dog owner. But I love men or women. I am fine with older teenagers but not children.
Up to date on age appropriate vaccines, neutered and micro-chipped.
***Haze is available for meet and greets with potential adopters by appointment only.*** (T&WL/CM*)
Adoption Fee: $100.00 1/31/21 6:30 PM

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
I'm Chevy and I love to run around. I am quite the boy around town. My life has certainly changed in the last year. I was one of 38 Chihuahuas confiscated in spring of 2015. I was not very nice at the time. Matter of fact, I hated everyone. I didn't know people could be nice. The girls spent a lot of time working with me. I still like to do my own thing, but I am starting to trust people and their toys. They even have these tasty things they call treats. I sleep inside with my foster mom every night. But I don't like to be carried. I want a home where I can be independent, but still have a nice person to play with when I want to. I have gone completely blind, but I still get around great. It's just hard to find the treats sometimes.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Cooper doesn't look it, but he is 12 years old. He came to us when he was 10 years old. I felt sorry for him and his owner. The guy that owned him had him since he was a puppy. He had recently gotten married and Cooper was unable to transition into a family with two small children. He was totally stressed out and snapping. Now I know what my answer would have been, but the guy was committed to making his marriage work, so Cooper had to go.

He had a real rough transition at first. He hated being at the facility. I took him my house, and he still wasn't happy. For the first six months he barked constantly. One day he followed me to the kennel and met the puppies. From then on he found his place in the world. He rules the quarantine room. He set up shop in a bottom kennel and he supervises al the workers and volunteers. He is happy as a lark. He loves the new puppies. He wants to babysit. When I was taking pictures, he kept getting on the table to make sure the babies were ok.

I'm not sure that Cooper would be a good candidate at this point for a new home, unless the person had a lot of patience and love to give him. He would really appreciate people sponsoring him. He still gets all the special treatment our adoptable dogs get. Every month he gets heartworm preventative, he gets a Bravecto pill every 90 days and he gets treats and toys. We are committed to letting him have a happy life, but as he ages his care will be more costly.
animal.name: Cooper

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.My name is Rosco. I was rescued from the Bandera County Pound several years ago. The inmates took care of me at the old facility. They played with me and taught me to be a good boy. When they got full, they called AD4Y Rescue and asked them to save me and here I am.

You see I don't like change too much. I became very withdrawn when I left my friends at the jail. I had alot more room to run and play and frankly I did everything I could to stay away from the girls. I trusted Ms. Pat, but no one else was going to touch this bad boy. But they wouldn't give up.

Over the last 30 days they have been telling me they are going to get me adopted one way or the other. They told me I have to start being a good boy with strangers and letting new people meet me. I wasn't going to do it, but Ms. Pat made me play with Ms. Kim. Did you know she keeps yummy stuff in her pocket? I tried to resist, but did I mention it was yummy?

The next thing you know Ms. Kim was taking me on walks and introducing me to new things. You know what? Change really isn't all that bad. I have to admit I love the attention. I am still a little skittish of new people but I am learning to trust people. I even went to the beauty shop and had them cut my hair. It's normally a lot longer.

I love to go on walks, it is truly my favorite thing or is it treats..it's a toss up. I even walk off leash at the ranch! When I warm up to you I am just a big love bug. I give Ms. Kim kisses all the time. I like to chase a ball but I am getting older so I usually just chew on it when I catch it. I have lived in a kennel now for awhile so I would need to be house trained again, but I am sure I can catch on fast, because I am super smart. I am doing great around other dogs too. I know that I can finally trust. I need to lose a little weight. I am slowing down but a nice orthopedic bed by you would be awesome. So iff you have lots of time and patience to help me adjust I will be your best friend for life!

If you would like to apply for me please go to www.adoggie4you.org and fill out a Companion Pet Application. If you want to help sponsor me, you can donate here. Your donations make sure other dogs like me have a chance at a new life, even if we are slow to adapt.
animal.name: Rosco

animal.description:
If you need more info please email. We don't call you, email only. cimarronhumane@yahoo.com. Read the message under the animal bio it will answer some of your questions. I work on the sites everyday and keep them updated.  Be sure to add us to your contact list on email or we could be trying to email you and it could go to spam.

Eva is a 5 yr old Catahoula/Pit Bull mix weighing 53 lbs. Smart, loyal, wants to please, very affectionate. Medium-low energy but still playful. Likes to be involved in whatever you are doing. Will bond closely. Great with adults and kids. Gets along with some dogs but will resource guard. Needs to be an only pet unless you are very dog savvy and have experience with these breeds. Eva has arthritis in one shoulder due to an old, untreated injury she received prior to coming into rescue. It is well controlled with meds/diet. Eva is house trained to a dog door and will crate herself on command. She is micro-chipped, spayed, current on vaccinations, heart worm negative and on monthly preventative. Adoption fee $85. Fostered in the Tulsa area.

We are foster based only (No shelter) you can't just drive up here and get a pet. If you are interested in a animal fill out the form, not a binding contract to adopt. This is how we get your information to the foster, most of our foster live in the Stillwater Ok. Area. Application to meet                                                                                       https://form.jotform.com/200005720739042 

We do adopt out of state but we do not ship animals, If you want to adopt one of our animals, you must come to pick them up in Oklahoma.

animal.description:
Every minute matters when it comes to rescuing a Shih Tzu. We may get a short notice that someone needs to surrender their dog or a puppy mill dog needs a temporary home. We can't help if we don't have families willing to foster, and we are always in need of more foster homes!

If you live in the Minneapolis/Saint Paul, Rockford or Chicago, IL areas and want to help save lives, please complete either our online Foster Sign-Up or download a word version here:

http://www.northstarshihtzurescue.org/foster/

(please note: neither dog pictured are available to foster or adopt, both are in their forever homes)

NorthStar Shih Tzu Rescue exists to benefit both Shih Tzu and Shih Tzu blend dogs and the people of our community. We operate as a no-kill rescue that provides rescue and adoption services, and meaningful outreach programs in order to advance the welfare of these companion animals, to serve and educate our community, and to make a positive, loving impact on the lives of both.

NorthStar, located in Excelsior, MN, actively works to rescue Shih Tzu and Shih Tzu blend dogs from dangerous environments and shelters with the ultimate goal of placing them in loving, permanent, adoptive homes. We rescue unwanted, abandoned, and abused dogs. We have them vaccinated, micro-chipped, spayed or neutered, provide other medical care, and rehabilitate them in carefully selected foster homes.

We also serve as a resource to our community and all pet owners by providing education and information on the benefits of adopting an animal in need as well as responsible pet ownership, including the importance of spay/neuter, good nutrition, and positive behavior training. We strive to increase public awareness about companion animal overpopulation, commercial breeders, and to offer solutions to end the killing of adoptable animals.

We work in alliance with local animal shelters, pounds, other rescue groups, and humane society organizations to ensure these animals are not forgotten.

animal.description:
If you are interested in adopting an ARPO pet, please visit our website, for details about our fees and process, and to complete our Adoption Application. ARPO limits adoptions to within 50 miles of Indianapolis. We do not have a shelter; all pets are in volunteer foster homes.

Cossett is a 7 yr old 50 lb hound mix and is an active dog who loves to run and play. She would LOVE to have a doggy playmate, but can be somewhat choosy about her friends. If you have a dog that is looking for a playmate, we would set up a meet and greet. Cossett is a very athletic dog with energy to burn so a fenced-in yard would be best for her.

She is looking for an ADULT-ONLY home with an owner who has dog EXPERIENCE (behavior, training experience). She is not compatible for a home with children or cats.

She takes a while to warm up and can be fearful and timid when first meeting people. However, it doesn't take her long to bond with someone and she establishes trust fairly quickly.

Cossett knows basic commands and once she gains your trust she is a Velcro dog. She craves attention and affection and loves nothing more than to be by your side. She's house broken and crate trained.

Our adoption fees cover less than half of our medical expenses. We depend on the generosity of all our animal loving friends to help us continue to rescue these animals. Please help us with your on-line donation via Paypal by clicking on the icon below. We are a Paypal Verified site and it is secure.

Or you can mail a check to: Alliance for Responsible Pet Ownership, P.O. Box 6385, Fishers, IN 46038.

If you are interested in adopting an ARPO pet, please complete the online Adoption Application.

Due to recent coronavirus concerns, we have suspended our public adoption events until further notice.

animal.description:
Initially shy with strangers, Carmine has a happy outlook on life. Once he warms up to new adults, he is a total love bug -- such a sweetheart! He loves to go for long walks, especially along the lakefront in his current foster home. He's dog friendly and enjoys playing with other dogs off leash. And, he loves toys and chasing Frisbees. Carmine even likes water - especially a baby pool.

Carmine is rather quiet, good in his crate, and sleeps through the night on his doggie bed. There's no better feeling when Carmine trusts you and his true personality comes out. It just takes a bit of time. Due to his shyness and probable lack of socialization in his previous life, he's not good with kids - he's scared of them.

Carmine just deserves a chance to be the amazing pup that he can be. He's sweet, affectionate, quiet, and gets along super well with his old foster dog who's 13. He's very respectful and great with him on walks. He's a bit spoiled - loves yogurt and random human food. Are you his forever family that will spoil him, too?

If you are interested in adopting this sweet little nugget, please fill out an application at: :http://www.dogsaredeservingrescue.com/adoptable-dogs/adoption-application/ (needs to link)

Check out Carmine's Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/Helpcarminefindahome/. 2/2/21 6:06 PM

animal.description:
MEET CHARLIE---
Charlie is a great little guy - but a tough dog to place and would NOT be a pet for most people. He needs a patient, VERY ALPHA dog savvy owner.
He is a King Charles Cavalier mix (?), a very playful and active 5 year old and full grown at about 20 lbs. He is healthy, housebroken, neutered, micro-chipped and LOVES to fetch and bring back! He would do it all day if he could! He is well behaved when left alone and does not need to be crated. In fact, he would be totally OK if he were the only pet and the sole center of your attention. But he doesn't like to be left alone for long periods of time. His ideal home would be where there is NOT A LOT of activity or visitors -- or CATS - as he is not comfortable with new people and situations. But once he feels safe, probably after 2-3 days, he will be your new best friend, sitting on your lap or snuggling in bed. HE IS NOT A 'CONDO or APARTMENT' TYPE DOG.
We are not sure of what may have happened to him in his past. He came to us as an owner surrender but he does have 'issues'. Aside from feeding and potty breaks, if you can totally ignore him for several days, he will eventually come to you, but on his terms. Three or four days after coming into your home, he will willingly climb up on your lap or in bed with you -- (he loves to snuggle and be petted). Charlie bonds closely with his owner, showing great affection whenever the owner is present. But is apprehensive, barky and insecure when meeting new people. When a visitor comes, you must keep him on a leash or confine him to another room. He reacts by barking and threatening to 'bite'. He hasn't bitten but we cannot place him in a position where he might! He is still a work in progress.
HE WILL NOT BE AT OUR ADOPTION EVENTS as that would be too stressful for him. A private meeting can be arranged (Fort Lauderdale). We are accepting applications on him now.
Adoption fee: $200

DOWNLOAD OUR APPLICATION: www.gratefulpaws.org. Click on ADOPT - at the bottom of that page you will find our application.
NOTE: Adoption/rehoming fees are applied towards the vet bill: Exam, blood tests, vaccinations, fecal, worming, spay/neuter, and microchip. There is rarely anything left over, but if that happens, the monies get applied to the next or previous pet - who may have had to have an x-ray, be groomed or have a dental. 1/5/21 4:59 PM

Update Octpber 2012: Bertha is a great dog with a wonderful personality. She is learning her basic commands and is doing really well.

Bertha, named after the patron saint of female illnesses, was rescued because she was bred to a much too large of a male dog AND then they were puilled forceibly separared by dumb humans. Her insides were hanging out for over two (2) weeks BEFORE the "owner who loved her"! came to us and said his dog was in trouble. Bertha has successfully gone through surgery and is recooperating well. She told us she does NOT want to go back to her old family! She has now been spayed and our vet has declared her "good to go". BERTHA WANTS ALL TO KNOW SHE HAS LEARNED TO "SIT" FOR HER FOOD!!

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Please contact Tracey (traceysl@tarasdream.org) for more information about this pet.

Email T.A.R.A. | T.A.R.A.'s Web Site | On-Line Application

Maveryck's story truly is a rags to riches fairy tale! This boy was found freezing and emaciated, the sad product of severe neglect! Thankfully, he was found by a dedicated T.A.R.A. volunteer who helped him regain his trust, confidence and health! Maveryck is such a handsome boy, we couldn't help but post an entire photo album throughout his time with us! If you scroll to the very last photo, your heart may break into a million pieces as you see how broken and dejected he was when he was found!

Maveryck currently lives in a loving foster home with a large family including mom, dad, human foster siblings and canine foster siblings and he's doing great! He is completely house trained, gets along with other dogs and loves snuggle time more than anything else in the world!

Although Maveryck has come so far in his confidence and trust, he can be just the tiniest bit nervous in some new situations. He would do best in a home with a family who understands his past and his current love for life and will continue to provide him a loving and stable home environment!

Won't you make this handsome beauty a part of your family today?

Approximate Birthdate:
12/08/2010

Adoption Fee: $150

TARA's adoption fee includes: spay/neuter, age appropriate vaccinations, microchip, heartworm test (if age appropriate), heartworm and flea prevention, and deworming. TARA's pets are all eligible for a

two week trial

.

Due to the fact that many of our dogs come from the local city shelters, we do not know the background of many of them and therefore cannot always guarantee age or breed. Size is subjective but we use the following guidelines: Small 1-20 pounds, Med 20-50 pounds, Large 50-80 pounds, Extra Large over 80 pounds.

For more information please fill out an APPLICATION

Please visit our

EVENTS PAGE

for information about our upcoming adoption events.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

All of the animals posted on our site have been temperament tested. While not all are in the immediate area, once we have processed and approved your application, we will move the dog to our adoptive area for you to meet, greet and hopefully adopt. Sometimes we will have more than one application on a dog. That does not mean it automatically goes to another family but you should be aware of the fact that until you are approved and set up for the meet/greet.. the dog could get adopted by another applicant.



Leia's Story...

 Lovely Leia is looking for a home of her own! She is a great companion, loves her pack walks, and likes to be near her person. Family friendly, acclimated to other dogs/cats/chickens. Quiet, docile, and loving girl. 
Leia is a 45 lbs and around 10 years young.
Located in VA, transportation available.
Adoption fee $100
Includes
Spay/Neuter
4DX Heartworm test (negative)
Da2PP Bordetella and Rabies vaccines
Deworming, on monthly HW Prevention
Treated with Advantage or Advantix
AVID microchip with registration
540.908.9152
info@highlandcountyhumanesociety.org
Download an application a www.highlandcountyhumanesociety.org/animals/
All animals for adoption are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment suitable to your schedule. 
Transportation available.

animal.description:
Winnie is a tricolor 5 year old hound/shepherd mix, about 60 lbs. She has a hound's coat but her shape is more like a shepherd's. She has one eye, though that doesn't impair her vision. Big energetic girl.
She loves women and would much prefer an estrogen-enriched environment. She has not really warmed up to our male staff. The head of our dog walking team says that she is excellent on a leash and is overall a good dog.
Her favorite dogs are big male dogs, like our golden husky Marley. We would want for her to go to a home with her best friend Marely.
Please find our applications and valuable information under 'Adopt a dog'* on our website: *www.beaglesandbuddies.com* and email your application to beaglesandbuddies@gmail.com. Let us know your preference of appointment day/time and which dogs you are interested in and we will do our best to accommodate and email you the closest appointment available. Please allow us up to a week to get back to you. Most appointments will be Friday-Sunday, 10 am - 2 pm, for an hour.
*Note bring any other dog/s and the entire family to your meet and greet at B&B.* A complimentary training manual is included with each adoption, authored by terristeuben.com. Check out her website - she is fabulous!
B&B is glad to be open during the pandemic. We know the value and comfort of a loving pet companion and are doing our best to help the dogs and folks who need them. We update our website daily and are always rescuing, vetting, rehabilitating, socializing.
* We are accepting applications for volunteers to spend time with our dogs, hang out, sing/read to the shy ones, walk/toss ball with those who go to the playgrounds; cleaning, office work, gardening, and building/repair projects! *


Are you my furrever family?

For further info on the adoption process, please visit our home page and check out the "Adopt a Dog" section, which has thorough instructions. All our dogs are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and

fully vaccinated before adoption; they have been wormed, bathed, socialized, walked daily and much loved; each adoptee leaves with a leash, collar, and all medical records.

Our prices are higher than the shelters' because we nurse the dogs through their illnesses and get them needed surgeries and dentals. We also spend time socializing. Furthermore, unlike shelters, rescues do not get financial aid from the government and must rely on donations, grants, and adoption fees. Our fees for adults start at $150 and go up to $750. The higher end is for our most in demand dogs, such as young beagles and other purebred dogs. The lower end is for dogs who have been here a while. For puppies, we may go beyond this and charge $1000. The good news is that, because rescues fall under the "charity" category, the fees for our dogs are officially donations and are therefore tax deductible. You can think of it as donating to a worthy cause and getting a dog in return!

Sponsor Me

Beagles & Buddies must find ways to raise money so we can continue saving dogs. Your tax-deductible donation keeps our rescue kennel operating!

Hours

Friday: 10 am to 3 pm

Saturday: 10 am to 3 pm

Sunday: 10 am to 3 pm

Monday: CLOSED

Tuesday: CLOSED

Wednesday: CLOSED

Thursday: CLOSED



Weekday appointments may be available. We are a small staff and do our best to accommodate your needs. **Note that during COVID, we are not holding open houses on any day. Please email us for an appointment and include your application (found on our website, beaglesandbuddies.com, under "Forms"). Most appointments will be Friday through Sunday, though other days may also be available. We usually schedule one appointment per hour. Allow 1-2 hours for your appointment. Please look at our website and make a list of one or more dogs that you would like to see.

Contacting Us

If you have a question about adopting, giving up a dog, boarding, or volunteering, please visit the appropriate tabs on our
home page.

For more specific questions, call 626-444-9664 (please leave a voicemail if no answer) or email at beaglesandbuddies@gmail.com. Note that
Emailing
is always preferred!

Thanks!

Please note: If you are viewing this profile anywhere other than Beagles & Buddies own website, you are not receiving full info. Visit info on pet here.

animal.description:
Marley is a very handsome 10 year old husky mix. He has had one home all his life - came to us through no fault of his own - his family was moving out of state and could not take him with.
Marley is a great guy for older folks - maybe some folks who are home often. He is very easy to walk on a leash. He is also gentle and obedient. He is potty trained but he is not so great with kiddos, small dogs, or cats, although we find that it is all about the introduction. He's a little shy right now, but he's warming up! He loves to chase after balls.
His BFF is Winnie - they adore one another and would love to go to a forever home together!

animal.description:
Chaz, also called Charlie, is a 7 year old chihuahua mix, about 14 lbs. He's a pretty orange and white color. He came in some years ago from a hoarding situation, unsocialized. It took him a while to trust people. But this December, he made the huge step of letting a volunteer pet him- good job, Charlie! Once he is comfortable with someone, he is devoted. He will follow them around, obey commands, go up to them, sit by them, and put his paws on them.
He is afraid of having things put around his neck. However, he does follow off leash commands. He's a quick learner, and he should do well in a home where he would have one on one attention.

animal.description:
Moe Moe is a white and cream, 7 year old terrier/chihuahua mix. About 15 lbs. He's one of a bunch of unsocialized dogs who came in from a Nevada rescue in 2014. He was very nervous at first, but not aggressive, and he now enjoys roaming the sanctuary. Though he usually doesn't come up to people, he has a friendly demeanor, and will follow around people he knows. He would probably come out of his shell more in a home where he would have one on one attention. He does well with other dogs. He really likes being part of the 'house dogs' pack - sleeps in the big people bed...and is well mannered.
Because of his shyness, not recommended for young kids. We've heard that he doesn't like cats.
He has really captured our hearts - wonderful little companion - super pal to lotsa dogs of all sizes and loves his peeps a lot!

animal.description:
DOB: 12/14 Weight: 65 lbs
Murphy is a very handsome boy with a beautiful smile. He was surrendered because his family moved. According to them, he is housetrained, good with dogs and kids. His has lots of energy so he will need either a fenced yard or an active family. He is very toy driven, he would rather play with toys than eat. He LOVES toys!!!
He has had a rabies shot, 7-way shot, bordetella, and been wormed. He is neutered, microchipped and heartworm tested negative. He came to the shelter 12/16.***YOU MUST FILL OUT AN APPLICATION BEFORE WE DO ANY MEET AND GREETS. QUESTIONS? CONTACT pcpoundpuppies1@gmail.com
Our adoption fee is $150 which covers a portion of the dog's vetting costs. The adoption process includes the completion of an application followed by an interview.
Click here to submit an adoption application: https://pcpoundpuppies.webs.com/adoption-application
***IMPORTANT: Due to the effects of COVID-19, our Sunday adoption events at Pet Food Center have been canceled until further notice. If there is a dog you are interested in meeting, be sure to contact us and we may be able to set up a meet and greet as soon as possible.***
You can get in touch with us by email at pcpoundpuppies1@gmail.com or by phone at 812-483-4341 for more information.

animal.description:
Name: Oakley
Breed: Belgian Malinois
Age: Adult
Gender: Male

Oakley is an adult Belgian Malinois who has seen a lot in his short life and not much of it good it seems. He came in emaciated, covered in buckshot pellets, a bullet in his elbow, and terrified of the world. Quick movements, hands reaching towards him sent him to the ground expecting the worst and belly crawling away to avoid being hurt. Give him a bit to settle in, build up trust, and gain some confidence and you have yourself a total puppy who loves to run, play, fetch, swim, and have a blast. He is the stereotypical super smart, high energy Malinois once he is comfortable in a home. He is living the puppyhood he never got to have before and loving it. He is still extremely leery and on guard outside his comfort zone and with new people so looking for a home who will do some serious confidence building and training to show him that the world is a safe place and new people are not to be feared. With his foster and at his foster home, he is a silly, playful, always happy guy with a puppy spirit and endless energy. Oakley is tolerant of most other large breed dogs, but no cats or small animals for him. He is housetrained and working through some issues in the crate and doing well. He requires an experienced working dog home who will continue to train and exercise him properly both physically and mentally. He does require a physically fenced yard and an adult-only home. We do not ship our dogs so please keep that in mind if you are outside the MN/WI area.

Requirements:  Fenced yard. No cats. Adult-only home.

Interested in adopting?  Fill out a preadopt application here: https://form.jotform.com/203104540557144

You can email laurahhk9@gmail.com with questions and for a preadopt application. This dog has been spayed/neutered, vaccinated as age appropriate, tested for heartworm disease if age appropriate, and dewormed.

This dog is located in Minneapolis, MN

animal.description: We have a sweet loving Boarder collie/ Pit mix that we desperately need to find a good home for.  We adopted him through Pet Rescue North.  We've had him for 8 years and he is an absolute love but he HATES Golden retrievers with a passion (something must've happened before we got him) and wants to kill the neighbors dog.  He Has NEVER attacked a human and we have 2 young children that love him dearly.  But this is our 2d home with a neighbor w an unneutered male Golden (yes!  2d time!!) and Lucky will real through his electronic fence to get after this dog. He goes straight for the throat and It scares me so much and I don't want anything bad to happen -- to the dogs or to any person who gets in the way.  Lucky is neutered but he is very Alpha and an unneutered male is just a red flag for him.  At least an unneutered male Golden!!   He needs a good loving single dog home with lots of property to roam.  He is a super protective dog and would make someone a great pet.

animal.description:
Paris is a beautiful Shepherd mix (possibly Belgian Malinois). She is approximately 6 years old and weighs around 50lbs. She is a lovely girl who came to us from Texas after her owner surrendered her. We brought her to Seattle in the hopes that she might have a better chance at finding her forever home.

 

Paris is extremely loyal to her people.  She loves to cuddle and gives the best gentle hugs. She loves the attention of people and gives all of herself when she's with you. She would do best in a home where there is lots of human attention and someone is there much of the time.

 

Paris loves to go for walks and is an active girl who would love a family that likes to go on walks, hikes, and adventures. She is the perfect co-pilot if you travel, great in a car and LOVES to go on car rides.

 

Paris can be reactive with other dogs and would do best as the only pet in the home.  While she'll never graduate to having another pet in the home, she is continuing her training to be neighborly around other dogs on a leash using a Halti head collar. She does well in controlled settings and with proper leadership. She will need a family with reactive dog experience and strong leadership who is committed to continue working with her to overcome her reactive tendencies.

 

Paris can be protective of her home and would be best suited in a quiet, single family home in a suburban or rural neighborhood. No apartment or attached home living for her.

 

Paris's adoption fee is $200 and she is up to date on her shots, spayed and microchipped.

animal.description:
Anyone looking for a quarantine buddy? Penny is sweet pup who loves to cuddle or be near her human. She was born in approximately November 2016 Her early puppy months lacked appropriate training and socialization, so she has been in foster learning to live in a home and how to be a good pup. She is a pit mixed with a super skinny breed (maybe a Whippet or Italian Greyhound) and she weighs ~50 lbs. She likes humans but needs to be the only dog in the house. 
Penny would benefit greatly from additional, positive training. She still has a little naughty puppy inside that shows itself sometimes. Her other growth opportunity involves interacting appropriately with dogs. She ignores a clear correction from a dog that does not want to play and bites their ears to get them to interact with her. Therefore, she cannot be taken to a dog park or any other location where she is allowed to interact off leash or unsupervised with another dog. Her home must have a secure, fenced yard. She sometimes chews so she securely confined when left alone. She does not like crates but is OK in a pen. She jumps, mouths, and resource guards so her home must not include kids. 
She is spayed, up to date on shots including rabies, has tested negative for heartworm, microchipped & comes with a 2018 Hamilton County dog license (good in surrounding counties).

You can see her in action here:
•	Scene 1 – Freedom Ride: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JR7gxMIxU9Y
•	Scene 2 – Rehab = Making Friends: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N3AxrbQSJoE
•	Scene 3 – Belly Rubs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4do3ipFugEA
•	Scene 4 – The Cuddler: https://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=aWUHhMxh5Sc
•	Scene 5 – More Friends: https://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=NZ7NWVtlSRQ
•	Scene 6 – The Little Spoon: https://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=ULjd9oPZqIU
•	Scene 7 – Kitten Rescuer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YlzeOnDs5uA
•	Scene 8 – Made about missing the party: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b8ronpRk7ks
•	Scene 9 – This is awkward: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CXY9TqigAtc
No appointments to meet will be made until an application is approved for consideration. Please note that approved applications do not guarantee adoption as a meeting and home visit may also take place.
If you want to be her special human please complete an adoption application first. Go to http://www.shelteredpaws.com/adoption fill out the application online using the blue 'adoption application' button on the Sheltered Paws adoption page or go to https://form.jotform.us/71915229253154 to access the Adoption Form Questionnaire. 
If you have specific questions not covered above you can email her foster family at spcashelteredpaws@gmail.com

animal.description:
To access the home page for our group, click on Southern Comfort Maltese Rescue which will take you to the map page.  Below the map is our logo and the link to click on to access adoption forms, contact info or to donate. ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE.


Adoption Fee:  $200.00 

Humphrey is 4 1/2 years old and weighs 8.5 pounds. We feel he is a mix between a Bichon, Maltese and Poodle. He has a cute underbite that is not a problem, giving him a cute square jaw look!  He gets along great with his foster siblings, but it is unknown how he would be with cats.

Humphrey is very sweet, loves attention and loves to cuddle at night.  He is one smart little boy teaching himself to use the doggie door to potty outside.... well most of the time!  He is very active and loves to explore, so anyone adopting him would have to child proof their home. 

The above statements are all the sweet and loving things about Humphrey, but there is some sad news.  Humphrey has poly-arthritis and there is no cure for it..  Yes, at just three years old he has arthritis.  His doctors suspect his kind of arthritis was caused by some sort of infection that settled in his joints causing swelling and pain in his ankles, knees, wrists and elbows.  It is unknown when he developed this condition, but it has been long enough for him to lose most of his muscle mass in his legs and shoulders causing his muscles to atrophy.  For his pain and discomfort he is taking, Lefluncomide suspension and Adequan.  The Adequan is an injection that must be taken for life.   For now, he is not in as much pain and is able to get around much better, but because of the loss of muscle, he is not able to straighten his back legs. This will be a life long condition, and anyone adopting him must be willing and able to care for what his life will be.  He will never be able to be taken for walks, he is unable to jump onto laps or a chair or jump down, and he is not one to want to snuggle.   We have been told, because of the extensive poly-arthritis, his life expectancy will be much less than normal.

For now, the arthritis swelling is under control, there is no way to know if or when his arthritis will flair up again.  He will always have to be on medicine, so any family adopting him will need to understand this possibility and be willing to take care of any life changes that may develop for him in the future.

He also tends to want to bite and is food aggressive, meaning he will fight and bite over food.  He does have a nasty habit of eating feces's, called coprophagia.  It's difficult to control him with other dogs in the home because he is very quick.  He will stop if told no but to catch him in the act can be challenging. 

Humphrey is now enjoying life in Gainesville, FL taking in the sun until his forever family takes him home.

NOTE: SCMR DOES NOT adopt to homes with children under the age of 10 years or homes with Electric Fences

Out-of-state adoptions are possible; however, the approved adoptive home is responsible for making the necessary arrangements to pick up their new little one.

animal.description:
Happy is 40 lbs, 4 years old
Happy is all about having fun all day long.
While visiting on her farm, she wanders over to check on me w/choco Lab Puddin'.
She considers this important work, loves to be engaged in activities.

The other dogs let her take the lead and they all get along very well together.
Happy is an always first in line for treats kind of a girl.
She gently takes hers and patiently waits for the others to be given theirs.

Her tail wags non stop.

She loves having a job to do.

Happy does guard her food and treats around dogs so should be an only dog and no kids.


She's a good watch dog and is vocal as needed, but not a chronic barker as far as I can tell.    

She has a truly beautiful coat, expressive eyes, a lovely example of her breed.

Happy is Happy all the time!

MEET ANNABELLE or ANNIE !!!!!

  MEET ANNABELLE!!  

 ANNABELLE loves to play with both other dogs and humans of all ages (although she can be rude with introductions and doesn't understand when other dogs do not want to play). She can play until she drops!! She is quirky, funny and spunky. She is a very smart girl who is eager to please and learns quickly. She has a sweet personality and is a total spaz. She is a funny girl who also loves to snuggle. She is already crate trained, housebroken and is learning basic obedience commands. 

 Annabelle would be a great running buddy and will keep you laughing for hours on end if you adopt this unpredictable bundle of crazy joy!

 Annabelle will do best in a home with older kids, as she is a larger dog and could have a tendency to knock little ones down accidentally. If you would like to meet ANNABELLE, please visit our website for our application www.underdogaz.com or email us for more info at info@underdogaz.com

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

MEET UTAH !!!!!

 UTAH is a higher energy pup that will do best in a very active home that enjoys lots of play time. He has the epitome of a Boxer personality. He LOVES to play tug-of-war and is an excellent fetch dog. He can play fetch for hours, if you are game!

 Utah is doofy but would do better as an only dog or in a home with another playful submissive dog.

 Utah also LOVES the water. He very much enjoys the doggy play pool and will be an excellent swimmer if you have a regular pool. He is super playful so he needs a family willing to give him a good amount of attention and play time that he requires. He is a bigger boy, so he will do best in a home with lots of room to roam and a larger sized yard to run.

 He also likes to be a lazy couch hog at times too. He loves Netflix marathons and snuggling with his human buddy while he chews on a toy.

 He is crate trained (but doesn't love it), housebroken, and is learning basic obedience commands.

 Utah is extremely food motivated and will learn any trick you want to teach him! He could be the next skate boarder!

 Utah will do best in a home with older kids, as he is a larger dog and could have a tendency to knock little ones down accidentally. If you would like to meet UTAH, please visit our website for our application www.underdogaz.com or email us for more info at info@underdogaz.com

  

 If you would like to meet this dog, please visit our website for our adoption application, www.underdogaz.com or email info@underdogaz.com

animal.description:
Marshal (on left) is likely a Yellow Lab/Shepherd/Husky Mix - 11/2 to 2 years old - Tall and Lanky - He is loving and active! Needs an interactive family and patient training. Loves to romp with doggie friends and may like to go jogging with a human! Hank (on right) is a Yellow Lab Mix - 11/2 to 2 years old - a medium size - Great with doggie friends! He too needs some basic training and patient trusting hands. We think someone didn't have patience with hank as he was going through puppyhood and would get frustrated and miss handle him. So he needs to regain trust that you are not calling him to yell or push or hit him. He is learning that no matter why we are calling him our hands are gentle and kind! He is a naturally sweet boy! Happy Jack is a Beagle Mix - 5 years old - He is super with doggie friends! Has a tendency to actually gravitate to dogs more than people. He is an amazing dog that lived in a community on his own for 41/2 years! He was finall trapped and found his way to SFA. You can't ask for a sweeter boy. No aggression ever! He just needs patient humans! 
We do recommend if you are serious about adopting to submit our SFA consideration form prior to visiting! This also helps facilitate the adoption process and allows the form to go to the adoption counselor for the animal you are interested in adopting! The proper counselor can then answer your questions via email! Thank you! 
Visit  www.solutionsforanimals.org  for Consideration Form! (The petfinder form is NOT our Consideration Form and may delay response time)

animal.description:
Est DOB: 02/01/14

 Approx weight: 25lbs

 Blakey is an absolutely adorable dog who was let down badly by his previous owners. They dropped him off at a kill shelter when he was suffering badly from colitis. Blakey was underweight and in a lot of pain. Thankfully we were able to help him.

 Blakey does need to be on a special diet and an enzyme powder for the rest of his life, however the enzyme medication is not expensive and the food is no more expensive than a good quality dog food.

 Unfortunately previous owners not only let him down when he got sick but also could not be bothered to give him heart worm prevention every month, because of this Blakey is heart worm positive. Thankfully this has been caught early, please do not rule him out because of it. He is on the slow approach to treatment which is not as hard on the dog as other treatment options you may have heard of. We will provide medication for this treatment approach for FREE!

 Although Blakey has some health needs, he is a dog that would really bring so much joy to a family. He is gorgeous with an amazingly soft coat, loyal and calm. Crate trained and house trained (although please expect an adjustment period) and has been good with all of the dogs in his foster home, the teenagers in the foster home (when they come home from university) and a visiting 2 year old and baby.

 Please consider making this adorable boy a member of your family and contact us to arrange to meet him.

 $140 adoption fee includes core vaccinations, rabies vaccination, heart worm test (in dogs over 6 months of age), microchip and registration, spay/neuter, wormer and flea and heart worm prevention while the dog is in our care.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

All of the animals posted on our site have been temperament tested. While not all are in the immediate area, once we have processed and approved your application, we will move the dog to our adoptive area for you to meet, greet and hopefully adopt. Sometimes we will have more than one application on a dog. That does not mean it automatically goes to another family but you should be aware of the fact that until you are approved and set up for the meet/greet.. the dog could get adopted by another applicant.



Echo is a sweet, calm 8 yr old Malamute. She is a small girl, weighing in at only 44lbs. Echo is looking for her bucket list buddy .She had bone cancer in her leg and walked around the streets in NC for several months with her leg broke in several places until she came to us at Wolf Spirit Sled Dog rescue. We had her leg amputated and gave her a year longer to enjoy a happy life. She is at the moment a happy active girl that loves car rides and walks. Her chest x-rays are clear. She is also heart worm positive we are doing the slow-kill treatment on her to rid her of those. She would really like a loving home to call her own for what time she has left. Echo is house broke, doesn't seem to mind cats that i have noticed, doesn't mind other dogs as long as they are gentle. We know how hard it is to lose a friend but she would really love a home of her own.E cho is up to date on her vaccines, dewormed, and microchipped. We will send 6 months of heartworm treatment with her. She will need another heartworm test in 6 months which we will pay for. 

If interested in Echo please contact Debbie at janrose@swva.net

Gypsy is a 3-year-old Boxer mix who came to Ruff Life after being found abandoned in a yard.  Gypsy weighs about 45 pounds.  

Gypsy is a sweet girl who adores her foster family, but is shy around new people and environments.  She is getting better as we expose her to more people, and comes out of her shell around other dogs. Gypsy is very playful, loves to cuddle and is very submissive! Gypsy is house and crate trained, knows sit and is learning leash skills. 

Medical
•Allergic to chicken (easily manageable with food!)

Requirements
•Another dog
•5-6 ft privacy fence

Our adoption fee is $250. Gypsy is spayed, heartworm negative, microchipped, fully vaccinated, dewormed, and fecal tested. She is on monthly heartworm and flea/tick prevention. 

Please visit ruffliferescue.com for information on meeting and/or adopting Gypsy!

*Adoptions only within 60 miles radius of Fort Mill, SC - Adoption process, requirements and application can be found at adopt.ruffliferescue.com*

animal.description:
Boiling him down to two words is helpful when learning to understand Roger. Hunting. Dog. Roger embodies pretty much every beautifully rugged characteristic of a textbook hunting dog, including a need to be understood, appreciated, and supported of his uncommon combination of strengths (so he can stay out of trouble!). Adventurous, hard-working, and trusting --- with a couple dashes of goofiness --- is a good way to begin unpacking this sophisticated yet simple (and special) pooch.

Roger is a smart guy with an amazingly sensitive nose. Of course, this is popular amongst hunting breeds, but what makes Roger different is his work ethic --- Roger LOVES to earn his kudos! Responsive to verbal praise, Roger's spirit gently lights up when he's caught doing something right. This is an important component for Roger's future --- his need to work and earn. If not given a regular "job", Roger is likely at risk of making one up on his own, which often backfires. He is also a confident, healthy guy who, while somewhat dominant in his personality, doesn't need a lot to gain his loyalty to follow you yet needs a strong leader.

We don't know too much about his first few years of life, but he does seem to have a few symptoms of being mistreated at one time. He sometimes winces with certain hand motions. However, after spending a little bit of time with him focused on shoring up his strengths, you can almost see him slowly begin to relax and trust. It's actually quite an endearing process.

Roger will thrive in a home who wants to genuinely "rescue" him --- take him under his wing, learn his nuances and needs, and commit to helping him unfold in the wake of a confusing context. Because of his understandable prey drive, Roger needs a home with no cats or small animals in the home. A fenced yard will probably be helpful, but not required. An interest in nurturing his "nose skill" is highly encouraged. Second dog is possible and will be considered case-by-case after a dog introduction. Adult only home (no children).

Contact the front office today to schedule an appointment only Trainer Meet-N-Greet.
animal.name: Garrabito Roger

animal.description:
PLEASE SHARE!??

I’ve dreaded writing this post but here we go. 

**Tugger is a 5 year old Catahoula mix, he is neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, dewormed, and ready to finally find his forever family! He is adoptable through Furever Buddy's Dog Rescue and his adoption fee is $100 (but if I find the right family I will gladly pay his fee)**

I have been fostering Tugger for around 8 months, I would 100% adopt him if I could but it’s just not feasible right now. We are moving and unfortunately he isn’t allowed to come, I need to find different placement for him soon. Whether it’s an adopter or foster through Furever Buddy's Dog Rescue or another rescue placement, he needs to find a place to go. 
As many of you know Tugger was rescued from a hoarding situation at 7 months old back in 2016, he sat in a kennel for over THREE YEARS before I finally took him home as a foster. 
Tugger has a bite history but it is not extensive and all were provoked. Since he’s been with me he has bitten three times. 
He nipped at a small child who was running around the corner and startled him, it didn’t break skin just bruised. 
A few months later he bit a teenage girl who was walking him and she tripped slightly and ran into him which resulted in two separate bites neither of which broke skin (just tore her clothing). 
The most recent one was when my dad (whom Tugger is unfamiliar with) was holding his leash and started waving his arms to get someone’s attention and Tugger jumped up and grabbed his shirt resulting in some scratches on the skin and a ripped shirt but nothing serious. 

Tugger is still uneasy about being touched even by me sometimes but he has never even attempted to bite me. ?I have been able to give him baths, put his harnesses on, and pick him up to load him in cars without issues. He is fine with being touched by a number of my friends and family. He does not want to hurt people, he is not aggressive in any way. He is fear reactive. 

He would do best in a home experienced with dog behavior and training, he can co exist with small children but I wouldn’t recommend a home with kids under 12 for him. 

Tugger loves to play fetch and is treat motivated. He still hasn’t been able to figure out learning tricks yet but someday I’m sure he will get there. He loves picking out his toys at tractor supply/ petco, he likes to “de-fluff” all his toys and rip the squeakers out. He keeps a clean kennel, rarely rips his beds or blankets up, and eats 5 cups of food morning and night. 

Tugger walks well on a leash, does well with other dogs but isn’t a huge fan of pushy dominant dogs, he needs to be supervised with cats and chickens. 

He gets the CUTEST zoomies whenever he gets fed, gets to go for a car ride, plays fetch, watches a leaf blow away, or literally any other time he gets excited about anything?

He does great off leash once he knows you, he’ll gladly go in any house or car and make himself at home as long as he has his person. He attaches to one person more than anyone else and he’ll trust you with anything once you’re that person. 

He loves car rides just make sure you don’t over feed him before a long one??. He listens to corrections very well and has done great on an e-collar for recall training! 

Tugger is such a great dog, he loves to run and hike. He’s always up for an adventure. Wildlife doesn’t phase him, he just wants to stay with his person. 

PLEASE contact me at (435)-401-5037 with any questions regarding Tuggy! I’m happy to answer any questions I can!
animal.name: Tugger

animal.description:
Once again, PAWS has stepped up to help with several amazing dogs retired from a breeding operation. They are the sweetest dogs and will make amazing companions. They are a little unsure of their surroundings right now as their human contact has been limited, but they are sweet beyond belief. Adopters must understand that dogs from these types of facilities have had little interaction with people and it will take time and patience for them to understand and develop their connection with their family.  It will be worth the effort.  

After over 3 years in a home, Chase and the older resident canine decided they were no longer friends.  Perhaps Chase was being a bit mean after the other dog lost his vision.   Chase is again available for adoption.  He is now about 6 years old.  He may do best as an only dog.

3 year old Chase is such a sweet, kissy little guy which is unusual for the boys.  He'll be an amazing addition to some lucky adopter's home.
Chase will be vaccinated, neutered and microchipped prior to adoption.  Any dental work needed in the opinion of our vet will be done as well.  Chase's adoption fee is $200.
PAWS has added the H3N2 flu vaccine to its shot protocol.  Every dog is being vaccinated upon intake.  Depending on how long they're here with us, they may received a second vaccination but if adopted right away, we urge adopters to get a second flu shot for their new family member to ensure as much protection against the flu as possible.
To meet our incredible dogs and offer them the love they deserve, stop by PAWS on Friday, Saturday or Sunday from 10 - 4 PM, call us at 217-243-7297.  We do applications in person or over the phone.  You can also see pictures on our Facebook page, PAWS Jackson.

animal.description:
DOLLY





Meet Dolly!

Dolly has had a ruff time finding a perfect furever home. She is 9 years old and has been in and out of the shelter several times in the last 4 years. She is your typical chi, loving, needy, friendly lap dog, on her terms! she does not care to be man handled or to have her space invaded. I met her at the shelter and she let me scoop her up and take her for a walk, she loves to go for walks! And boy does she need it, she is VERY over weight! She probably weighs 11 lbs and should weigh 8lbs. She will need someone who understands her quirks and a home with no children or visiting children under the age of 13 to ensure they are old enough to respect her space. Today her new life starts! Also her new diet.

Please check back as we learn more about Dolly


Please email Angela (areeves13@hotmail.com) for information about Dolly.

animal.description:
Muffin is a year old now.  She is a very sweet, adoring big girl, but is still a puppy.  She is crate trained and house trained with supervision.  She will bark when she needs to go outside.  She is enjoying this cooler weather but loves to be inside with her foster parents.  She would do best in a home with a dog her size or larger that is submissive to her, as she thinks she should be “top dog” in the home.  She would also do well as an only dog.  She is about 65 lbs, so she is not as large as a purebred Saint Bernard.  We don’t know what she is mixed with.  She likes children and would do well with older children.
Muffin  is in a foster home in Wichita, Kansas and will not be shipped. Requirements to adopt Muffin are as follows: Her adopter will have to be in the Wichita Metro area or surrounding area; no out-of-state adopters because we need to do a home visit. A secure fenced yard is a must; invisible fences not acceptable. A veterinarian reference is required showing that your present/past pets are up-to-date on shots, spayed/neutered and on heartworm prevention. Her adoption fee is $200.00. For information on how to apply to adopt Muffin, please go to our website www.palsrescue.org

animal.description: We have so many great dogs in our program, but Brandy, with her tiny quotation mark ears, is the one who has grabbed our hearts.  She is fiercely loyal and so, so smart. She adores treats and tennis balls and sitting inside our tiny visitors cottage.  She loves the toys in there and the fluffy bed and the little ottoman we sit on side by side.  We spend a lot of time talking with her about the weather or our week or the obvious fact she is the best good girl.  Brandy has been waiting years for a home, largely because she needs the right fit. And adult home with a strong routine would be optimal.  She loves playing fetch and is excellent at it.  Brandy is a tripod, but she has no idea she has any limitations, so please, please don't tell her she is any different from any other playful, graceful, athletic dog. Brandy likes other dogs but tanked rather miserably on her cat test.  She needs an adult home, preferably with someone who can work with her and help her adjust to life outside of the shelter, which is all she has known for a while.

animal.description:
Rhea is a pretty, medium-sized female Doberman with natural ears and a docked tail. She was given up because her owners did not have the know-how or time to devote to raising a big, high energy puppy. 

Rhea is a very dominant, energetic, and smart Doberman. She is pushy with other dogs and tends to do best with dominant male dogs or very social male dogs that can put up with her. 

Rhea was adopted, but was returned because she was aggressive towards the cats in the household and she nipped at a couple of people. Rhea needs an experienced Doberman owner that can give her the mental and physical exercise that she needs. She is very athletic and would be a good candidate for agility, nose works, obedience or some other dog sport where she could expend her energy and talents. 

Rhea is crate-trained and housebroken. She was born in October of 2016.
animal.name: Rhea

animal.description:
Rock is 5 year old Egyptian Baladi/Shepherd  mix. He is good with cats and most dogs. He can be timid with strangers. He is housebroken. He needs a home with kids over 15 and adopters with get free in-home training so they can help him overcome his fear of new people.

Our cats and dogs are at our Rehabilitation Center in East Patchogue, NY or in private foster homes. They are available to see by appointment. Email Adoptions@pawsunitepeople.com for more information. 
Our cats and dogs are not available to be adopted out of state via a transporter. All of our animals require meet and greets, we do home visits and reference checks. If you are willing to travel to meet the pet and live out of area, feel free to inquire, but we will not send any animal to a home sight unseen.

animal.description:
Reading, PA ---
Jazmine is a beautiful 5-6 year old, 65 lb. female pit bull with a rich caramel-colored coat and absolutely spectacular ears. A very intelligent and lovable girl, Jazmine is fully housebroken and knows all of her basic commands, including give-paw, and she even sits upright when you give her the command “Uppies” and will stay that way to pose for a photo! She is a strong, athletic pup who loves going on walks, she especially loves to play fetch with a ball, and even prefers to have her feet cleaned after playing outside — a tomboy yet a true girly-girl! She loves to bond with her humans and is super generous with hugs and kisses. This lovely lady needed some help learning appropriate behaviors so she was sent to doggy rehabilitation and recently graduated with flying colors! Now, she’s waiting for a new Foster or Adopter so she can leave her training facility. 

***** Here’s what her TRAINERS have to say:
“Jasmine has learned so much and is excited to find her very own home that can continue all the work she started. She has learned how to share her toys and space with others, play with male and female dogs, and walk nicely on a leash. As she loves to exercise, Jazmine would thrive in an athletic home that will provide healthy outlets for her energy by giving her long walks, hikes, or even run or bike with her! Now she is looking for a home with experienced owners of guardian-breed dogs who can provide the disciplined leadership that she needs to help her maintain her new stable, relaxed, confident behavior in a calm, structured, and balanced environment in which she can excel. A home with either similarly-sized dogs or where she can be an only dog would be best (no small dogs or cats). She enjoys playing with her canine companions and loves a good game of chase and some body checking that would make the NHL proud! Due to her size and activity level, a home with no young children would be best. Her new home should be a patient one that is willing to provide an adjustment period where she is given the opportunity to properly acclimate and learn the people, rules, pets, and new environment while building a foundation of trust and confidence in her new ‘pack-leader/s’. After all the hard work that Jazzy has put into working on her new behaviors, she is so excited to finally find a new foster - or preferably her own adopter - who is ready to start this journey together.” 

******* PLEASE NOTE: The wonderful team who worked hard with Jazmine has graciously offered to provide training guidance and assistance to her new family throughout the transition period to help ensure her continued success. Help us reward her for all of her hard work by getting her into a new home ASAP! She is up to date on vaccinations, microchipped, spayed and ready to find her forever home. 

----- If you are interested in opening your heart and home to Jazmine for FOSTER or ADOPT, please contact mastiffmojo@msn.com or 484-220-0418 and please be sure to complete our application online at www.almosthomeanimalsanctuary.com.  Thank you for caring about a pet in need!

animal.description:
Hi my name is Harvey! I’m about 3.5 years old and currently weigh 50lbs. I am working on my New Year's resolution to lose 5 more pounds.

My report card from doggie daycare: (see video of me playing)
Charming, confident, playful, and sooo cute!  Harvey is an amazing daycare dog.  He channels his inner working dog and absolutely loves burning off his energy by chasing his friends around the yard.  His play style is perfect and fits with every dog he makes friends with.  He is an attention seeker and loves nudging staff to get all the head rubs and ear scratches throughout the day.  Harvey is going to make a family extremely happy that they adopted him.

Harvey's best fit:
I really love women pack leaders.  I'm looking for an active family that will help keep me fit and give me lots of outlets for physical and mental stimulation - I am a working dog after all.  Potential jobs for me could be herding livestock, daily walks or runs, chasing balls or frisbees, or doing fun dog sports like agility. I have good recall and know basic commands. I love going to doggie daycare and burning off my energy.  Harvey has amazing potty manners and will just need to get acclimated to his new home and your routine.

Harvey's needs:
I will need a strong pack leader to give me direction and correct me when I need it. I would do well in a home with another active, playful dog and in a home that has kids aged middle to high school that could actively participate in my care. I also tend to prefer females over males.  Sometimes I get fearful of men and I might growl, but this doesn't happen with all men.

You can come adopt me or even join our foster program to help the humans learn all the awesome things about new dogs like me! Learn more on our website!

Hope to see you soon!

Educational articles:
3/3/3 Rule;
https://www.rescuedogs101.com/bringing-new-dog-home-3-3-3-rule/?fbclid=IwAR2iv5m7fqk3FieO7LOsstGeGsYYV_F1rJOd1BPxaImofLpcinpYsUbFRWs

Adoption Donations are $250 for an adult, $350 for puppies (a dog under one year of age), and $125 for a senior dog (based on the age of the dog). Adoption donations are to be made via cash, and credit/debit card. There is a $5 fee to run cards.

Please remember to bring a collar and leash (non-retractable) with you the day of the adoption. Note: Martingale collars and slip leads are strongly recommended.

Due to COVID19, we aren't having as many open, public adoption events. Current schedule is pre-determined meet and greet appointments are Wednesday evenings and on Saturday from 12-2.
Our adoption center is located at 3602 Lafayette Blvd, Suite 102, Fredericksburg, VA 22408. It's important that you keep an eye on your emails for any changes or updates during the adoption process.

Visit our website for an application to adopt.
https://www.olddominionhumanesociety.org/adoption-application

Old Dominion Humane Society is a volunteer based organization. We are run completely by volunteers, who also have full time jobs, so we appreciate your patience. Currently, the average timeframe for a response to your application is 1 week.

Like us on Facebook "Old Dominion Humane Society"
and be a part of promoting forever homes for dogs in need.
#Adopt #Donate #Foster #Volunteer

Note: ODHS only adopts to Virginia and surrounding states (including D.C.). A $50 out of state fee applies.

animal.description:
Meet Maryann! She is a 6 year old Min Pin who came from a hoarding situation. She has had a tough past but is ready to meet her furever family! Maryann enjoys being with other dogs and would prefer a home with them but it's not a requirement. She is a shy girl who enjoys her personal space unless she has had time to feel comfortable around you. Her foster mom respects Maryann's space and as a reward, Maryanne will ask her for head scratches from time to time but it did take her a while to trust her foster mom. She will only ask for head scractchs in you are sitting or laying down. She will run if you are standing up. If you stop giving her attention, she'll gently touch you with her paw to ask for more! Silly pup. A calm, quiet home would be best for this little lady and she would absolutely love potty pads or a fenced yard to roam in during potty breaks as leashes scare her. Her favorite thing in the whole world is food...and you will gain her heart by giving her treats. When it is time for dinner she circles and barks because she is so excited. Who doesn't love a good meal?! Maryanne really deserves a loving family of her own! She came from a hoarding case of 67 dogs who were living in their own feces. Her past was sad and dark but her future could be very bright with you!

The adoption fee for this pretty girl is $175. She has been spayed, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines!

Want to meet Maryann? Submit an adoption application via the link below and someone will be in touch to schedule a meet n greet to see if shes the right match for you!

animal.description:
Spirit is an enchanting and energetic Border Collie about 30 pounds and 7 years old.  She's deaf but her vision is fabulous.   Spirit is a double merle, a type of pattern that results in blindness or deafness in dogs.  Even though she can't hear, she is incredibly adaptive and is absolutely dedicated to the art of fun!  She loves to play catch, chase balls, bring the ball back to you, and toss it to you too!  Spirit also loves walks and will keep up with your pace and adventuring.   She is very bossy, typical of her breed, and we are looking for someone with breed experience so that she can live her very best life!  Spirit takes a medication for arthritis pain relief and also takes joint support supplements daily as well!  

YOU CAN SPONSOR SPIRIT'S CARE IN RESCUE BY CLICKING ON THE SPONSOR BUTTON ON THIS PAGE or DIRECTLY ON THE RESCUE'S WEBSITE: www.onmywayhomerescue.com. Thank you so very much for caring and supporting our rescue mission!


You can apply to adopt or foster at http://www.onmywayhomerescue.com/how-to-adopt.html.

Out of state adoption available. 

This cutie is super friendly and loves attention and to be pet . If you are looking for a calm large dog, Ringo is your fellow.  He is a very large dog  and weighs about 86 lbs and his pictures do not do him justice  He is gentle, very well mannered and calm and walks well on a leash.  He is calm inside and does very well.  He enjoys relaxing inside on a blanket or couch.. He really prefers laying around rather than a lot of activity.  He is 6-7 years old .  He does struggle with arthritis in his back legs/hips but it really does not bother him much unless he takes really long walks. He really just prefers to be pet and lay around in his senior years. He would love to be your friend!   We always take the fur babies back into our care if for any reason it does not work out.


NOTE FOR RINGO STAR IF YOU LIVE OUT OF STATE TRANSPORTATION TO YOUR LOCATION IS POTENTIALLY AVAILABLE WITH AN APPROVED HOME STUDY/APPLICATION.  PLEASE INQUIRE IF INTERESTED IN FINDING OUT MORE AND WE CAN CONTACT PET TRANSPORTERS TO GET A QUOTE FOR YOU.
