animal.description:
If you do not see a dog posted on our site that you feel is a good fit for your situation, please come back and visit us again.

Our Adoptable Pets page is regularly updated with new pets.  There are currently a number of dogs in foster care being assessed and/or receiving medical treatments who will be coming up for adoption as soon as their foster parents feel they are ready to find their forever homes.

Ugly Mutts Rescue Team works very closely with a number of pounds and shelters and are continually assessing dogs that are in need of rescue to be brought into our care.   We also work with caring pet owners to help them find suitable, loving homes for their pets when for some unfortunate reason they are no longer able to continue caring for them.

Fostering is a good opportunity for those who are considering adoption but have not yet determined whether they are wanting to make a lifetime commitment to a pet.   Ugly Mutts Rescue Team is very good at selecting dogs that are a good match for their foster family's situation which is why so many of our rescued dogs are adopted by their fosters and never make it to the adoptable pets page.  We can only save the number of pets that we have foster homes to care for them so, please consider helping Ugly Mutts save lives and become a foster parent today.

For more information please visit our main website at http://uglymuttsdogrescue.com

animal.description:
MARGO HAS BEEN ADOPTED AT THIS TIME. Margo is a total cutie pie who is sweet as can be and the kind of dog you can't help but feel happy around because her personality is so joyful.  She is about 4 years old and weighs 50 pounds.  She has been here for a long time and would love a home of her own with people that would love her for the rest of her life. She was found as a lost doggie.  She is a hound with beautiful markings.  Margo is spayed, housebroken, up to date with her vaccinations, micro-chipped, and heartworm negative.  She knows the commands of sit, stay, and lay down and walks nicely on a leash.

Margo came from a high kill shelter in Georgia where.her time was almost up.  She is a high energy dog who loves to play and run around in the yard with the other dogs.  She is wonderful with people or dogs.  We don't know how she is with cats.  She has shown no aggression since coming here and only seems to have a loving, sweet nature for anyone who comes her way.  

We think she would be fine with older children but because of her energy level may accidentally knock young children down.  Margo loves to play with her toys, including balls, tugs and hard bones; which she loves to bite on.  

Because Margo is a high energy dog a fenced yard would be a must so she would be able to run around and be safe and secure.  

If u think Margo might fit in your family, please call Judi at (908) 510-8721 or send me an application for her. Just click on the Application Button and return it to Save Us Dog Rescue at fries3@aol.com

animal.description:
Beautiful, sweet, loving, well behaved, gorgeous Buffy.  She is a white, female, pointer/shepherd mix dog with brown spots on her ears and very pale brown spots on her fur.  She is a very unique looking dog.  Buffy is approximately 
5 years old, 50 pounds, housebroken, up to date on her vaccinations, spayed, micro-chipped and heartworm negative.  She also has the most gorgeous white eye lashes. Buffy 
knows how to sit and will do so when asked.  She is a little shy but loves giving and getting love. She is so sweet and loving. 

Buffy came from a kill shelter in Georgia where her time was almost up.  Since coming into rescue she has shown no aggression but only sweetness.  She is a high energy dog who loves to play with her toys, including balls and hard bones which she loves to bite on.  She takes her treats very gently.  We believe that she would be great with children, but care should be taken with  young children who could be knocked over by accident through play.  

Buffy is fine and friendly with most other dogs and enjoys running around and playing with them here.  A secure fenced yard would be important for this dog so she could run safely free.  We don't know how she is with cats.  Buffy is so loving and sweet and is so deserving of a loving home. Please give her a chance.  She has been waiting for a long time. 

If u think Buffy might be a good match for your family,  please send an application to Save Us Dog Rescue at fries3@aol.com   Buffy is so deserving of a forever, loving home. If u would like to talk to me about her, please call Judi at (908) 510-8721.

Junior is a 6 year old Heeler/Aussie/Beagle mix who was an owner surrender.  It seems Junior was a bit too active and had to be kept on a chain which is sort of sad.  He is a super happy dog, never met a stranger, loves to go to the vet, the grocery store, the dry cleaners, and all other places.  He is very short and stumpy but very thick and fat on his short and stumpy legs. He is selective with his dog friends and seems to prefer the ladies. 
He does not lack for self-confidence and considers himself to be a pretty terrific guy.  Junior is very good about not pottying in his kennel and does his best to hold it for outside exercise time.  Junior is one of those silly dogs who makes you giggle because of his physical appearance and is silly demeanor.  Please ask about an application for him today!

animal.description:
Babs is little big-eared girl who LOVES toys!! Babs has had a bit of a rough start despite being young. She had emergency surgery in December of 2017 to repair a herniated disc that was causing her severe discomfort and pain. She has recovered well but because of this she needs a home with very few or no stairs. 
She still loves to run and play even after her surgery so a home with a fenced-in yard is a must. 

Babs needs a home with no other pets due to her surgery. One wrong move while playing could completely reverse all of the repairs that were made. She loves to get pets and rubs. 

Could you be Babs' peanut butter to her jelly?

animal.description:
Name: Skyy

Approximate Age: Approx. 2yrs old

Breed: Pit mix

Sex: Female

Special Needs: Allergies

Adoption fee: $300.00

Up to date on vaccinations/preventatives, spayed, house/crate trained, microchipped

I came to the rescue back in 2016 from a high kill shelter in Texas. The conditions werent the best to say the least and oh yeah, I was SUPER pregnant. Not a good place for a expecting mom. Thankfully, I was taken from there just in time and was able to have my puppies in a foster home. I was even thrown a huge baby shower by a ton of people who follow SNARR! I was so happy to finally have had my babies and be out of the shelter but my excitement quickly became tragedy. Not long after giving birth, almost half of my babies passed away- only 4 survived. 
Now that my remaining pups have gone to live their own liveshere I sit and wait. While I adore my foster mom, I want a home to call my own. 
Im confused on why I dont have my own home yet Im incredibly adorable and Im hands down the most wiggly tushed pocket pittie youll ever meet! I have never met a person I didnt like, however dogs.not too fond of dogs or any other furry little creatures. I blame that on my high prey drive and Im very smart when it comes down to it- I can be a pro stalker and Im lightning fast so its best that the temptation isnt there in forever home. Give me any kind of human though and its nothing but hugs (literally, I give hugs) and kisses! 
Due to having allergies, I take Benedryl and cannot eat chicken.

Transport to any approved home within the US can be provided at no additional fee
Currently Skyy is located in Lawrenceville, Georgia.


Please visit SNARRANIMALRESCUE.org to fill out an adoption application and our adoption requirements/process can also be found there!

animal.description:
FRANK THE TANK is now heartworm free and looking for a home. We are seeking a longhaul truck driver for him or someone who is home most of the day. Frank absolutely loves to ride. If the truck door is open he is ready to ride..... When we first got Frank he suffered terribly from separation anxiety. I don't know if it had anything to do with the circumstances of how he was found. ( Someone had tied him to a light pole in a rural part of the parish.) Fortunately time and lots of love has taught him he can trust us to come back. He now can be kenneled for 4 or 5 hours during the day and all night long without any problems! He needs a non rural environment. He delights in defeathering my roosters and chasing the domestic rabbits until they die of fright. He is good with the cats, other dogs, and people.- just not chickens or rabbits.   He also loves kids!  

Frank is approximately 6 years old and currently weighs around 80 pounds.  

Frank is up for adoption through Swampy Paws and his adoption fee is $200 which includes all vaccinations, dewormer, flea/heartworm prevention, heartworm treatment, vet check and neuter. 

A fenced yard and home visit are REQUIRED to adopt. 

For more info call 225-772-8836 or email swampypaws4@yahoo.com

animal.description:
PHOTOS:  Virtually all of our dogs have online PHOTO ALBUMS through SmugMug with LOTS of additional pictures.  Just copy and paste the link below into your browser (or simply type it in) and then search for the dog's "gallery" by name

          http://adoptasleddog.smugmug.com

VIDEOS:  In addition to photo albums, almost every dog has a video which will give you a much better "feel" for his or her personality.  Please make sure you CHECK ON THE PETFINDER VIDEO ICON, above, to see a video of this wonderful dog!  Our videos will include, at a minimum, whatever info we had on the dog upon (or shortly after) his/her arrival into our program.  There will sometimes be video updates as well.  And in every case, our Adoptions Coordinator can be emailed at ADOPTASLEDDOG@AOL.COM to answer questions and provide the most current information we have on the dog.  

NOTES:  Please see video or contact our Adoptions Coordinator at ADOPTASLEDDOG@AOL.COM.

ADOPTION DONATION:  $250  Before adoption, all Northern Lights dogs (regardless of whether Petfinder's symbols appear) are spayed or neutered, microchipped, heartworm negative, fully vaccinated and tested/treated for known parasites.
 
WHAT TO DO IF YOU WANT TO ADOPT THIS DOG:  Email us at ADOPTASLEDDOG@AOL.COM to request an application and get started.  WE DO NOT HAVE AN ONLINE APPLICATION - you will have to request one via email.  We will review your application to determine if there is a good fit between you and/or your family and this dog.  We may suggest another dog or dog(s) if we can offer a better fit in terms of lifestyle, experience, other pets, etc.  A vet check, reference checks, and a home visit will be conducted before an adoption can be considered for approval.  
 
NORTHERN LIGHTS DOES NOT HAVE A PHYSICAL SHELTER.  We are a nonprofit rescue organization comprised of individuals who open their private homes to foster dogs in need of a second chance..  When fosters are not available, we often pay to board a dog until space is available.  New fosters and donations to pay for boarding are always desperately needed us.  Email us at KATYLIED2@AOL.COM if you are interested in donating or for information on fostering.
 
FAQ:  For information regarding our organization, as well as adoption policies and practices, please visit our Petfinder Home Page at WWW.NORTHERNLIGHTS.PETFINDER.COM.
 
 
NOTICE:  In the vast majority of cases, the dogs in our program and rescued from shelters, and Northern Lights has no means by which to collect or verify a dog's history.  We work in concert with our veterinarians, and breed and age estimates are based on a combination of professional input and our collective experience.  Our policy with information acquired prior to acceptance and while the dogs are in our care is that of "full disclosure".  It is our goal to ensure the adopter has all available information to ensure the best possible match between the dog and the adopter(s).  If we have identified a behavioral or health condition while the dog is in our care and custody, every effort will be made to correct it prior to adoption, OR the adopter will be made aware of the issue or condition prior to adoption.  Northern Lights' screening process is designed to identify only those adopters who are willing, and have the means, to treat conditions which may occur after adoption, and the adopter will be contractually responsible for doing so. However, Northern Lights' policy is to accept any adopted dog back into the program, at any time, for any reason.

animal.description:
Chai is a very handsome and sweet big boy. He loves people, he is house trained, well behaved on the leash and around the house.
Chai is dog selective, getting along best mostly with females, and he would be good around older calmer cats. Because of his size and rough play, he would do best with adults only. He is a lover and can be a great companion but someone with experience would be better.
Chai enjoys long walks, being outdoor in the sun and spending his time with the people he loves. Whoever meets him is very impressed by his sweet personality and his playful joyful affection, but he can also be a bit mouthy when over excited. We recommend a very quiet and experienced home for him, someone who can be firm and assertive because in fact responds better to men than women and we have noticed that he needs a strong personality to keep him calm and well behaved.
Chai is always ready to go with you on your next adventure or just to be in the sun. A beautiful adult dog of about 70 lbs he just needs a stable home.

animal.description:
Meet Creed!

This big guy is looking for a special person or couple to call his own. He is a strong boy with a lot of spunk and sometimes doesn't realize his size when he's barreling around. Because of this, we'd prefer a home without small kids. He is a sweet boy, he's just still working on personal space and boundaries. 

Creed is 4 years old and is completely vetted meaning he is neutered, vaccinated, HW-, microchipped and on monthly flea/tick/heart worm prevention. 

He has a lot of potential to grow into a well rounded family dog, he just needs someone ready to continue polishing him to help him shine! 

Creed enjoys chewing his nylabones, going for car rides, and getting belly rubs. He really enjoys chasing his ball around the yard, and finding big sticks to carry and chew on. 

This handsome fellas personality is as big as his head, and we can't wait to see what lucky person or people make him theirs forever! 

To meet Creed, please first submit an application at mercysdoorpetrescue.org. This is the first step in the adoption process. If meet and greets are successful, we place the dogs on a trial adoption for two weeks to see how they settle in, and ensure they are the right fit. 

If you think Creed might be a good match for you, please submit your application at www.mercysdoorpetrescue.org. His adoption fee is $175.

animal.description:
Hi! My name is Chandler, and my foster mom and I are looking for my VERY OWN forever home. Let me tell you about myself. I am past the puppy stages, and I have Level 1 Basic Training experience. I know SIT, WAIT, SHAKE, ROLL OVER, DOWN, PLAY DEAD, and I'm eager to learn even more! My foster mom says it will be very important for my new owner to reinforce training practice in my new home to keep my skills sharp. This is fun for me, too, since I love to work for treats! She can give you lots of tips on how to do this.
I am HOUSE TRAINED and CRATE TRAINED, and keeping me in my crate when unsupervised in my new home will help me to be my BEST self. I really enjoy CHEW TOYS, like maybe a KONG or DEER ANTLER to keep me busy when we are not going on adventures together. After our activities, I would love to share a CUDDLE or two! One thing to note is that I can get very excited when I know we're going for a walk or a car ride, so using CALM, ASSERTIVE leadership at those times is very important. 
An IDEAL HOME for me is one where I can be included in lots of activities, get daily exercise, and be the only KING in the CASTLE. I would do best as an ONLY DOG, and in a home with NO CHILDREN, since they can be too much for me. However, it is possible that I can live in a home with a CAT, if we are introduced SLOWLY. A yard would be great, but please MONITOR ME CLOSELY, to be sure I don't try to be an escape artist, since my foster mom does not have a fenced yard. One last thing that would help me to be the BEST BOY EVER please be patient with me as I meet all of the people in your household, as well as friends. I'm the kind of guy who needs some TLC in new situations, but once I'm comfortable, I'll soak up all the attention you can give. 
If you think we might be a PAWFECT MATCH, or have any questions, please email my foster mom at stephanie331@yahoo.com. You can also see me in action on my own YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/
Or my very own Facebook page, Chandler the unwanted pit bull. You can see me and all my adventures. Primary Color: Red Brown Weight: 64.5lbs Age: 8yrs 6mths 2wks Animal has been Neutered

animal.description:
Affectionate! Easy to Please! Uber Smart! House-Trained!

Quinn is a sweet, playful, belly-rubbing girl who pretty much just wants a family to live with forever. Our beauty queen is shy in new situations, and so she needs a home with lot’s of love and patience. Quinn would do well in almost any home, though she prefers older kids and she has so much love to give. In addition to being a gentle soul, Quinn keeps her kennel clean, and is working on basic commands. Consider meeting this 4 year old sweetheart. Your heart will melt. 

Quinn is slow to warm up but once she does, she loves unconditionally.  She had a female best friend who was adopted and we haven't been able to pair her with a new friend since.  

We prefer older/no kids since she is slow to warm up to new people.

Quinn’s adoption fee is $300 which includes her spay, microchip, fecal exam, and vaccinations up to date. 

Please note:  

= All dogs require a $100 training deposit. Once confirmation of the completion of a training class has been sent to the rescue, you will receive your deposit back in full.

 = When emailing please include your phone number to help speed up the adoption process. 

= For the safety of our dogs, we only adopt within a 2 hour radius from Joliet to allow our volunteers to do home checks, if necessary.

animal.description:
Dahlia adores people and that is her gift to the world. Dogs like her are often discarded by horrible people but their zest for seeking joy makes them survivors. This beautiful dog was found sitting on a good person's porch after just having puppies -- she had begged countless others for help but finally found a safe place. Her puppies were believed to be sold by the person who dumped her after using her to make money. Do you see why we love bully breeds?
Dahlia has a very sensitive nature and just wants to be near her person. She prefers a calm environment. She likes to cuddle and give kisses. And Dahlia loves to eat! She's a smart dog; eager to please. She's practicing basic obedience and leash manners. Dahlia is always looking to her human leader for guidance; we try to remind her every single day how truly wonderful she is -- and we know she will learn even more in a dedicated home. To see this dog smile is a priceless gift.

Dahlia is about 50 pounds; born 2014. Dahlia would do best in a home as the only pet.
She's spayed, current on routine vaccinations, microchipped and heartworm negative. To learn more about Dahlia and her progress in our rehabilitation program, email SacredPawsDogs@gmail.com
Adoption fee $150

animal.description:
Rusty may be getting a little grey in the face but that doesn't slow him down. He will steal your heart if you give him the chance. This older boy is super-sweet and loves to cuddle but still has a very independent side to him. When he prefers some quiet time, he will simply grab one of his toys (which he LOVES) and go lay down on his bed. When he's ready for some more love he will come find you, no matter where you are. 

He does seem to really like "his stuff" so he would prefer a home with older, respectful children. Rusty will roll over for belly rubs any time, any place. Rusty would do best in a home without cats or small dogs. 

Could you be Rusty's snuggle buddy?

animal.description:
PRINCESS WOULD LOVE TO BE IN A FOSTER HOME WHILE SHE IS WAITING TO BE ADOPTED. IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN FOSTERING PRINCESS, PLEASE GO TO THE MAKE A DIFFERENCE RESCUE FACEBOOK PAGE AND SEND A PRIVATE MESSAGE THAT INCLUDES YOUR PHONE NUMBER AND EMAIL ADDRESS.

Princess is the sweetest 8 year old Labrador retriever mix that was chained at an abandoned house until we rescued her. Princess does have epilepsy and requires medications to prevent seizures. She loves being around people. Princess knows her basic commands. She doesn't mind having a bath. Princess does well with playful good natured dogs. She has lived with cats several years ago and did ok. She has not been with cats recently. She is not only beautiful but extremely loving and smart. Our little girl knows how cute she is and will stick her tongue out when she is being silly. She is very people friendly. Princess likes to play ball and cuddle on the couch or be anywhere you want to shower her with hugs and kisses. Her forever home must have a fenced yard so she can safely hang out with her people and sun herself. Children 7 years old or older. Princess is spayed, up to date on her vaccinations, on heartworm preventative as well as house trained. Princess would be a great fit for any couple or family.

All dogs we rescue stay with us until they find their forever homes. We do not do same day adoptions. A home visit is required to ensure our dog is going to a safe environment and our dog gets along with your dog(s) and/or cat(s). We require all our dogs over the age of 1 year attend 1 obedience class (6 week session) outside the home. You must live within 1 hour of Birmingham, MI to adopt one of our dogs. No out of state or outside the U.S. adoptions or fosters. Princess' adoption fee is $275.

animal.description:
Gus is a special, headstrong boy.. happy and a handsome tiger striped brindle mix who has soulful eyes and a lets do it attitude! We consider Gus one of the Love Dogs "HOMIES" because he has some behavior quirks that can be easily misinterpreted... He often tells us how to act around him haha! 

He loves meeting new dog pals and spends most of his time in playgroup with his best dog buddy Savannah or hanging out in the office with his favorite human Michelle. Treadmill, play time, group walks, hikes.. Gus is keen for adventure, he is curious, smart and eager! He also has amazing obedience skills and loves to show them off during our many workshops! If you give the command "go to your mat", Gus pops right over to his mat and lays down until you release him. One of his favorite commands! 

Gus is loyal as loyal as a dog can get and sometimes his strong protection instinct can run into trouble if he's protecting someone or something that doesn't need to be protected.. if you know what i mean. Gus thinks it's his job to keep watch over his human peeps.. once you're in his circle though, you bet he'll stand by your side!  Even though Gus is a Homie, we don't believe he is "un-adoptable". All it takes is understanding and dedication to seeing Gus for who HE is and he can happily live in a home that appreciates his loyalty and respects him.

animal.description:
Looking for a devoted friend?  Finn is the dog for you!  He loves people, going for car rides, and walks.  He is in search of a new home through no fault of his own.  He was returned to rescue when his owners' living situation changed and they were no longer able to keep him. Originally he was surrendered to a shelter because his owner bred beagles and he and the stud beagle got into a fight.   Finn can be dog selective, but has done fine on extended visits with male and female dogs smaller than he is.  He is too interested in cats, so a home without a cat would be best.  He LOVES people and getting attention. Finn likes cuddling too.   He does not need to be crated when you are gone. Finn is willing to follow commands and is eager to please. He was born in October of 2015.  He enjoys getting attention and loves being petted and brushed.  

Finn will be placed as an inside pet with outside privileges to  a secure visibly fenced  yard.  Pyrs do not do well with wireless fencing.  We recommend obedience training for all newly adopted pyrs, to help you create a special bond with you and your new friend, and so you have a well behaved canine.  Great Pyrenees are willing to learn, but are not as eager to comply with commands as much as other breeds.  They are bred to be independent thinkers.

Adopters must be over 25, own their own home and all children in household must be over 6 years old.   If you are interested in fostering or adopting Finn, please complete the appropriate application on our website, www.igpr.org

All of our dogs marked as needing foster homes are also available for adoption. In fostering a dog, the dog comes to you fully vetted. and groomed.  You provide good quality food,  grooming, and we provide the heartworm preventative and medical care, if needed* .(*Based on approval from IGPR.)

We also offer a foster to adopt program.  You foster the dog, and have first right of refusal on them if an approved application is submitted for them. 

Adoption fee is $350

animal.description:
Abbie is a 6 year old Boxer/Great Pyrenees mix that is looking for her forever home. She is super sweet and loving. 

She came in to the rescue after just giving birth to 6 puppies. She wasn't able to feed the litter after just a few days so the puppies had to be taken away and bottle fed. She was such a good mom that it was really hard to see her missing them. It appears that this was one of many litters that this big girl has had in her short life.
 
I'm not sure that she has been abused but I don't think she has been cared for either and suspect that she may have spent a lot of time outside in a kennel. She is now an inside girl and loving every minute of it. She is crate and house trained.

Abbie just graduated from the "New Leash on Life" program where she spent time being trained the basic commands. She did great with all her training except leash and she is a puller at times. She will also sit and shake hands.

She is not good with cats so it's best if she has a home without them. She is not aggressive with other dogs but if they push or get in her face she will fight back.

Adoption Fee $150.00








To adopt this animal or one of his/her orphaned friends, just fill out our online application.

Please note, we do not ship animals for any reason.  All adopters must travel to Marion, North Carolina to pick up their animals.

animal.description:
Athena, about 2 yrs. old and such a pretty Lady!!  about 50# and uptodate on shots, spayed, HW negative and microchipped.

She was Last Call in a shelter that is small, rural and state governed to kill - although they prefer not to, they have to sometimes.

This Lady was owner surrendered due to her high energy.  and not socialized with other dogs and tends to get a little crazy when the dogs start barking!

Athena is doing great - playing with Gena Beana, running and coming when called.  She's high energy and learning to be on leash, but has her moments.  Now, if you are experienced, the excitement is not vicious, just can't contain her excitement and gets a little crazy.  I love her!  So happy!!

 She loves People and Kids, and is so happy to have the attention at adoption day!  I've never been a fan of Dog Parks - she should not go...if you have a fenced in back yard, kids, she's a great dog.  She loves her toys and balls, and the attention from all people and kids!!

For more information:  Julie cell 770-329-4742 - or email for application:  jachambers4806@yahoo.com  

Pet Adoptions:  Sat. 2-6 pm - call ahead for location and attendance.

animal.description:
Canis is 35 pounds of pure love and sweetness! She found us on a cold morning in March 2009 when she was discovered in a cat carrier in our horse tack room. We took her in to the vet where she was checked over and spayed. She tested positive for heartworms AND had a dislocated hip (probably due to being hit by a car.) It's been an interesting few months for Canis having first successfully completed heartworm treatment then had her hip repaired. Dr. Milton in Birmingham performed an FHO (Femoral Head Ostectomy) which is a very sucessful procedure. Canis loves people and does fine with other dogs also. Her tail never stops wagging! We believe she is the perfect candidate for therapy dog training.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~This dog is crate trained, spayed or neutered, up to date on shots and HW negative.  Adoption application, home visit, and $50 adoption fee are required.  Please read our adoption requirements on our home page.  Many of your questions can be answered here. We welcome your phone call, but for a faster response, it is best to email us your specific questions.  After reviewing GSRCA’s adoption process, please fill out the application completely. INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS CANNOT BE PROCESSED!  This is the first step in our adoption process. No adoption will be considered or discussed until the application has been received.

Click here to fill out an application  Thank you for considering a rescued German Shepherd dog!

Galileo is a big fun boy who loves people and other dogs. He is not aggressive or mean in any way but he thinks he is still a puppy and his manners need some more training.
Galileo would love a family who does outdoor activities, he loves the woods and the water. He is easy to train, smart and attentive but he just need your time, structure and love.
Galileo is a really handsome, a big stunning dog that bonds to people well. He loves playing fetch, lived with a small dog and he is strong on the leash but walks very well if you use a harness. We recommend a quiet environment without too many stimulation around him to help him relax and settle.
His ideal person should be an experienced, firm but calm one so he can feel safe, learn the rules and behave at his best.

animal.description:
Brandie von Brakel is a beautiful 3-year-old German Shepherd mix – a special girl who needs a special owner. She's a sleek lady with a striking face and sparkling eyes. Her leash manners are good and, when needed, she listens attentively to corrections. House-trained and intelligent, Brandie already knows her basic commands and is eager to  please. This sweet and playful girl needs a confident, kind and no-nonsense female owner who will set boundaries and who will not provide an overdose of physical affection, which causes Brandie to become overly protective of her owner and aggressive towards outsiders.   She should be the only dog in the family.  Our Miss Agility can jump a 5-foot fence  so a secure environment is important.  Westside’s professional trainer will help to transition Brandie into your home.

Log on to WESTSIDE'S website: www.sheprescue.org. , for the most current adoption information and to see more photos of this dog and all our other wonderful dogs.

animal.description:
PROFILE
NAME: Mayo (Maizey)
GENDER: Female
DOB (Approx): 04/20/2017
BREED: Shar-Pei X

BEHAVIOR
DOGS: Some
CATS: No
KIDS: Over 10
TRAINING: Housebroken
REQUIREMENTS: Fenced yard, dietary restrictions

A BIT ABOUT ME

Our beautiful Mayo, or Maizey as her foster mom likes to call her, has run the gauntlet suffering from terrible allergies.  But everything is finally all sorted out and she is doing very well.

Mayo is currently living with two other similar size dogs but it took a while for her to adapt to them so she will need and experienced owner if she is to live with other pets.  Mayo is also particular about who she gets along with so will need to meet any potential dog siblings in advance.  

Mayo is very very sweet and chill, she loves to curl up and cuddle with her people, and get belly rubs.  She loves to pay, and is a pro at tug of war, but most of all she just wants to be around people and all the action.

Mayo came from a northern community where she roamed free and sometimes old habits are hard to break so she will require a fenced yard to keep her safe.

Mayo has waited a very long time for the right family, we really hope that she finally finds the home she deserves.  

If you are interested in Mayo please fill out an application on our website earthdogterrierrescue.com


ADOTION FEES:
Small breed dogs: $350.00
Puppies (under 6 months): $350.00
All other dogs: $300.00

ADOPTION FEE INCLUDES:
•	Mandatory Spay or Neuter
•	Update to date on shots
•	Microchip
•	Tattoo
•	Rabies
•	Heartworm tested
•	6 weeks of Pet Insurance

animal.description:
Bella is very much a favorite at the shelter!  One look into her gorgeous eyes and you may just melt!

She is a beautiful 10 1/2 year old Shar pei/Labrador mix with a gorgeous tan coat and a winning personality!  This nice girl is very treat motivated, friendly and fun to be with!  Bella is a pleasure to walk and really loves going on pack walks at the shelter with the other dogs!   After a walk, she enjoys relaxing in the water to cool off!   She has tried paddle boarding but will need a few more lessons!!

Bella and her housemate were abandoned at their vet's office by their owners who no longer wanted them.  Her brother has been adopted and now Bella needs the second chance she so deserves.  Once Bella gets to know you, she will be your friend for life.  She is very loyal to the people she loves and trusts.

If you are looking for a new best friend and would like to meet Bella, please download our adoption application and email the completed form to adopt@bobbicares.org.  She is currently at our Freeport location, spayed, microchipped, negative for heart worm, and up to date on all vaccines.  THIS BEAUTIFUL GIRL WILL HAVE 2 YEARS OF FREE VETERINARY CARE ONCE ADOPTED! Kindly keep in mind that our adoptions are local only (Long Island, Queens, Brooklyn, Manhattan).

Tootsie is a fun, sweet and lovable four-year-old, 56-pound, tan and white female terrier-mix looking for a loving guardian. Tootsie rolls over for belly rubs and has a delightful personality. Her tail is always happily wagging. 

Tootsie knows the command "sit" and takes treats gently from your fingers. She is currently being kenneled in Union, Illinois, where she is great with all the other dogs, but not cats! 

Tootsie is also wonderful with people of all ages. She is very sweet, snugly and loving. She prefers cuddling to playing ball and doesn't seem to have an interest in playing fetch. 

Tootsie was found stray in Schaumburg, Illinois, and her teeth are all ground down. Perhaps she was chewing on a chain or rocks? She is crate-trained and appears to be housebroken. To meet and possibly adopt Tootsie, please contact Melia at melia88@comcast.net for an adoption application. Her adoption fee of $200 benefits the rescued dogs of Lucky Dog Rescue. She is extremely healthy, spayed, up-to-date on vaccines, micro-chipped and heartworm-tested.

animal.description:
Daisy suffers from seizures due to a head injury before she was given to us.

She takes phenobarbitol pills 2x a day on a strict schedule as well as potassium bromide.

She takes comfort in fellow dogs and cats and would do best with a dog in the home.

She does not like walks or a leash/collar and is independent, not one for cuddling.

She needs a fenced yard to enjoy and relax and play in.

She has been in foster care since April 2017 and they know her well so we will not be moving her to a home that's less than ideal that would cause her to digress.

WHY IS THIS DOG IN NEED??- This little girl was surrendered into rescue by her owner 

WHERE IS THIS DOG NOW ?- She is fostered in Gorrie 

**ALL ABOUT DAISY **
Requirements;
- another dog in the home .
-Fenced yard
-Adult home due to her level of uncertainty with children. 
-no Small children or visiting small children.
-someone who is exp with seizure disorder. She is on medication that is inexpensive

She is very uncertain at times when she has to be cornered to put on a collar/ leash which she currently has a real fear of. 
Her foster uses a harness to access her as needed with a leash attached.

** ALL ABOUT DAISY **
Daisy is said to be born June 2016 and supposedly a terrier/cavalier king charles.

Daisy is fostered with dogs and cats.

She was surrendered to a foster home, April 2017, at their home business, then we arranged boarding as she needed to be vetted and groomed for the night.

When I met her for the first time in April 2017 she was shy and scared for a few minutes then she was playful and affectionate but not hyper. 

Daisy warmed up to me within minutes of meeting me and even licked my hand.

She was given to last owner 4 months prior in December/January 2018.

She was then found by side of the road 8 weeks later. 
She was seen by a vet and her eye was treated. 
She now has a slight head tilt. 
They feel she was hit by a vehicle.

She is cratetrained/housetrained, and was living with three other dogs, and used to kids, and didn't bother owners geese.

On intake she met chickens unexpectedly, and ran from them.

She has a sweet demeanor but the place she was boarded at after being given up by her owner said she was nervous at first as well. (Understandably)
and she has shown to be very uncertain of children.
For that reason we are looking for a spot with no kids as we don't want her stressed.

Once arriving in to rescue and after her vetting April 2017 she started having seizures in our care.

She has been checked and is now treated with inexpensive medicatios that she gets daily with success. 

She loves to be with other dogs and follows her foster mom around - if you are home more often than not and have a nicely mannered fellow dog it's possible that Daisy could be a great addition to your home.

She doesn't like walks and she doesn't like car rides - She is a home body.

Foster adds (April 2020)

"Personality - She suffers from seizures due to traumatic  brain injury. She has her own routine and she doesn't like change. When nervous she will pace. 
Daisy is not a lap dog. 
She will come when she wants to be petted or for attention. 

She doesn't bark. 

She would not be good for apartment as she needs a secure fenced back yard.

People/ Strangers & Kids: Daisy is shy around new people. She doesn't interact very much.


Interaction with Packmates- dogs/ cats -She is fine with dogs and cats she doesn't bother cats and is fine with respectful dogs, She doesn't play very offen. She pretty much does her own thing.

Energy level-  very low energy 

House : she is great in house. She will go to door to go out and pace in circles when she needs to go to bathroom .  She will have an accident if you are not near by to let her out.

Crating: she is crated when we are not home and is great in the crate. She gets treats in her crate when we go out.

Food: she is free fed and no aggression to food.  She eats grain free. 

Toys: she once in awhile plays with toys but not overly interested. 

Likes: she loves going outside and laying in the sun in warm weather. 

Dislikes: loud noises and other dogs barking. She doesn't like going for walks as traffic noise spooks her and strangers walking and kids.

Leash respect & training/ Commands: she doesn't like collars and leashes.  She will pace when she sees one and needs to be confined in a small area in order to place one on.

Yard rules: she needs a full fenced in yard must be secured. She can not be tied out and no under ground fencing.

Grooming: she doesn't like to be brushed. Not a fan of baths.

Traveling : she is fine in vehicle will just lay down and sleep. No car sickness.

Current Routine : she gets up and let out of crate when I get home from work.  She then will come in and lay down. She is given her meds for seizures. Then she will go on couch and sleep..she gets up and goes out to bathroom then comes in and lays down.

Daisy needs a home she feels safe in a quiet home with another dog. 
She needs someone that is home more than not. She would not be good at a trailer or cottage. 
She sometimes gets up and is confused a bit. 
She needs a home where she isn't forced to do things as she will stress and pace. 
She needs someone familiar with seizures and giving medication on schedule. 
Daisy has suffered many seizures till we got meds regulated. 
She will go months with out a seizure but may suffer several at a time once they start.
She is over all a very sweet girl that just needs the right family where she can be herself."

Her adoption fee-  $500

WE DO NOT ADOPT OUT OF ONTARIO
*******************************************************

*** HOW IT WORKS - ADOPTION INFORMATION **** 
Please read ** ALL** the information provided below on the process to 
save time and facilitate the process in a smooth manner.

Applications 
http://www.adoptapet.lucknow.on.ca/applications.html--This is a MS Word copy of our application.
It can be completed, saved and emailed back to the rescue at 
petrescue@hurontel.on.ca . 

1. We require a fully filled app to be considered as a possible home
2. Only the approved app will be premitted a viewing with the pet ** in the foster home **
3. ALL family members MUST meet the dog ** in the foser home** .
4. Any exsisting pets MUST attend the meet/ greet with the dog ** at the foster home ** .
5. A home visit must be completed as part of the adoption process after the inital viewing by a rescue representative.
This is not a replacement of the meet/ greet at the Foster home.
6. We do not adopt outside of ONTARIO . 
7. We do not deliver dogs. If and once the adoption process is approved and complete the dog must be picked up at the
foster home 
If you have any difficulties with the various application options please let us know @ petrescue@hurontel.on.ca
***************************************************

animal.description:
Update:
Cheyenne has been in our care for two years. She can be selective with certain dogs
Cheyenne would most likely do best in a home with male dogs. 
In August of 2018, Cheyenne was diagnosed with Addison’s disease and requires daily prednisone and monthly injections of Percortin. 

Cheyenne came to us after being hit by a car, she had FHO surgery to repair her dislocated hip and has now undergone heartworm treatment.  Please consider giving this wonderful girl a forever home!  


Prior to discussing our dogs we will need you to complete the Preliminary Adoption Application on our homepage at www.henryhumane.com.  This application does not commit you to an adoption. It is used to screen those interested to make sure the home is a good match for the animal. If your application is approved, one of our volunteers will contact you via phone or email.
As with all our other pets please have an excellent verifiable vet history if you wish to be considered to adopt. Adoption Fee:  $250.00  All of our dogs have been given age-appropriate vaccinations, are spayed/neutered, dewormed, had capstar and/or frontline applied, heartworm tested and treated if necessary, and microchipped with registration pre paid.

animal.description:
Gemini is doing amazingly well in her foster home after having a rough start in life. She is incredibly smart; knowing many commands including sit, stay, drop it, leave it, take it, shake, turn, go, come, touch, kennel, fetch and several others. Her foster says that Gemini actually thinks things through and figures out what needs to be done without being told. Due to having been tortured and neglected by men in the past, she has every right to be slow to trust them. She is still learning to enjoy the company of other animals. Gemini weighs 50 lbs so any dog in the home would need to be at least her size in order for there to be a possibility that she would get along with them. Gemini loves to run and would be a great running partner. The perfect home for this bundle of love, entertainment, and personality would be with a single woman who is an experienced dog owner and has no other pets in the home. Gemini is a charming young lady who will be a devoted companion to her lucky adopter. Gemini is kennel trained, is never destructive when roaming freely in the home, and is completely housebroken. She will need a fenced yard so she can get her energy out until her little heart's content. We prefer that Gemini's adopter live in the Omaha area so that she can work with our trainer at our expense, if anything should ever arise. Gemini's ideal adopter would be a dog experienced female, willing to continue to work with her on her fear issues. In return for these things, Gemini would provide protection, loyalty, companionship and would be one of the smartest , most eager to please dogs you have ever met. 

The suggested adoption donation for Gemini is $200, which is tax deductible an goes toward the high cost of vetting our rescue dogs. Gemini is healthy and fully vetted. All she needs is a Second Chance!

animal.description:
**NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE** ... We are so busy with rescuing and caring for animals and can't return everyone's inquiry. If you are interested in adopting this pet...You must fill out the adoption application at:
http://www.marlcares.org/adopt_app-dog.php  (cut and paste into your browser) 
PLEASE READ all the following info. We do not reply to inquiries asking if the dog is still available, if it is listed here, then it is still available.

**Local.Adoption Only**  We got this girl from the Bartlett Animal Shelter...they had taken her out of a neglectful situation.  We think she was approx 4 yrs old at time of rescue...April 2017 is approx 90 lbs
 She is house trained and kennel trained.  She is in a foster home with other dogs all sizes and is fine with them but she does not want to play with them.  She is an alpha and can be bossy with other dogs and really would prefer to have an owner all to herself to give her all the attention.  She would probably prefer to have a home without other dogs but is fine with a home with other dogs as long as they don't expect her to play with them or cuddle with them.  She will correct them verbally if they get on her hips or rough house around her.  Zena does have severe arthritis in her hips and is on daily meds and supplements to help her and will need to be on them the rest of her life.  She needs someone who can be gentle, understanding and careful with her because her arthritis is painful.  She is very well behaved but does have a diva, all about me, wants attention all the time, personality....she is very calm and laid back.  She loves to nap on the couch.  We would prefer an owner with rottweiler or large dog experience.  She needs an owner that will keep her on meds to help manage her arthritis and be willing to give her the attention she wants so badly from an owner.  She wants to be someone's BFF.  She knows to "sit".  She loves to go for rides and always wants to leave with her foster mom for car rides.  She loves meeting new people.  A rottie lover would love this girl...she is a typical rottie diva.  She will sit in front of you and give you a paw if you don't give her attention quick enough.  Due to her advanced arthritis we will not place her in a home with young children.  Zena's favorite place to hang out is on the couch...so if you don't want a dog on the couch...this is not the dog for you.

Adoption fee is $150 and includes ... spayed/neutered, microchipped, current vaccinations, heartworm negative, and kennel trained.

ADOPTION APPLICATION: If you are interested in this pet you must fill out the Adoption Application…which you can find on this site or you can copy and paste this link … http://www.marlcares.org/adopt_app-dog.php
This does not obligate you in any way. If this does not work for you then you can email us at midsouthpets@aol.com for one.

PLEASE READ about our ADOPTION PROCESS AND REQUIREMENTS provided on this site before contacting us.  You can find it quickly by clicking on our NAME or MORE ABOUT US in the column to the right of this pet’s description.  All your questions can be answered by reading the following info provided below.  Our pets are fostered in the Memphis Area, a tri-state area, TN/AR/MS.  Most are fostered in Red Banks, MS.  

We do not allow meetings with any of our dogs until we have your Adoption Application.  Adopting a new family member should involve a well-thought out and deliberate process. This is not an impulse purchase. Please understand that we do not want these animals to be homeless again. We try to complete the process as quickly as possible and appreciate all the applications and will consider each and every one we receive. 

Filling out the Adoption Application does not obligate you in any way, but simply tells us a little bit about you and whether you and this pet would be a good fit for each other.  We will call you after we receive your application and answer all your questions and talk to you about this pet.  After being approved, we will set up a time to bring the pet to meet you and your family and pets or set up a time for you to meet the pet at the foster home.

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.  Rescue is a full time job every day.  Please know because we are so very busy with the dogs along with processing applications, updating webpage’s, rescuing, in many vet appointments, caring for seniors and hospice dogs, etc, etc that we are not able to return phone calls or emails asking if this dog is still adoptable, how much is it to adopt, is it house trained etc…We have included all the info we have on this dog at this current time and update the bio as we learn more about them.  We kennel train all the dogs and will indicate if there are housebreaking issues that we have discovered.  We update our site regularly so if the dog is listed here they are in fact adoptable, but may have applications coming in on them, so if you are interested, you need to get your application in now.

**WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE ANY ADOPTION**  Our first concern is the happiness and welfare of the animal.  We respect our potential adoptors and appreciate your interest in adopting one of our pets.  We care about you too and that you are getting the right fit for your home and lifestyle.  By following our process, together we can make sure you are getting the right pet.**

NOTE: We prefer to adopt in the Mid-South AREA, usually no more than 1-2 hours away in driving distance. It is up to the foster home, how far they are willing to drive. We rarely adopt long distance, but will consider each and every application. 
 
MidSouth Animal Rescue League is an all breed, 501c3, non-profit organization that prefer to rescue senior dogs and special cases.  WE LOVE ROTTWEILERS...With 20 years of experience with our beloved ROTTWEILER breed, and little help for this breed in our area, we try to focus on rescuing them and try not to ever have to turn any away that need us…especially the seniors that end up in shelters.  Currently, we have several senior rottweilers in our hospice foster program.  We always need more fosters so that we never have to say NO to them or other seniors.  

We have also started a community relief effort specifically in the Red Banks, MS area not far from us, called The Dog House Project, where we go door to door providing dog houses to dogs on chains and other dogs and cats without proper shelter, including straw in cold temps, as well as food and other supplies as needed.   We offer free spay/neuter services to those animals and continue to check on them all year.  To date many have been spayed and neutered and some have been surrendered from their neglected lives on chains.  We are making a difference and need your donations to continue this program.  We always need igloo type dog houses.  

MidSouth Animal Rescue League relies on the kindness, generosity, and financial support of people like you so that we can continue to rescue and care for dogs like this one. We are a group of dedicated volunteers who respond to animals in need in shelters, strays, and from individuals. We receive no federal or state funds and are supported solely by private donations. 

Many of the animals we save are in need of special medical care or surgery to bring them back to health before they can be placed. Veterinary care, vaccinations, tests, x-rays, medications, spay and neutering, heartworm prevention, flea/tick prevention, worming, food, kennels, grooming, and other supplies are provided for each dog while in our care.

animal.description:
Copeland is a special case that is going to take a really special someone to be his happily ever after. At present, he is working on some behavioral modification in the hopes of rehabilitating him enough that he can be placed in a home successfully. However, please read his story below and feel free to email us at bark@pawtropolis.com if you’d like more details on his situation and how you can help with his rehabilitation. Copeland will not be adopted into a home with children because he tends to bite when scared. Additionally, he is not a candidate for Apartment or Condominium living as he is quite vocal when left alone and would be very stressed if he had to interact regularly with people and dogs who were not in his immediate family. 

Copeland was originally brought into Helping Paws Rescue in February 2017. He was an owner surrender to Barrow County Animal Control and not much is known about his past life before arriving. At the shelter, he was fearful and they reported that he was distrustful of men, so when we came to evaluate him, we were skeptical if he would be able to be handled. He showed fearful, tense, and what appeared to be submissive body language with us, but allowed us to handle him and pick him up without incident. Like so many dogs at the shelter, he was in fact completely shutdown, so we decided that we would give him a chance to flourish with us.

Since then, he has bounced through several foster homes and has had increasingly aggressive reactions to both other dogs in the home and strangers. He lived full-time at our Westside facility for a few years where the staff worked diligently with him on learning trust and also on how to read his body language when he’s uncomfortable so that he isn’t put in situations that he feels the need to bite. He currently lives full time in a foster home where his foster mom is working with him. He is a current patient of the UGA Veterinary Teaching Hospital Behavior Medicine program where they have diagnosed him with a generalized anxiety disorder that manifests in fear aggression. Like people that suffer from the same disorder, he lacks the coping mechanisms to deal with situations he perceives as stressful and so he has learned that the only way he can control the situation is to bite. His behavioral modification exercises will hopefully build a foundation for him to learn those coping mechanisms. If successful in his rehabilitation, UGA has offered to continue consulting with his new family so that they can continue to receive professional feedback on his transition into a new home.

When you get around Copeland’s troubled emotions, you get to see a very sweet, intelligent, and downright silly personality. He loves to play with toys and will happily toss them to himself. He loves going for car rides and walks. He enjoys being with the people that he trusts, leaning against them and napping nearby. He also loves to learn new things. He has all his basic manners down cold including sit, down, wait, walking nicely on a leash, and potty training. He has been clicker trained as well, and he loves to work for his food and treats with that. We are committed to giving Copeland his best chance at happiness. We are limiting his visitors to only serious applicants who can provide him with safety and stability that he needs and would love to hear from someone that might be willing to work with him and bring them into their home.

Thanks for your interest in this pet. For more information about our adoption procedure please visit www.pawtropolis.com. We rarely do out of state adoptions. You'll find more about long-distance adoptions on our adoption procedure page of the website above. WE DO NOT SHIP. 

Adoption fee is $250. This includes spay/neuter, rabies, bordetella, dhpp, micro-chipping, id tag, training materials, toy, a week's worth of food and moderate to advanced training.

Frankie's approximate date of birth is 10/18/16.  She has been spayed and fully vetted.
 Frankie and her brother, Flint,  were found as strays when they were only about 8 weeks old. These Chow/ Shepherd Mix are very sweet dogs but can be a bit timid. They walk great on a leash and you can walk them both easily together, they also enjoy swimming and boat rides and play very well together. It may take some time for them to warm up to you but once they do they will be very loving and loyal companions. We believe they will act very different once inside of their forever homes. With love and care, these two will be shining bright in no time. 
Frankie and her brother, Flint are extremely bonded and reliant on one another.  They will only be adopted out together, but there is a special adoption fee in place for anyone who meets all adoption requirements, and is willing to adopt the pair.

animal.description:
*Please read entire bio before inquiring about this family member*

Say “Hi” to Hendrix!  Hendrix is a 10 year old Pomeranian/Chihuahua mix that Milwaukee Pets Alive rescued from Milwaukee Animal Control (MADACC).  Red/tan in color, Hendrix resembles a little fox and is cute as a button.  Besides being adorable, all those that meet this happy little guy who is always “smiling” describe him as the sweetest, friendliest, most phenomenal little soul you will ever meet.

When someone says “Hendrix”, “loyal” and “affectionate” are what comes to mind.  Hendrix’s first love in life is people.  Where the humans are is where Hendrix will be and as a lap dog, if you are sitting somewhere where he can access your lap, he will be on it.  His foster family and all that know Hendrix constantly comment on the fact that they have never known a dog that truly craves being held and snuggled all the time like Hendrix does - his joy in life is being with his people.  Hendrix is looking for the people that will be as devoted to him as he will be to them.  The people who will commit and love him forever, as a beloved member of the family, as a best friend, and as a companion.  As attention from humans is what he craves most in life, Hendrix is looking for a forever mom and/or dad with plenty of time to give to Hendrix for love, attention, affection, and exercise (Hendrix lives for walks!  Read below) and want to share time with this incredible little guy.  Everyone has to work, but if you are always gone and on the go outside of work, Hendrix would not be the companion for you.  Hendrix wants someone who wants to hang out with him!

Besides loving people, Hendrix LOVES his walks!  Many people think little dogs only want to walk to the end of the block and back – not this little dog!  Hendrix looks forward to his walks SO much.  He gets so excited when he knows he’s going out for a walk.  Sometimes he gets so excited that he runs in circles around the first floor of his foster home in anticipation.  He goes for walks every single day.  Hendrix adores taking in all the smells outdoors, nose to the ground, sniffing the trail of all those dogs that have walked the same path before him – a little bloodhound in a tiny dog’s body!  Also, Hendrix is not a dog who shakes, shivers, and is afraid to step paw outside when the temperature drops below 50 degrees.  Hendrix loves to walk year round – warm and cold out (it must be the Pomeranian undercoat keeping him warm).  If you are drawn to little dogs because you don’t think you’ll need to walk them, Hendrix is not the companion for you.  He is looking for a forever family that wants to get out there and exercise with him on a structured walk every day in all 4 seasons (not running around a fenced in back yard - that's that mentally fulfilling to any dog - they want to go on a walk with their person).

And Purebites freeze-dried chicken treats.  He's a wild-man for these!  Next to people, these are his second favorite thing in the world - so stock up!
  
Hendrix’s favorite toys include a couple of different Kongs that he likes to chase and chew (and bark at as he runs after them).  Ball toys/little tennis balls are fun to chase after as well, though he still has not fully grasped the concept of completing the process of fetch, which is charming in its own right.

Hendrix has a small dog that he lives with and that he naps with occasionally, but his first choice and preference is to cuddle with humans.  The presence of the other dog in the home seems to give Hendrix some anxiety and we can tell Hendrix would prefer to be the only animal in the home so he can have all the attention to himself - he loves people that much.  Hendrix does get along fine with other well-behaved dogs so if you encounter other canines while out on your walks, he'll be just fine - he would just prefer not to live with one.

Having guests over?  Hendrix will give them a warm welcome to your home and will take over a guest’s lap and remain there for an hour or so if possible.  Hendrix is a “people-dog” if there ever was one.  He really demands to be the center of attention and when you meet Hendrix, you’ll understand why he rightfully deserves to be.

Besides making your guests feel welcome, he may just provide them with some entertainment as well!  Hendrix sometimes will bark or “yip” along to music when played in the foster home or when his people are singing along.  America’s next “Canine Idol” in the making!

When Hendrix is not snuggling a human at every opportunity, enjoying the scents of the outdoors on a walk, or playing with toys, Hendrix can be found lounging with his favorite blanket anywhere the sunlight comes in through the windows.

Change is so hard on animals.  Hendrix loves his routine and is looking for a forever family with a stable home environment where his person or persons are established in their life and residence.

Hendrix does not like travel.  Hendrix has extreme car anxiety - even for short distances.  Hendrix needs a forever family that tends to stay close to home, and, if they do occasionally travel, has family, friends, etc. that can stay with him or they secure a pet sitter so he can stay in the comfort of his territory - his home.

Because of his small size and delicate frame and legs, we are looking for an adult-only home for Hendrix.  The ideal family for Hendrix is one with someone or someones who aren't going to have children or whose kids are grown and out of the home.  Hendrix craves attention and wants to be someone's baby (and not have to compete with their human "babies" for their attention).

Hendrix has a few insecurities and anxieties as all small dogs do, but you will feel confident helping him feel his most confident as you go to training together as we require of all of our new dog adopters.  Hendrix will bark upon his humans leaving the home though will quiet down soon after they leave.  He also will bark when excited (like when someone comes to the door!).  As such, he would be best in a house, not an apartment/condo.

On a routine wellness exam, Hendrix was found to have a heart murmur.  Milwaukee Pets Alive provides comprehensive care to every animal in our program and we looked into the matter further with a veterinary cardiologist and in October 2018 Hendrix was diagnosed with degenerative valve disease (or endocardiosis), a heart condition common in smaller breed dogs as they age.  The condition is always progressive, but how it progresses can vary from dog to dog and there is no way to know how it will progress.  Some dogs live a long life without ever developing any problems associated with endocardiosis.  Others will experience complications over time.  Research has shown that a medication called Vetmedin can delay complications so being an organization that provides our animals with anything and everything they need to live their best lives, we of course started the drug with Hendrix and he takes it easily twice a day.  At Hendrix's 1-year cardiology follow-up and repeat echocardiogram in October 2019, we were pleased to hear that Hendrix's heart condition had remained stable since he was diagnosed a year prior.  However at his most recent cardiology check up in December 2020, his disease did show progression, revealing left atrial enlargement and a ventricular arrhythmia.  We started Hendrix on an additional medication, benazepril, which decreases the resistance against which the heart has to pump.  He takes this med also twice a day and with ease.  

We expect a continuum of care to that which our organization provides and Hendrix's adoptive family will need to continue the comprehensive veterinary care he receives in our rescue (and have the financial means to do so) by monitoring his heart health with his veterinary cardiologist as part of his care (now every 6 months for an echocardiogram, ECG, and blood pressure) and provide whatever care necessary as directed by his cardiologist as his heart condition progresses including continuing his Vetmedin and benazapril medication regimen and any other medications, diagnostics, or treatments deemed necessary in the future.  

Hendrix is a happy, energetic dog who you wouldn't know has a heart condition by looking at him and is deserving of love regardless of the fact.  While Hendrix did not start out with a special need/consideration (and developed one since being with us), MPA serves a primarily special needs population of animals and we always like to point out, every human has an issue they are dealing with (no one is perfect), and we all want to receive love.  Our animal companions are no different, and are the most perfect beings on earth, special need/consideration or not.  To us, Hendrix (and his heart) is perfect - he loves everyone and there isn't a being, or heart, more perfect than that.  He will love someone(s) unconditionally and deserves the same along with a commitment to the care he needs. 

A devoted friend, Hendrix will always be by your side and is waiting for that special mom and/or dad to make the same commitment to him forever.

Companion animals are family.  They are not “less than”, “below”, “beneath,” or any different from human family members.  They are one and the same to us and we seek those adopters who share the same philosophy and feel the same way about these, the most amazing beings we are so privileged to share our lives with.  If you live in the Milwaukee Metro Area, and if you have what Hendrix is looking for in his forever home and will promise to love him always (and know you’re lucky to have the opportunity to do so), send us a message telling us about yourself and detailing what you can provide our family member, Hendrix! (inquiries that don't include this will not be considered).  Hendrix’s adoption fee is $175 and, like all MPA adoptables, he is neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Hendrix is waiting to cuddle with you!

animal.description:
Coco arrived at Horse Creek from the animal shelter on March 8, 2017.  
He is extremely friendly!  He enjoys playing with toys and other dogs in our exercise areas.  He loves receiving affection from people, as well as the occasional dog treat.
Coco is full-grown and weighs 37 pounds.  We believe he may be a Kelpie mix. 
He will make a great companion to a loving and caring family. Who wouldn’t want to make Coco’s life complete and be his devoted family?

All of our dogs are spayed or neutered and are current on all vaccinations. They are on monthly heartworm and flea/tick prevention. All of their medical needs are taken care of before they are available for adoption. Our adoption fee is only $100.00. Please complete an application, if you have found a dog you are interested in adopting. You can find our application at www.horsecreekwildlife.org/applic.html. Once completed, you can forward it to adoptions@horsecreekwildlife.org or fax it to 731-926-3000. Kim Austin, our adoption facilitator, will be in contact with you as soon as she has an opportunity to review your application. Understand that she has other duties and she will not ignore any interest shown in adopting one of our dogs. An application will need to be approved before a scheduled time to visit our dogs will be set up.  It may take up to 48 hours before she returns your call or responds to your email, due to work schedules, holidays and adoption events. We do the very best we can for the dogs we have rescued and do not take the adoption process lightly. Please be patient and understand that we will place our rescued dogs in the very best homes possible and reserve the right to refuse applications.

animal.description:
Hyatt was rescued from a Missouri puppy mill where he spent the first ten years of his life. It was a life of unimaginable misery and heart ache for him. He has come quite a ways in his progress at HUA. He loves his good nutritious food that has helped him gain a tad more weight that he probably should have - but how could we say no to anything his sweet little heart desires? He likes running around with his dog friends at recess and cuddling in piles of soft blankets. These things may sound small, but they are things he was sadly deprived of for ten years. He is still a little bit shy but every day he is getting more and more brave. He is starting to approach his favorite caretakers for pats on the head, which is a major milestone for our dear Hyatt. We know he loves life at HUA, and he would not even believe his good fortune if he were to know life in a home for his final years...the life he always should have had, one nearly robbed entirely by the rotten puppy mill that imprisoned him for a decade.

To learn more about this dog and to complete an online adoption application, please visit our website at www.hua.org.

animal.description:
Oriole is a very special dog. She came to us from a puppy mill in Missouri that finally shut down due to lack of funds. For many years, HUA has taken dogs from this mill who either had no human interaction or violent human interaction. Oriole was practically feral when she arrived at the shelter. She was terrified beyond belief. We were not sure she would ever be able to forgive the human race for the monstrosities she had endured. To our shock and amazement, this beautiful girl has decided that she is going to make up for lost time. She lives freely in our hallways and laundry room and is allowed to come and go as she pleases. Because of this, Oriole has realized that we are not going to put boundaries on her happiness. She ADORES the other dogs and plays all day long. She is learning how totally fabulous soft beds and squeaky toys can be. She takes care of the new pups that come in quaking with fear and shows them the super hiding places on the shelves of freshly laundered blankets. Oriole is nosey and always wants to know what we are up to, but she still shies away from our touch. She dares us to play chase and try to catch her, but she does not yet want to snuggle. She may never be a cuddly, clingy dog, but she will always be worthy of our admiration and respect. Oriole will be a wonderful companion for another dog who may be feeling lonely or bored, as she knows the heartache of being alone. She is brave, she is stoic, she is a survivor, and we love her.

To learn more about this dog and to complete an online adoption application, please visit our website at www.hua.org.
animal.name: Oriole

animal.description:
Want a BFF? I'm your girl!
I ama young, silly, affectionate girl who has been living in a kennel for far too long. While I doneed some time to warm up to new people, once you are myfriend I will be your buddy for life. I ama favorite among staff, students and volunteers alike!I just need that one person who will take the time to get to know me for the lovely girl I am. I don't like to be alone for long periods of time, I love to stick close by my humans. I love playing ball!

General Socialization Notes: 

 I stickclose by my humans, and I don't like to be left alone for long periods.I would be a great companion for someone who works from home, or is retired.I am a strong girl but our students and volunteers have worked hard to teach me some manners. Now, I walklovely on leash! I sometimes bark at other dogs or humans when out walking, but I ameasily redirected with simple cues.

Does Scarlett like other pets?

I'd do best in a home without other dogs and nocats.

Does Scarlett like children?

 While I have played nicely with appropriate children, I can become overly excited.Because I sometimesforgetwhat a big girl I am, a home with no children would be best for me.

Favorite toys?

 I love to chase a ball (sometimes I'll even bring it back to you!)or chew on a squeaky toy. Kongs and other durable bones are great, too.

Ideal Forever Home: 

 I'm a total sweetheartwho wants to find someone who will love me as much as I love them. My perfect family will be patient with me as I adjust to life in a home. I'd do best in a house, not an apartmentand I'd love a fenced back yard to play in.I'd love someone who can be with me a lot and who will continue my training to help me be confident and well mannered as I learn to trust that they are mine forever.

animal.description:
Elton is a very sweet young fellow that is looking for a new forever family that will be able to have lots of fun with him and  continue to teach him his basic training skills.  He's very sweet and well behaved. He likes to play and does well with the other dogs at his foster home.  Elton is crate trained and housebroken.  He is a large strong dog that will need to have a strong person to handle him.
A home with a visible fence is required.





Like us on Facebook! Click here!
 
 
     
  Additional info on our home page.
To learn more about our adoption process, please CLICK HERE 
Home FurEver is a non-profit foster based dog rescue seeking foster parents, volunteers and donations. Please see our website for more information.
 
Please note that Home FurEver does not post applications on line. We will receive all applications in person at local adoption events in order to conduct an in-person interview.  All members of the household should be present for the application and interview process. All applicants require a home inspection and vet check - Please note that we cannot drive more than an hour to do a home inspection.  We do require a fenced back yard for all bully breeds.  Some dogs may require households with children over a certain age.

Ask yourself some questions before you consider bringing a new dog home.   1.  Am I ready for a LIFE LONG commitment?  2. Am I prepared for a rowdy puppy?  3. Am I prepared to potty train?   4. Is this the right breed for me or my family?  5. Can I afford the food and vet care for this dog?  6. Is it best to have a totally fenced yard?  7. Will I make a commitment to obedience training?

animal.description:
Gigi is a very expressive and affectionate dog who gives it her all every day and sleeps soundly at night.
 
This girl is approximately 55 pounds  and an impressive athletic ninja. She would make a great hiking and running partner. If she could ride a bike we would put her in a triathlon. :)
She also loves to cuddle, play fetch with toys and her downward dog would put yoga instructors to shame. She greets every morning with a perfect downward dog & a Namaste.

With all her Zen like personalities, she is an alpha so if you have other dogs in the house know that she likes to be the alpha and although she enjoys the dog park she might be better in a home with no other dog. 

She does not like cats, so please no cats for this girl.  Again, for all those who didn't read it the 1st time... NO CATS!!  

She loves her people and being active. 
If you would like to meet Gigi#2 please fill out an application and we can set up a meet and greet.
