animal.description:
**NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE** ... We are so busy with rescuing and caring for animals and can't return everyone's inquiry. If you are interested in adopting this pet...You must fill out the adoption application at:
http://www.marlcares.org/adopt_app-dog.php (cut and paste into your browser)
PLEASE READ all the following info. We do not reply to inquiries asking if the dog is still available, if it is listed here, then it is still available.

This sweet girl had us at hello.  Possum is a very sweet, very friendly, loves all other dogs cutie that was picked up as a stray.  Possum is deaf but that doesn't stop her from giving you her unconditional love and attention. She is so smart, eager to learn, and happy and smiling all the time. Possum is approx 8 months old as of March 2017 and weighs 40 lbs. Possum is currently looking for a foster home or forever home that will be patient and willing to work with her deafness.  When we rescued her we did not even realize she was deaf at first...she was so happy, affectionate and eager to please us we didn't notice at first.  Possum is kennel trained.  She loves toys and loves to play with other dogs.  She will be happiest with an owner that will give her the attention she needs and wants.  She is fine with a home with or without other dogs.  In a perfect world we would love to find someone who has experience with deaf dogs that can teach her sign language.  We can't be certain what her breed mixture is but we feel like australian shepherd is a good guess, but she could be a mix of many breeds.  This sweet girl needs you to make her life complete.

Adoption fee is $150 and includes ... spayed/neutered, microchipped, current vaccinations, heartworm negative, and kennel trained.

ADOPTION APPLICATION: If you are interested in this pet you must fill out the Adoption Application…which you can find on this site or you can copy and paste this link … http://www.marlcares.org/adopt_app-dog.php
This does not obligate you in any way. If this does not work for you then you can email us at midsouthpets@aol.com for one.

PLEASE READ about our ADOPTION PROCESS AND REQUIREMENTS provided on this site before contacting us.  You can find it quickly by clicking on our NAME or MORE ABOUT US in the column to the right of this pet’s description.  All your questions can be answered by reading the following info provided below.  Our pets are fostered in the Memphis Area, a tri-state area, TN/AR/MS.  Most are fostered in Red Banks, MS.  

We do not allow meetings with any of our dogs until we have your Adoption Application.  Adopting a new family member should involve a well-thought out and deliberate process. This is not an impulse purchase. Please understand that we do not want these animals to be homeless again. We try to complete the process as quickly as possible and appreciate all the applications and will consider each and every one we receive. 

Filling out the Adoption Application does not obligate you in any way, but simply tells us a little bit about you and whether you and this pet would be a good fit for each other.  We will call you after we receive your application and answer all your questions and talk to you about this pet.  After being approved, we will set up a time to bring the pet to meet you and your family and pets or set up a time for you to meet the pet at the foster home.

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.  Rescue is a full time job every day.  Please know because we are so very busy with the dogs along with processing applications, updating webpage’s, rescuing, in many vet appointments, caring for seniors and hospice dogs, etc, etc that we are not able to return phone calls or emails asking if this dog is still adoptable, how much is it to adopt, is it house trained etc…We have included all the info we have on this dog at this current time and update the bio as we learn more about them.  We kennel train all the dogs and will indicate if there are housebreaking issues that we have discovered.  We update our site regularly so if the dog is listed here they are in fact adoptable, but may have applications coming in on them, so if you are interested, you need to get your application in now.

**WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE ANY ADOPTION**  Our first concern is the happiness and welfare of the animal.  We respect our potential adoptors and appreciate your interest in adopting one of our pets.  We care about you too and that you are getting the right fit for your home and lifestyle.  By following our process, together we can make sure you are getting the right pet.**

NOTE: We prefer to adopt in the Mid-South AREA, usually no more than 1-2 hours away in driving distance. It is up to the foster home, how far they are willing to drive. We rarely adopt long distance, but will consider each and every application. 
 
MidSouth Animal Rescue League is an all breed, 501c3, non-profit organization that prefer to rescue senior dogs and special cases.  WE LOVE ROTTWEILERS...With 20 years of experience with our beloved ROTTWEILER breed, and little help for this breed in our area, we try to focus on rescuing them and try not to ever have to turn any away that need us…especially the seniors that end up in shelters.  Currently, we have several senior rottweilers in our hospice foster program.  We always need more fosters so that we never have to say NO to them or other seniors.  

We have also started a community relief effort specifically in the Red Banks, MS area not far from us, called The Dog House Project, where we go door to door providing dog houses to dogs on chains and other dogs and cats without proper shelter, including straw in cold temps, as well as food and other supplies as needed.   We offer free spay/neuter services to those animals and continue to check on them all year.  To date many have been spayed and neutered and some have been surrendered from their neglected lives on chains.  We are making a difference and need your donations to continue this program.  We always need igloo type dog houses.  

MidSouth Animal Rescue League relies on the kindness, generosity, and financial support of people like you so that we can continue to rescue and care for dogs like this one. We are a group of dedicated volunteers who respond to animals in need in shelters, strays, and from individuals. We receive no federal or state funds and are supported solely by private donations. 

Many of the animals we save are in need of special medical care or surgery to bring them back to health before they can be placed. Veterinary care, vaccinations, tests, x-rays, medications, spay and neutering, heartworm prevention, flea/tick prevention, worming, food, kennels, grooming, and other supplies are provided for each dog while in our care.

animal.description:
**NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE** ... We are so busy with rescuing and caring for animals and can't return everyone's inquiry. If you are interested in adopting this pet...You must fill out the adoption application at:
http://www.marlcares.org/adopt_app-dog.php (cut and paste into your browser)
PLEASE READ all the following info. We do not reply to inquiries asking if the dog is still available, if it is listed here, then it is still available.

We are not sure what breed mixture Snowball is...we feel like he is probably terrier...maybe even has some Jack Russel terrier in him considering his personality and behavior.  We met Snowball while out knocking on doors offering dog houses to dogs on chains and in need.  We always took Snowball straw and food and he was always tangled up on his short chain, but we never found anyone home when we would go by to check on him.  He was always so adorable and so happy to see us and it broke our hearts to see him on that chain.  Well...persistence and patience paid off...because we finally caught Snowball's owner at home and he surrendered Snowball to us...Snowball is a sweet boy who is approx 2 yrs old as of March 2017 and weighs 26 lbs. 
 Snowball is such a happy little guy and is always smiling.  He needs someone to give him the attention he hasn't had and someone to be patient with him and show him how great life can be off a chain.  Based on how he behaved when we first brought him in, he appeared to have been in a house at some point in his past.  He is full of affection, but needs someone to show him all the manners he has missed out on someone teaching him.  He likes to sit next to you and follow you.  You should see him run all over the yard now that he is off a chain...he runs and chases bees and is smiling the whole time.  He is kennel trained.  He is good with the other dogs of all sizes in his foster home, but he does try to be the bossy one.  Sometimes he gets confused and isn't sure about coming back inside the house, as if he has been punished for getting near the door, so he needs someone that will be patient with him and work with this.  He doesn't always do this, but when he does, the foster mom has to go outside and sit at the patio table and wait for him to come over and then pick him up and take him inside.  This is easily corrected if someone will just be patient and reward him for coming inside.  Snowball is so crazy about toys and loves loves loves to have them and play with them and as of yet has never torn one up.  He had a horrible infection in his neck from the collar being so tight...but is fine now.   Little Snowball is off his chain and will never be on one again. Together we are making a difference.  Please consider fostering or adopting this sweet boy...so he can have the happy ever after he deserves.  

Adoption fee is $150 and includes ... spayed/neutered, microchipped, current vaccinations, heartworm negative, and kennel trained.

animal.description:
She smiles when she is with you

HER STORY

 Kaily gave birth to 8 puppies on November 17, 2015; 4 girls & 4 boys. All have been adopted.  Kaily appears to be a true Labrador Retriever but mixed with something. Kaily had no microchip and I guess she ran away for a better life.
 
 Kaily ate through her rope and tie-down from her home and ended up at one of my feeding stations very pregnant. She gave birth to 9 puppies almost 1 week later. Very smart girl, I guess Kaily decided she would not give birth while tied up. 
 
 She had on a huge black collar and chain that she broke to escape her previous home. That awful collar has been removed for a more stylist one.
 
 As soon as she had her babies, I climbed the fence and found her 2 day old babies laying filth, dirt, trash, it was not very nice and they were covered already with fleas. This may have been Kaily's first litter, she tried to hide them from the elements but she didn't do a very good job, they were completely exposed to the wind and rain. 1 little puppy didn't make it. But the other 8 looked good. 

 Kaily ended up being very happy to be rescued, loaded up and taken to a clean, safe home where she could receive love & attention. 

 Kaily is 2.5 years old and currently weighs 68 lbs but she could stand to lose a few pounds. I’m sure with regular walks she would probably lose 10 pounds easily. Kaily has a great personalities, she is very quiet, friendly and gets along with all humans and dogs. Actually her entire litter of puppies were all very quiet, quiet when they played, ate, wrestled, they were just a very calm, chill bunch. 
 
 Kaily does not get upset, nor is she destructive. She will sleep in her crate but she is fine just sleeping on her doggy bed, she is not destructive. She will play with toys but she would rather have some ear scratches and love from her human and cuddle besides you. She is not a shadow dog, very independent but she keeps an eye on you to make sure you are still there. Her solemn look turns into a smile while she is following you around and she is just close to you, all she wants s to share her love. Kaily is a great, very calm, well behaved young lady and will make a great family pet.

 
 Kaily is a Labrador Retriever mix with a bronzy brown coat with black going doing the middle. Now that she knows she is safe and not chained up, she is the perfect little lady. She requires very little maintenance and just wants to be loved. She has 1 male playmate that she is fond of but she is in a home with a variety of foster brothers and sisters. She gets along with small and big dogs, her first roommate upon arriving here was a 4 pound Maltese and he made sure she knew who was boss!!
 
 Kaily has a mild demeanor; not aggressive in any area and likes to get out for walks but not demanding of them. Nor does her behavior require that she be walked on a daily basis.  Kaily's coat looks a lot better now than when she was first rescued.  Please consider giving Kaily her chance at a forever home.

  PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE FOR MORE PICTURES: roxysk9rescue.org   

  ADOPTION FEE & APPLICATION REQUIRED   

  Roxy's K-9 Rescue does not have a shelter, all of our foster dogs are raised in private homes; .       Each dog comes spay/neutered (fixed), up to date on vaccinations       and rabies shots appropriate for their age, and dewormed twice. They are microchipped, heartworm tested and proof of the results of the heartworm test are included with their medical records; also on monthly flea/tick and heartworm preventative.        ALL OF THIS IS INCLUDED IN THE ADOPTION FEE.   

  Medical records will come with each dog at the time of adoption.   

  Our organization is run by volunteers/foster parents, please be patient to give us time to respond to your emails and/or phone calls. We will reply to you. Thank you.   





  

 ADOPTION FEE & APPLICATION REQUIRED

  

 Roxy's K-9 Rescue does not have a shelter, all of our dogs are raised in foster homes. Each dog comes spay/neutered (fixed), rabies shots appropriate for their age, and dewormed twice. The dogs are up to date on vaccinations according to their age at the time of adoption. They are microchipped, heartworm tested and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm preventative. ALL OF THIS IS INCLUDED IN THE ADOPTION FEE.

 Medical records will come with each dog at the time of adoption.

 Our organization is run by volunteers/foster parents, please be patient to give us time to respond to your emails and/or phone calls. We will reply to you. Thank you.

animal.description:
Huggy is a delightful girl.  She loves to put her front legs around your waist and HUG you tight, which is where she got her name.    Huggy is working on her socialization skills as we don't believe she was taught much by her previous people.  She is extremely intelligent, and loves nothing more than to cuddle and be by your side.  Huggy is about 4 years old.

If you need a cuddle buddy, Huggy is your girl.  She is spayed, current on vaccinations and ready for her forever home.  We will provide time with a trainer to her new owner to help her be as successful in her future home as possible, and to continue to help her with socialization.  She just needs a patient and loving hooman to help her grow.

Huggy's adoption fee is $150.  She is spayed and current on vaccinations.  Contact Lori at 405-620-2411 to set a time to meet this very special girl.

animal.description:
Hi, my name is Wren and I am an adorable Heinz 57 boy. I have been at The Haven ACS a while because, well, I have a phobia of leashes!  Please don't let this keep you from falling in love with me and giving me a forever home! I just need that perfect someone who is definitely out there for me who will help me overcome my fear!  I will even bark at you to come in and visit me. I am a one-of-a kind, kind of guy!

If you are not able to adopt me, please consider virtually adopting me or coming to spend time with me on the weekends!

Please visit havenacs.org for our visitation hours, information about the adoption process and to fill out an application!

animal.description: Delilah is a 3 year old female rottie who had a rough start in life. She was adopted from the shelter but once she showed trust issues with people her owner decided not to walk her at all and she spent two years inside the home rarely going out and using wee wee pads. She became overweight and under socialized even more. Delilah was sent to one of our trainers and has done so well with her progress. She is good with dogs and cats now and is good with people with the right introduction. She loves long walks in the neighborhood and now is much slimmer and looking healthy. She rolls on her back for belly rubs, plays with the other dogs and just loves being outside now. We desperately need a foster or adopter for Delilah by March 25th otherwise she will have to go into boarding. Please contact us directly at hudsonrotties@gmail.com if you can foster or adopt Delilah. She is currently in Suffolk County, NY.

animal.description:
Bella is a people person. She loves to play or just cuddle. She is a little slow on walks and would just like to smell the flowers. 

Noah's Arks Rescue is all about giving an Abused Animal a second chance at life and to experience what true love is. We take animals that have been tortured, abused, and neglected and supply the emergency medical care required to get them well. We then provide rehab physically and mentally to prepare them for their new home and new life. We are located in Ridgeland, SC., and are by appointment only. All of our dogs are at our Rehabilitation Center either in hospice care or being loved on by staff until we find them forever homes. Please call 843.540.6755 or email NoahsArksRescues@mac.com with any questions. If you are interested, please fill out our Adoption Application at https://www.noahs-arks.net/nar-application. We do adopt out of state and will arrange transports. Our dogs are not allowed to fly cargo at any time.

animal.description:
Well hello there my name is Bella.  I am a "mature woman" but I totally act like a teenager.  Hey at my age I get to be bat crazy if I so choose!  My sidekick and bestie is Gidgit she's "mature" too LOL  We are a pair and 2nd Chance said we have no worries we will not be separated and if that means we stay with our foster mommy & daddy furever they are OK with that :)
We have a fenced yard and fur buddies to play with so life is good!   
We've had some crazy times in our 16 years.  Our first 9 we lived with a hoarder.  Now I can tell you that was NOT fun!  We were kept in stacked cages and there wasn't much room and it was FILTHY and when someone pottied above us well you can guess what happened :(   Then the police came and got all of us and that was awesome!  They took us to the shelter and while other dogs seemed scared to be there we were pretty excited because we got nice soft, clean beds and yummy food and they gave us this warm thing called a bath and WOW we smelled really "pretty"!  Gidgit and I were adopted by an older couple and although they were nice they didn't fix are wobbly knees so we have some "issues" with them but we've learned to adjust and we are too old for surgery now.
The couple started having health problems and they brought us back to the shelter :(  Lucky for us the awesome Rescue lady at the shelter scooped us up and called 2nd Chance who didn't care how old we were and now we are living with pups and having a great time!  Tomorrow we are having a dental.  I'm not sure what that means but our foster mommy says our breath smells "stinky poo"  I don't think that is a good smell cause when she says it her face gets all weird and wrinkly!
Well I'm going to get ready for bed since I have a big day tomorrow.  Wish us luck!
animal.name: Bella McKenzie

The adoption fee for dogs is as follows:
*Purebred dogs under 7 years of age: $200
*Mixed Breed dogs under 7 years of age: $125
*Dogs 7 years or older- any breed: $100
*Puppies- 6 months or younger: $150
The adoption fee includes:
*Spaying/Neutering,
*Age-Appropriate Vaccinations (must be at least 4 months old before they can receive a Rabies Vaccination),
*Current on Dewormings,
*Heartworm Testing (all dogs who are adopted out are Negative for Heartworms. If any dog in our care is Heartworm Positive, they undergo the treatment until the vet clears them for adoption.) All dogs in our care are kept on monthly Heartworm Preventative.
*Microchip (which will be registered to the new adopter!)
*30 Days of Free Pet Insurance

animal.description:
See more pictures of Brody on his Facebook album!

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?vanity=forgottendogsrescue&set=a.3732881646730605

Well, hello Bo! Bo (previously Brody) is back with the rescue through no fault of his own after being adopted in 2017. His family has gone through some changes since originally adopting him and have come to the difficult decision that a different home would be best for him. Everyone say “hi and welcome back” to Bo! 

Bo is about 4 years old (estimated born around September 2016) and weighs about 65 pounds. Bo is a happy, handsome, energetic and cuddly Pit Bull/Lab mix. He LOVES to play. Tug? You bet. Fetch? Yep. He also loves to give kisses and is an expert cuddler. If Bo had a list of his favorite things to do, we are not sure which of these would be at the top so his new family should be ready for tug, fetch, snuggles AND kisses. 

Bo would likely do best as an only dog. He has some dog friends but, is fairly selective about them and, if there is another dog in the home the dogs would need a very slow introduction to one another. He has a couple dog friends that he loves but, hasn’t lived in a home with another dog since adopted. 

Bo has been working with a professional trainer for the last six months and knows basic cues such as sit, down, spin and stay. Unfortunately, Bo was allowed off leash and hit by a car in October of 2019, and from that experience developed leash reactivity to stuff outside the house including things with wheels. We can’t really blame him for that! Through positive reinforcement training, he has learned how to stay calm and pay attention to his trainer when he is out and about. The progress he has made has been amazing and he will need continued work with positive training methods to maintain the work that has been done to help him regain his confidence. He is treat motivated and eager to learn! 

Bo loves going for hikes and swimming and does just fine in the car. He also loves his yard and, given his reactivity outside the house, will need a home with a yard so he can get his zoomies out and play his favorite games. Did we mention tug and fetch? Yep, those. 

Bo has some nervousness around visitors to his home and we are reintroducing him to crate training so he has someplace comfortable and safe to be if the energy in the home is making him nervous. All in all, Bo has a few quirks given his history that his adoptive family will need to understand and be willing to continue the work that has been helping him be the best boy. He is worth it and will pay his family back in love, snuggles and kisses. 

If you are interested in adding Bo to your family, please visit our website and submit an application or email us at: forgottendogsrescue@gmail.com. His adoption fee is $350 and he is neutered, up to date on vaccines and microchipped. And, so handsome.

animal.description:
DRAKE:    Purebred Pitbull  Approx 8 years old....60 lbs 

The BEST way to describe in Drake in one word is:  COUCH POTATO



 

 He would be a great companion dog for the right person, but unfortunately he's not socialized around kids, or cats! 

He's a mellow fellow and just likes to take naps most of the day.  He's quiet,  well behaved and non-destructive among his good qualities. 

 His favorite thing is to go for WALKS,  but dog parks are unacceptable for this guy.  Sorry!  But he will be Mans  best friend and provide you with the kind of un-dying loyalty, dedication, and constant companionship most people are looking for in a dog if he is given the chance......

He is a mix of being dog tolerant but also dog reactive..... he did have a female companion in his "previous" life but very sadly he was in a shelter for a VERY long time and now he has lost some of his "social" skills

We are thinking the ideal home would be a ONE DOG ONLY  home  to be on the safe side and absolutely NO CATS!  We know this limits his options but we want to set him up for success, not set him up to fail!   

We believe there IS a RIGHT home for most every dog, but sometimes we have to wait patiently for it to come along...... in the mean time he is SAFE with us!

animal.description:
Harley is so ready to nd his forever family! At six years old, Harley has grown up at Satchel's and has become a volunteer favorite. Harley is incredibly smart and loves having a job and learning new skills. He completed 6 weeks of agility training and loved the high energy exercise. He looks forward to attending his weekly doggie playgroup sessions at a local dog training studio, having so much fun that he pretty much passes out for the night when he returns to the shelter. Harley is sweet and aectionate, adores car rides and meeting new people. He enjoys exploring the outdoors, especially fenced-in back yards so he can chase lizards and bugs. He would do best in an adult, dog savvy household with no other pets or perhaps a large submissive female dog!
In order for Harley to continue enjoying his doggie playgroup sessions after adoption, LEADSRQ, is sponsoring Harley with a $300 training package at K9 Korral. Thank you LEADSRQ!
For an appointment to meet Harley, please email adoptions@satchelslastresort.org or call 941-924-5070

animal.description: Cute right? This adorable guy is Sensei and he is finally ready to start the search for a forever home. Ironically enough, Sensei actually needs a sensei or in another words...a teacher. We aren't sure he has a lick of training but we know an experienced and calm owner could do wonders with him. He has mellowed a lot in the last few weeks, a far cry from the emaciated wild child that showed up from the animal shelter. Honestly, he was tough to handle and all over the place at first but he has settled in and become a willing student. We aren't sure if he has any doggie social skills yet but we do know he has some reactivity on leash (common in our breed) so he will need a little work in order to go for walks in the neighborhood. He won't be the right addition for a lot of people but for the right home, Sensei could be an amazing companion. Affectionate, smart and perfect for people who love to be active...absolutely full of potential.

animal.description: Marty is an endearing but STRONG Dobie boy who came to us from an upstate shelter. Fortunately, he's apparently very dog-social, as he let himself out of a crate and a fenced area in order to run with other dogs having that privilege. He is currently bunking with another male Dobie, who seems slightly overwhelmed by Marty's energy level. He did come directly to us when called, so he would likely be a good candidate for dog parks and dog beaches, and this would help to expend some of his energy. An adult home or at least one with teenage kids would be best, at least until Marty has enough training not to overwhelm smaller fry. He appears to know basic commands like "sit" and "come." His animal shelter aged him at 5 years, but to our experienced eye he appears to be more like 3. When impounded at his shelter he had several wounds, one of which required shaving and suturing, on his forehead. We don't expect this to be permanently scarred, though it may always be noticeable.

FRANKIE
DOB: 09/04/2013*

This is Frankie.
He is looking for his forever home. What a beauty boy. One blue eye, one brown. High energy. Alpha male. Gets along with other properly introduced dogs. Neutered, current on vaccinations, crate trained, house broken, knows some basic obedience, good on a leash. Super fun boy! Loves his toys and will usually bring them to you to play. NO CATS! If you are interested in adopting Frankie, please send an email to PawPrintzRescue@gmail.com and request an application. 

All of our animals are up to date on their vaccinations, spayed/neutered, microchipped, and have had a physical exam. At adoption we provide; veterinary records and vaccine certificates, castration certificate, lifetime lost animal support, leash, collar, ID tag, and a familiar toy or blanket to help them settle in. We also keep in contact and try to help with any issues that may need to be additional support.

Adoption Requirements: Application, Interview, Home Check 
Adoption Fee: $200.00

This dog is located near Fresno, Ca

*Age is always a guess with rescue dogs but here at Paw Printz we believe everyone should have a birth day so when the vet guesses at their age, we work out what would be a good birthday for each dog and make it so!

animal.description:
Meet Wally! 

If we made a yearbook of all of our shelter dog’s we are certain Wally would be voted “Class Clown”! When we first met Wally he found himself surrendered to a local animal shelter at a very young age. No one understood him for who he truly is a lively adventure dog. You can say that with people he lacked the correct manners but with his four-legged friends he was the prime example of a fantastic canine.

Wally quickly picked up the training we started with him and is always up for learning new things. As much as he depends on us to take care of him, we actually rely on him to assist us when teaching our other dogs how to correctly interact with their fellow dogs. Wally has had a lot of work building trust in people since a long time ago he was badly treated by the humans that were suppose to care for him. He now is a rising star here and we can’t wait to see him in his new home!

If you are in need of an adventure dog or know of someone that is please fill out an application or share Wally with them today!


Contact the Adoptions team at (914) 273-1674 or adoptions@adoptadog,org for more information!

The first step to adopting one of our dogs is to fill out our online adoptions questionnaire located here: https://forms.gle/5heEH8S6c7zXBneD7

animal.description:
Requirement: Secure, fenced yard, no apartments, children 12 and older.  Chatham and Chatham Kent adoption applications only will be considered

Milo is a very active 6 yr old maltese mix (DOB approx. 2014) who loves to be outside exploring.  He has keen sense of hearing because he will bark at new sounds and is very curious to see what’s going on.  While he gets along with most dogs, he would be happiest to be the only apple of someone’s eye.  He loves attention.

He was originally surrendered because his former owner did not have the time to take care of him and wanted him to have a better life.  He was left alone all day and crated at night, that’s not the life for any adorable little guy like Milo.  He is a snuggler at bedtime.  Milo loves his toys, stuffed, squeaky or balls…..he is ready to play!  

Milo is looking for an active adopter to be his walking companion to explore new scents on his walks.  He is great in a car, he is good little passenger.

He gets very excited at mealtime and will let you know he’s hungry!
We are looking for an adopter who has a  very secure fenced yard, works from home (not just during covid), or semi retired and is very active and wants a four legged companion to enjoy daily walks, car rides or just hanging out together.

Adoption fee: $400

animal.description:
Linus came to the SPCA after he was found as a stray. He was adopted from our rescue but then given away by his owners. His new family recently abandoned him at our local animal shelter. Linus has been moved around from home to home and we are looking to find him his final home. He is a Black Mouth Cur/ Labrador Mix with an estimated birth date of 10/16/16. Sadly, Linus's body shows a story that most won’t want to hear. We hope to find him a forever home where he will be loved. He is GREAT around everyone and does not mind cats. He would LOVE to have a yard where he can spend his time running and playing during the day. He prefers to be outside when the weather is nice. He would do best in a home that is willing to work on basic training with him. Linus has been neutered, micro-chipped, and is up-to-date on vaccinations. 

If you are interested in adopting Linus please fill out an adoption application at www.spcaeasttx.com under the "adopt a dog" tab!

animal.description:
Thank you for your inquiry. Rongo has an adopter but we have to wait for them to go pick him up after the stay at home is lifted.  Once he is picked up we will remove his profile. Please do not write to us for an application. Sorry for any inconvenience.


Meet Ringo, a 2- 3 year old, 7-pound bundle of love. He is as sweet as he looks.  He gets along well with the other dogs in his foster home but would love to be an only dog. He is house-trained, uses the doggie door and sleeps in his crate. He sleeps great all night and eats everything you give him, no fussy eater here. He is just a great dog that could be placed in a home with kids or other dogs.  

He loves to be with his people and hang out with you whenever he can. He is a little shy at first and may need some time to adjust but once he is comfortable and lets his hair down he is super confident.  Ringo has a mild activity level and loves to play and chase the other dogs in his foster home.  

He does need some help with basic commands but he is a smart little guy and should pick up the basics quickly. He aims to please. This cuddly boy would be a great addition to a family or individual looking for an affectionate little dog to join their family. Ringo wouldn’t do well left alone for a full work day and would like to have a canine companion if his parents are gone that long. He would do fine with no other dog as long as someone was around doing the day.

Ringo’s adoption fee is $275.00 and he is being fostered in Vallejo, CA

All our dogs are in private foster homes and arrangements to meet our dogs occur after an application has been received.

If you would like to know more about this sweet boy or receive an application to adopt, please contact us at Dogzonerescue@yahoo.com
animal.name: Ringo

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

My name is Lola and I would love to snuggle with you. I was rescued from the Bandera County Pound, along with my brother and sister. I love to play with toys and other dogs. I even love my foster mom's two cats. It takes me a little while to warm up to new people. It's tough when you get dumped on the streets at six weeks of age. The nice people who brought me to the pound found us in a box on the side of the road. I am sure glad they stopped and picked us up or we would have died. Will you take me home and keep me forever? Adoption fee $150 includes spay/neuter, current shots, and confirmation that the dog is heartworm negative. A Doggie 4 You is a non-profit organization. We are one of the only rescues that accept dogs that are injured or in need of medical treatment. Our standard adoption fee is $150, or $300 for a purebred or highly adoptable dog. All monies go towards the care and placement of the dogs. We use the higher adoption fees on the highly adoptable dogs to help offset the medical and surgical costs on the less desirable dogs. To donate, please go to: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=RHPQWH7DV2S9W If you are interested in becoming a foster, please email us at adoggie4you@yahoo.com

animal.description: Welcome Charlie. Charlie is a 5 year old Shepherd mix. He weighs about 60 pounds. He was in a home and was a fun hiking companion for his adopter. She got a new male companion and Charlie didn’t like him. She felt she had no choice but to return Charlie. Charlie is wary of men. He is naturally drawn to women and his best home would be a quiet one so this would be without children or older children. One with a fenced yard and he can be an only dog or with other dogs. He does love other low energy dogs. He needs a family that has a soft touch in his handling. He responds to kind, soft words and gentle touches. He is fully potty trained, good on a leash and ready for his next best adventure. He is intelligent, very loyal and due to his breed, a natural protective boy. He is an adorable guy and will make some lucky family a great companion. He is up on his shots, neutered and ready for his forever home. His adoption fee is $185 and transport is $185. Contact Lytle Animal Care and Control at 830-709-3832 for an application.

animal.description:
We have been placing this breed since 1991!  All these dogs pictured here have been placed and this ad is just for attention only so folks click the currently adoptable dog's photo and read first before emailing or messaging though this site.  I am sorry but we do not adopt photos so reading first helps.  

Please don't fill in adoption any forms anywhere else, but on OUR website.  Thanks for that.  We do not adopt from Petfinder messaging so going to our main website helps the adoption process gets started.

To start our adoption process, please fill out our form on our web site at: www.spokanewienerdogs.org and see the Adopt a Dog/Fee page with more details on how we adopt our dogs. There are a lot of questions answered on our web site and personality details below about each dog BELOW so please READ BEFORE getting in touch. We already answer 500+ emails a day.  We do answer questions on dogs once our adoption paperwork is filled in so we can match to the right homes.    

Please indicate which dog you are interested in on our adoption form once you read the dog's bios here:  www.drnw.petfinder.com.  If their name says pending home then they are not available and are on a test drive with a new family.  We do remove our dogs when our adoptions are final so please do not ask us if dogs are available if you see their ads.

We have our adoptable dogs on this site as well as www.spokanewienerdogs.org as well as our requirements and our adoption form to fill in to start our adoption process.  Thanks for reading first BEFORE emailing us.  We do have time to speak to folks AFTER they have started our adoption process by visiting our To Adopt page first.

Folks can visit the dogs AFTER our adoption form is filled in if they are adopting one from us.  Thanks.

animal.description:
Guess who had a nickname of "crazy Daisy"?  Me!  When I arrived at AGPR, I was young and enthusiastic and full of fun.  In my book, "crazy" was a term of endearment and I loved it.  I will admit that I have aged a bit and have left some of my "crazy" ways behind me.  But I'm still very energetic!

I'm hoping to find a wonderful family who don't have any other pets - I want to be the center of your universe!  I'd suggest that I don't have any young children as companions until I learn a few more manners.

I am a very confident dog and I know better than my humans.  I will make sure that I keep you safe on walks.  A life in the city or a neighborhood with houses close together is not the best environment for me, especially if there are lots of dog walkers in the neighborhood.  I'd love a big yard with lots of room to run and play with my people.

All Great Pyrenees require a fenced-in yard (at least four foot high). If you have questions about the breed or our adoption policies and procedures, please go to our website at www.agprescue.org. There's plenty of good information about the breed on our website - Pyrs aren't a breed for everyone! 

Our adoption application is online: http://agprescue.org/adoption-application/agpr-application-donations/

Please note that we are a small regional rescue organization. We will consider adopting to families within a four to five hour drive to Richmond, VA

animal.description:
Please read first: We are located in LOS ANGELES, CA, we DO NOT adopt outside of the Southern California area (as we require physical home checks), nor will we ship dogs to other parts of the country, please do not ask.

Looking for a Foster or Forever Home

Kibbles, a 20lb, 6yr old terrier mix, was pulled from the the Shelter on his "last day."

This boy is very devoted to his 'person'.  He is cautious around new people, but with a trusted person he flourishes! Also, once he gets to know you, he is sweet and lovable. He is such a happy boy - ready to give as many kisses and cuddles as you can handle! He's curious and loves to explore, bringing you all sorts of toys to play with him. He even watches TV!

He is very smart and could learn new tricks quickly and easily. Kibbles has a best friend that we would like him to be adopted with. His girlfriend's name is Cha Cha and she is a very sweet, loving German Pinscher (please see her bio). This couple absolutely loves each other, they love playing together or just hanging out with each other. They have not left each others' side since they met!!

Kibbles and Cha Cha are looking for a forever home or foster. Please contact us if you are interested in giving this couple and give both of them their second chance!

Due to COVID, we have suspended adoption events however, we do do meet-and-greets.

We are located in LOS ANGELES, CA,  we DO NOT adopt outside of the Southern California area (as we require physical homechecks), nor will we ship dogs to other parts of the country, please do not ask.

 NOW on Instagram! @tailsofthecityrescue

animal.description:
PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT THE RESCUE THROUGH PETFINDER, VISIT PITCREW.ORG AND COMPLETE ADOPTION APPLICATION.

*All of our rescue dogs are spayed/neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations and microchipped*

Overbred and thrown out Bulldog mix Babs, our poor, innocent demodex girl Blondie and last but certainly not least Short-Stack, who's time was up but as it turns out, has multiple medical issues himself. 

Teddy and Babs get along like two peas in a pod, even when they're trying to one-up each other in the manners department! Babs' back is a little hunched from years of being kept on a chain so her "sit" looks like more of a "lounge", but it definitely counts, and she's working for that treat! We almost can't handle the cuteness!

Babs likes to play tug of war with any of the dogs that will play too, OR she will steal your shoes and socks off your feet and make her own game. ?? Babs has her foster mom laughing CONSTANTLY. She is such a happy girl! We love everything about her and we can't wait to find her the perfect, loving home. ?

animal.description:
Faith is a beautiful, healthy 5-year old female Lab/Pit Bull mix. She was rescued from the streets.

Faith is super sweet, just wants to please. Very outgoing & friendly, she is very high energy. She needs an active owner and/or family. She knows how to sit & shake. She loves to ride in the car, loads right up. 

She would probably be good with older kids, but not small ones. She is good with other dogs as long as they are easygoing & laidback. No cats, her prey drive is too strong.

Faith will also need a secure 6ft stockade fence. 

Faith is house and crate trained, but will need assistance with leash training. We recommend an Easy Walker type of leash due to her strength. 

For more information email her foster mom Sherrie: sherrie53@cox.net

animal.description:
VOLUNTEERS & FOSTERS ALWAYS NEEDED!!  

Do you love GSPs? Do you like to have fun?  Then you should come on board with our awesome volunteer group!!

We always have a need for volunteers and a lot of what we do can be done from the comfort of your own home!

We also do events throughout the year which are super fun and gets you out & about meeting fellow GSP/dog lovers!

As well as we are always in need of foster homes.  We supply everything and pay all expenses, all you need is your home and love :) 

Please email us gsprescuenj@hotmail.com if you would like to learn more about volunteering!
